fields.description:
Walmart e-commerce is a fast paced, dynamic, high-tech division of Walmart. Our Inventory Accounting team is searching for a talented Senior Accountant to support the month end close process and monthly accounting and analysis activities. This includes but is not limited to: analyzing and determining the accuracy of the data as it flows through the various systems (such as SAP, OMS, WMS) and reporting tools (Essbase) integral to the inventory and cost accounting. Additional responsibilities include: posting journal entries, performing Balance Sheet reconciliations; performing ad hoc analysis to identify and resolve key issues with significant financial impacts. Senior Accountant must possess significant business acumen to understand business initiatives and their respective impact to inventory accounting and controls. Success factors for this role include being resourceful and comfortable with change, having a global mindset and exhibiting professional curiosity. This position will report to the Manager of Inventory Accounting and Controls.

•Provide COGS and inventory related reporting and variance analysis for distribution to key stakeholders by pulling and analyzing historical and current data and preparing report for timely delivery to leadership.
•Contribute to the preparation of all inventory related information for financial statements (P&Ls, Balance Sheets, KPIs, ROI) and any other reports as required by management.
•Work with Manager to enhance inventory processes, including reconciliations, buying allowance benefits, proof of delivery charges, replacement POs and inventory exits. Conduct research on these inventory adjustments to ensure accurate statement of COGS.
•Prepares the division balance sheet by compiling reconciliations and explanations from business partners; reviewing reconciliations to identify variances; analyzing variances; and presenting the Balance Sheet to leadership.
•Assist in the development of effective and efficient processes for areas such as shrink, obsolete and excess inventory and lower-of-cost-or market (LCM) valuation to minimize the risk of losses to the organization. Analyze monthly and quarterly financial impact, book corresponding journal entries and prepare account reconciliations.
•Develop and maintain standardized desk procedures and documentation for all areas of responsibility, including SOX narratives and key controls.
•Represent the Inventory Accounting and Controls perspective in new projects and initiatives. Provide technical and compliance guidance on business issues, such as inventory ownership flow, exits and reverse logistics etc.
•Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities.
•Works with business partners to evaluate, document, and improve systems, operations and accounting flows for all inventory-related processes.
•Supports the execution of multiple projects for inventory/cost accounting by identifying Customer and operational needs; developing and communicating business plans and priorities; identifying barriers and obstacles that impact performance; measuring progress and adjusting performance accordingly; and demonstrating adaptability and supporting continuous learning.
fields.title: Senior Accountant - Inventory Accounting
fields.skills:
• Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting required
• 2-5 years of relevant inventory/cost accounting experience (Fortune 500 preferred)
• Good working knowledge of Excel, Access, SAP and Essbase
• Inventory and cost accounting experience
• Must understand and be able to apply basic accounting concepts and US GAAP principles
• MBA/CPA preferred

fields.description:
Senior Financial Analyst (0216U) #16227

UC Berkeley - Main Campus

The Campus Budget Office (CBO) reports to the Berkeley Office of the Chief Financial Officer and supports the University’s mission by promoting an environment of financial integrity, enabling optimal use of Berkeley’s $2+ billion operating budget, and facilitating informed decision-making.  Specifically, the CBO: 

• Leads efforts to enhance budgeting, forecasting, and multi-year financial planning across campus 

• Provides financial planning and decision-support analysis for campus leadership on a range of strategic and financial issues 

• Oversees the campus annual budget process and establishes the consolidated budget plan. 

• Works with campus constituents to improve the quality of financial management information and analytical capacity across Berkeley 

The CBO is organized into three integrated teams of experts.  The Special Projects team works with campus leadership and Divisions on a range of strategic and financial issues, providing analytical capacity on high impact projects.  The Operations team administers campus resources and is charged with moving Berkeley’s systems, policies, and business processes towards automation, accuracy, speed, and rationalized incentives.  The Financial Planning and Analysis  Outreach team directs the campus annual budget process, and is focused on forging strong, collaborative and proactive client partnerships with the campus Divisions. 

  

Reporting to the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis Outreach, the Senior Financial Analyst will play a material role in the on-going transformation of the Campus Budget Office (CBO) into a consultative enterprise focused on forging strong, collaborative and proactive client partnerships within the portfolio of her/his assigned campus divisions.  The Senior Financial Analyst will be seen as an essential resource whose input is sought to guide decisions and make recommendations to optimize spend against a $2 billon operating budget.  She/he can be expected to be engaged in a wide range of projects including those related to completion of assessments to identify opportunities to optimize reporting inputs and outputs; the on-going development and implementation financial planning best practices; the development of knowledge management systems for her/his client base; strategic financial planning and assessment; change management and training and; financial infrastructure optimization. 

The Senior Financial Analyst will provide insight within a comprehensive framework inclusive of technology, policy and strategy.  She/he will have complete responsibility of her/his projects, from scoping to delivery and will serve as a critical point of intersection between the project office, central policy and her/his client (s).  This is an outward-facing position where frequent interaction with internal clients is essential and expected.  While activities will vary, approximately 60% of the Senior Financial Analyst’s time will be allocated to direct client interaction.  Of her/his remaining time, 30% will be spent guiding initiatives from the pilot stage to campus-wide implementation and 10% will be allocated general administration tasks. 

Collaboration will be essential.  The Senior Financial Analyst will need to cultivate partnerships within the Office of the Controller and the broader CBO organization.  At a Division-level, the Senior Financial Analyst will work across multiple functions and at multiple levels up to Dean or Vice Chancellor.  She/he will also coordinate activities with Technology and Project Management to assure her/his work is seamlessly aligned and in concert with other on-going projects.

Responsibilities:

-Works with Executive Director, Budget, workgroups, and senior Budget Office staff to perform highly complex financial analysis projects for both internal department and external campus constituents with minimal supervision. 

-Applies advanced professional concepts to perform complex technical analysis to understand past performance and determine present and future performance and/or resource allocations. 

-Responsible for providing analytical support for highly complex budget, financial, and resource projects dealing directly with campus and divisional finance leadership:  Meet with Dean regularly to review financial performance of Division.  Provide analytical support to Divisional Dean and CFO in evaluating budget requests, new program proposals, and other ad hoc analyses.  Monitor budget-to-actuals quarterly and  year-end results   Review all-funds budget submissions to ensure maximizing use of resources; Actively review restricted gift and endowment funds to ensure “first dollar principal” 

-Guides the work output of less-experienced analysts. 

-Drawing on expert judgment and advanced technical tools and techniques, initiates, designs and delivers analytical studies, decision content and supporting materials for campus or divisional finance leaders for financial and/or resource plans that have a significant impact on individual or multiple divisions. 

-Serves as expert consultant/advisor to divisions for strategic financial planning and assessment, including resource allocation and revenue enhancement approaches, trended future requirements, developing internal budget and forecasting processes, and optimization of the financial infrastructure (chart of accounts, business processes, etc.) that have a significant impact on campuswide business processes.. 

Influences stakeholders, providing partnership and support to bring consensus to the University’s financial management mission.  Provides strategic financial assessment and planning for the university.  Researches and/or clarifies standards and compliance expectations and ensures divisions are trained accordingly. 

-Supports campuswide communities of practice that facilitate the collaborative development of cross-divisional financial planning and analysis “best practices”. 

-Develops strategies for implementation of key financial performance metrics and uses the information to identify trends, drive change and assess performance. Contributes to implementation of feedback mechanisms for key stakeholders and clients to influence the continuous improvement of financial analysis services and processes.

Qualifications:

-5-8 years of consultatively-oriented financial planning and analysis experience.  Experience in higher education is a plus but is not required. 

-Exposure to multiple businesses or experience working across a complex, multi-division environment. 

-A passion for Higher Education or work within a role blending business with a mission-driven orientation. 

-Proven track-record of achieving trusted business partner status across multiple stakeholders. 

-Strong data skills; able to navigate through, extract insights from and manipulate large data sets; able to fit details into a broad business strategy or mission. 

-Proven competence with budget and forecasting processes and development. 

-Demonstrated expertise developing decision-focused presentations and leading groups to consensus within a designated timeframe. 

-Proven ability to communicate, verbally and in writing, complex findings and recommendations to technical and non-technical audiences. 

-Exceptional judgment to pull consensus from conflict. 

-An approach to problem-solving that seeks to address root issue versus symptoms. 

-Keen ability to maintain sharp focus amidst competing priorities; the acumen to effectively manage time, teams and projects to deliver commitments on time. 

-Proven attention to details/accuracy; an unwavering sense of integrity and pride in their work. 

-Highly adaptable work-style; proven skills to “think-on-their-feet” and move fluidly between tasks and changing priorities in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment. 

-Advanced user of Excel; proficiency with other MS Office tools. 

-Proven capacity to confidently “fill in the blanks” when few facts are available. 

-Highly collaborative; able to demonstrate skills managing across teams, functions and business areas. 

-Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business or related field from an accredited institution.  An MBA is preferred but not required. 

-CPA, MA or CFA is preferred but is not required. 

-Ability to perform complex financial analyses; strong problem solving skills; relentless attention to detail and accuracy; 

-Extensive experience with data management and spreadsheet software such as Excel, Access, and Brio required. Knowledge of Oracle financial systems and Hyperion is a plus; 

-Ability to navigate effectively within a complex, decentralized environment. Operate effectively in a sometimes ambiguous decision-making environment.  

-Proven aptitude, competence, and experience with budget and forecasting processes and development. Quantitative and financial analytical skills with industry-standard fund accounting financial projections and forecasting methodologies and tools are required. 

-Strong analytical skills, with the ability to independently develop creative responses to obstacles 

-Expert knowledge of all financial policies, practices and systems (industry standard financial planning, accounting practices, and reporting formats, etc.) and broad financial (fee development, debt financing, cashflow, etc.), operational, and organizational experience in an academic environment. 

-Expertise in institutional accounting systems, databases, data extraction methods, and report presentation is required. Knowledge of UC Berkeley’s PeopleSoft HCM and financial systems, data structures and methods of report generation is highly preferable. 

-Demonstrated experience developing decision-focused presentations and leading groups to consensus within a designated timeframe.  Ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing, complex findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner. 

-Exceptional judgment and interpretation between conflicting concerns or organizations, and the ability to reach mutually agreeable solutions among diverse parties. Ability to see past immediate issues, grasp/address the secondary and tertiary impacts/consequences, and to r-ecommend appropriate responses. 

-Strong inter-personal skills, political acumen and demonstrated capability to gain the respect of others, influence people of varying levels of authority in multiple organizations, and elicit cooperation without direct authority. 

-Ability to work collaboratively as part of a diverse, high-performing team, leveraging the insights of others to optimize solutions. 

-Knowledge of higher education real estate and capital project practices, priorities, and policies, highly desirable; UC experience highly preferred. 

-Proven track record of success and a strong customer focus (makes customer needs a priority, practices active listening, engages collaboratively with a broad, multi-audience constituency) 

-Excellent project management:  ability to break down objectives into tasks and schedule tasks and resources to meet objectives 

Technical Skills 

-Financial Modeling – development of complex allocation and long-range revenue and expense planning models 

-Expertise in logical business rules associated with Berkeley’s financial systems and associated data structures 

-Ad hoc querying – utilize  common data mining tools to develop custom queries to extract required data from data warehouse 

-Advanced MS Excel skills; creative and expert use of other MS Office tools (Visio, Powerpoint, Project) to meet deliverable requirements 

Change Management & Training 

-Experience with contributing to and guiding change management and communications plans related to financial business process and financial systems changes 

-Ability to guide the development of business process-focused documentation and training content that will illustrate concepts for a variety of audiences

Salary: For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit: 

http://atyourservice.ucop.edu/forms_pubs/misc/benefits_of_belonging.pdf

To Apply: Please submit your cover letter and resume as a single attachment when applying through http://apptrkr.com/400068 click on ‘Job Listings’ followed by ‘External Applicants’, and then search for job number 16227.

Additional Information: This position has been designated as sensitive and may require a Criminal Background Check. We reserve the right to make employment contingent upon successful completion of a Criminal Background Check.

The University of California, Berkeley is one of the world's leading universities in research, teaching, and public service. The campus employs 2,028 faculty and over 14,000 staff in more than 130 academic departments and interdepartmental groups, libraries, museums and more than 65 interdisciplinary research units contribute to this dynamic and vital research and teaching environment.

The University of California, Berkeley is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We offer a diverse working environment, competitive salaries, and comprehensive benefits.

fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst (7710U)

fields.description:
When it comes to evaluating a Mergers and Acquisitions opportunity, the M&A Finance team plays a critical role in providing the tool kit for making sound business decisions. Working in close partnership with Legal, Corporate Development and People Operations, this team provides the financial analysis, forecasting and modeling to help decision-makers assess the strengths and risks involved in a given acquisition opportunity. As part of this team, you not only have strong finance and accounting background, but you can harness this knowledge to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions. You're willing to dive deep into the details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture.

As the Finance Analyst, Mergers and Acquisitions you will support the financial due diligence and accounting efforts as well as assist with the integration for our acquisitions and strategic investments.This role offers a great opportunity to gain experience, responsibility and exposure to functions both within and outside of finance by working closely with an M&A-Finance Deal Lead. You will have a strong finance and accounting background with Mergers and Acquisitions diligence and/or integration experience in public accounting or private industry. You are a well rounded individual who thrives in a fast paced, demanding environment with the willingness to dig deep into details as well as the ability to assess the big picture.


Responsibilities
  • Help research and determine guidance for internal staff on deal structure and ramifications of terms, perform and report on financial due diligence on targets for strategic investments and acquisitions.
  • Contribute to transactions from initial term sheet draft through financial due diligence, deal structuring, integration planning, valuation of intangible assets & IPR&D and purchase price allocation.
  • Gather research and process data to determine purchase accounting, create journal entries and determine consolidation structure.
  • Draft technical accounting documents to describe all aspects of executed transactions, assist with financial integration issues.
  • Create and maintain internal and external reporting schedules and help with ad-hoc requests.



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree preferred with a strong academic record.
  • 4 years experience in public accounting and/or private industry.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • CPA.
  • Experience with mergers and acquisitions and strategic investments.
  • Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and Oracle 11i.
  • Excellent planning, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-task, be detail-oriented and adapt quickly to a dynamic, fast-changing environment.


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
fields.title: Financial Analyst, Mergers and Acquisitions

fields.description:
Description

Kaiser Permanente

Director, Accounting Policy and Strategic Initiatives

Oakland, CA

The Director is directly responsible for managing the National Accounting Policy function and for working directly with the Deputy Controller to implement strategic initiatives for the national Controller function.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Provide general oversight, leadership, and direction for the Kaiser Foundation Health Plan, Inc. and Kaiser Foundation Hospitals (KFH/HP) National Accounting Policy department. Plan, lead and direct the periodic review and updating of over 100 National Accounting Policies. Provide quality review to ensure that policies are complete, accurate and ready for submission to the SVP, Corporate Controller and Chief Accounting Officer. Ensure input and alignment with external auditors.

2. Provide a leading role to inform, educate, and interpret financial operational policies of national scope to all regions and shared services operation, and manage an effective vehicle to disseminate such policies and interpretations to all regional policy liaisons. Coordinates efforts with the national business leaders, national and regional governance and compliance leaders, training managers and other subject matter experts in writing policy and in identifying policy gaps.

3. Work collaboratively with staff and executives in various departments and the regional Health Plans to influence, develop and maintain National Accounting Policies. Author certain new National Accounting Policies as business circumstances require and/or direct subordinates in the drafting of new policies. Supervise and review the work of Policy Consultants.

4. Establish strategy and objectives for process improvement initiatives for the Controllers function for approval by executive sponsor. Lead process improvement projects and day to day direction and performance feedback process improvement personnel. Direct external consultants engaged for process improvement projects. Establish project budgets, timelines and key milestones.

5. Serve as accounting function Business Process Owner Designee (BPOD). Work closely with OneLink, IT and other departments as a central point of contact to manage system implementations and upgrades on behalf of the controllers function.

6. Conduct meetings and provide BPOD updates for program controllers to ensure appropriate project management and execution are occurring. Report to senior finance leadership on project status as needed.

KEY RELATIONSHIPS

1. SVP, Corporate Controller & Chief Accounting Officer
2. Program Offices Financial Reporting personnel
3. SOX PMO
4. Regional Controllers, Directors and Managers.
5. Business Unit Controllers
6. External consultants/auditors
7. National Policy Department
8. National Compliance Office

Qualifications

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

· Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance required.
· CPA required.
· 5 years of progressive managerial experience.
· 10 years of finance experience in a highly diversified and complex organization with successive levels of accountability and results.
· Technical knowledge expert in generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
· Significant compliance orientation with demonstrated expertise in internal controls and Sarbanes Oxley.
· Knowledge and experience with major financial software systems.
· Significant experience with project management and change management required.
· Proven team leader with the ability to problem solve and negotiate with multiple internal customers.
· Collaborative style with skills to engage multiple diverse stakeholders with differing points of views.
· Demonstrated excellence in written / verbal communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
· Proven experience building and leading a team.
· Demonstrated ability to influence and motivate interdisciplinary teams. Successful experience in achieving results through people.
· Demonstrated high ethics and integrity.

REQUIRED COMPETENCIES

1. Ability to perform independently with minimal supervision and to form relationships, and work, with staff at all levels in the organization.

2. Must be able to quickly establish priorities and adapt to change, re-order priorities on short notice, develop solutions to obstacles and proactively move assignments forward to completion. Ability to use sound judgment and initiative in meeting a variety of situations.

3. Must have strong organization skills and the ability to work on multiple projects / assignments and meet required deadlines.

4. Must be a team player who can take initiative and who can function effectively and efficiently in a fast-paced, multi-tasked environment. Ability to discern when to seek approval, input and feedback prior to taking action.

5. Must be very detail oriented with a strong controls and quality assurance focus.

6. Ability to lead, train, develop, motivate and manage staff.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

· Significant involvement in major system implementations
· MBA
· Kaiser Permanente experience
fields.title: Director, Accounting Policies and Strategic Initiatives (Oakland, CA)

fields.description:
The Senior Technical Accountant will play a critical role in carrying out important initiatives of the Corporate Accounting team as well as assisting in other important processes such as technical accounting research, contract review, external reporting, Sarbanes-Oxley preparedness and compliance.

Responsibilities:

  • Technical Accounting - Provides timely technical support and guidance on significant accounting issues and corporate transactions to senior management; ensures business transactions are accounted for in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Researches and analyzes new and upcoming accounting standards for impact to Gilead and prepares high quality technical memoranda to support accounting treatment.
  • Participates in the research and analysis of the impact of IFRS on Gilead and assists with any IFRS implementation initiatives.
  • Related activities include participation in internal consultations, working with the external auditors and making presentations to senior members of the Finance team.
  • Attends training seminars and technical webcasts sponsored by third party providers as well as stays current on relevant communications and technical materials from external parties to stay abreast of new and developing accounting rules.
  • Collaborates cross-functionally within Finance and with Legal and senior management to determine potential accounting/reporting implications/issues and identify solutions. 
  • SEC Reporting - Assists in the review of Gilead's quarterly, annual and other SEC filings, earnings releases, call scripts and the annual proxy. Stays current on external reporting. 
  • Internal Consultations - Researches and prepares thorough analyses of accounting and disclosure implications of new contracts and transactions. Related activities include the participation in M&A due diligence, determination of purchase price accounting, and the review of distribution, licensing and collaboration and supply agreements.
  • Worldwide Controller's Manual - Responsible for the maintenance of Gilead's worldwide policy manual by proposing changes to corporate policies due to changes in accounting standards and ensuring that current policies are reviewed and updated on a periodic basis. Works with business process owners in formulating changes to corporate procedures/policies that help maintain/enhance the internal control environment but are practical to execute. 


Esential duties:

  • Manages the activities of one or more general accounting functions/processes and provides direction and coordination to professional and clerical staff within the department and cross-functionally. 
  • Acts as an advisor to subordinate(s) to meet schedules and resolve technical problems. 
  • Responsible for the timely and accurate review and posting of month end close and accounting transactions; P&L and balance sheet account analysis, review, reconciliation & resolution; and financial analysis. 
  • Ensures financial records are in compliance with GAAP. 
  • Consistently maintains appropriate internal controls and upholds company policies & procedures including the Worldwide Controllers manual. 
  • Interacts successfully with internal and external auditors and support quarter end, interim and year-end audits by providing timely & accurate data and communication. 
  • Recommends & implements process improvements. 
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision, interact successfully with non-financial personnel.
fields.title: Senior Accountant, Technical Accounting
fields.skills:

fields.description: Silverwood Partners views the Analyst as a critical member of the transaction team and the Analyst will assume high levels of responsibility almost immediately. An Analyst assists senior bankers in advising clients on making acquisitions or divestitures, selling businesses or helping to strategically advise companies in obtaining private funding and executing private placement transactions. As one of the principal client contacts in a client engagement, an Analyst coordinates the process, from initial meeting with senior management to working closely with senior professionals to negotiate transactions. The Analyst is required to actively participate in meetings with CEOs, CFOs, and corporate development executives of public and private companies, to prepare and deliver client presentations and to manage analysts and other support staff. Analysts are also expected to participate in various management roles of the firm including business development, research development, and recruiting.

fields.description:
Facebook is seeking a Manager, Technical Accounting. This position is full-time and located in our Menlo Park, CA headquarters.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor the activities of all accounting standard setting bodies to ensure timely identification of emerging accounting pronouncements
  • lead the quarterly GAAP and SEC updates with the Chief Accounting Officer.
  • Understand and provide interpretation of new accounting pronouncements in order to assist management in assessing financial and operational implications
  • support the implementation of new accounting standards across functional teams within the company where applicable.
  • Review contracts and agreements, research relevant accounting guidance, recommend accounting and financial reporting requirements for complex non-routine transactions, including but not limited to the areas of business combination, share-based compensation and leases.
  • Prepare technical accounting memorandums for significant transactions and support the review process with finance management and external auditors.
  • Conduct financial due diligence of proposed M&A transactions as needed.
  • Support the External Reporting team to ensure proper implementation of new accounting pronouncements
  • participate in the review of quarterly and annual SEC filings
  • assist in the preparation of financial statement disclosures in times of high seasonal demand or in areas with increased complexity.
  • Support various accounting teams with the drafting and review of any new accounting policies or updates of existing policies.

Requirements
  • Bachelor or higher degree in accounting or finance
  • CPA or equivalent qualification
  • Experienced manager tenure in a Big 4 accounting firm, including experience working with the firm’s technical advisory / professional practice group
  • Demonstrated knowledge and ability in researching and documenting new accounting guidance and the accounting treatment of complex issues
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills, particularly the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and precise manner
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Proven self-starter and independent thinker who sets aggressive goals and meets them
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite
  • Demonstrated IFRS knowledge is a plus
  • Experience in a public company preferred
  • Experience with the technology or social media industry preferred
fields.title: Manager, Technical Accounting

fields.description:
We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to support our Global Sales Organization. You will be directly involved in the coordination of the various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks). Your role will include providing variance analysis of bookings, revenues, and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments.

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to support our Global Sales Organization. You will be directly involved in the coordination of the various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks). Your role will include providing variance analysis of bookings, revenues, and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments. You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy of the company’s models and assisting with the worldwide consolidation process. Strict attention to detail and an ability to set and meet tight deadlines will be important for your success.
Specific Job Responsibilities:
  • Develop an understanding of the LinkedIn business model and support its development and execution in partnership with the America’s leadership
  • Understand the macro business drivers and operating environment and the impact on the LinkedIn growth strategy
  • Interpret the above requirements and develop a suite of business insights to analyze and make recommendations on business trends
  • Distribute and interpret financial and non-financial indicators for the business leaders on a routine basis
  • Formulate short-term and long-term financial plans to include yearly budgets and quarterly forecasts
  • Researching and reporting on factors influencing business performance
  • Analyze competitors and market trends
  • Work with the other members of the corporate finance team to scale the global Financial Planning & Analysis team
  • In addition to the planning responsibilities other duties include headcount and T&E reporting
Requirements:
  • 5-10 years financial analysis experience in a high-tech, high growth environment with demonstrated career advancement
  • Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting, MBA is a plus
  • Analytical background working directly in an FP&A environment modeling bookings, revenue, costs and expenses
  • Resume must reflect ability for critical thinking demonstrated by examples of specific projects and related outcomes
  • Advanced Excel modeling skills and competency in Word and PowerPoint
  • Strong systems skills with preference toward Hyperion Essbase and Oracle Financials
  • Possess a positive attitude, excellent communication and analytical skills
  • Proactive, result oriented, with a can-do attitude in meeting critical deadlines
fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst - North America Sales Organization (Talent Solutions)

fields.description:
Overview: Sales and Trading
From the largest global institutions to the latest hedge funds, investors come to Morgan Stanley for sales, trading, and market-making services in almost every type of financial instrument in all the world’s major financial markets, including stocks, bonds, derivatives, foreign exchange and commodities. Morgan Stanley professionals use the firm’s network and leading technology to provide liquidity and sophisticated analysis, to assess and manage risk and to execute reliably in the fast-changing markets.

Placement and Duration
The Summer Analyst Programme runs for 10 weeks from the end of June. While on the programme, candidates will undertake three rotations, each lasting three weeks. These will be in both Fixed Income and Equities, and candidates will experience a range of roles such as Sales, Trading, Structuring and Research.

Training Programme
All new summer interns participate in a Firmwide Orientation program, which covers the firm’s businesses, the transition from the academic to corporate world, and the chance to establish a network throughout the firm globally. The Sales and Trading summer interns then attend division training which programme includes three days of classroom-based product and technical training and weekly two hour work shadowing sessions across all areas. Interns will rotate across various desks within equities and fixed income product areas and work on individual and group project assignments. There will be a senior management speaker series and Managing Director introductions, mentor and buddy support and networkingand networking events Throughout the summer, interns will experiences presentation projects, trading and sales games, and regular evaluation and feedback.

Responsibilities
Pre-planned projects using a variety of academic and personal skills to allow interns to demonstrate their capabilities and improve the productivity and efficiency of the desk
Interns will shadow experienced Morgan Stanley employees to gain a broader understanding of the function of the desk.

Interview Process
The selection process consists of two stages, including telephone interviews and an assessment centre. At the assessment centre, candidates can expect to be assessed in a number of exercises

Salary is competitive with excellent benefits.

We operate on-going recruitment; therefore early application is strongly encouraged. Deadline for applications is Sunday 1st December 2013.

Skills Required
• You are a penultimate-year undergraduate student with outstanding academic achievements, and a minimum of 2.1 honours; all degree disciplines accepted, especially those with a keen interest in the financial markets.
• You possess strong analytical, problem-solving, communication and interpersonal skills; communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly and thrive under pressure and changing situations.
• You analyse and interpret complex information quickly and accurately.
fields.title: Sales and Trading Summer Analyst Programme

fields.description:
Description

The Financial Analyst develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control. Performs technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance. Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, trended future requirements and operating forecasts. Performs economic research and studies in the areas of rates of return, expense amortization, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.

Essential Functions:
• Prepares more complex financial trend and data analysis reports.
• May be accountable for the coordination, compilation and distribution of financial data.
• Performs financial analysis upon identification of variances and prepares summary of key findings.
• Responsible for more complex Marketing-specific departmental financial planning
• Participates in the planning and development of Marketing departmental forecasts and budgets including functional areas of Marketing Communications, Creative & Design, and Events.
• Will be responsible for budget completion in the Cognos system.
• Will be responsible for month-end accounting close procedures including expense accrual and amortization, reclasses and recharges.
• Will be responsible for GL & AP entries submitted in the KP OneLink system.
• Will be responsible for monitoring KP vendor contracts compliance and educating members of the Marketing department on contracts policy.
• Participates in projects of moderate complexity as assigned and may lead projects of low complexity.
• Responsibilities impact the achievement of department objectives.
• Results usually contribute to the completion of projects and department objectives.
• Typical errors would cause moderate delays, inefficiencies and/or expenses.
• Typically involves interpreting and carrying out general guidelines.
• Requires some judgment to develop alternatives.
• Provides information to others to be used in the decision-making process.
• Requires limited decision-making.
• Demonstrated problem solving and organization skills.
• Exchanges and interprets non-routine information and/or collaboration of work.
• Demonstrated strong oral and interpersonal communication skills with members of management.
• Follows generally defined directions.
• Works well independently with general supervision.
• Exercises some discretion within defined boundaries.
• Will seek a supervisor or manager to provide guidance and/or solve problems for difficult issues.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
• Four (4) or more years financial analysis & accounting or related experience.
• Bachelor's degree in finance related field or equivalent experience.
• General application of financial analysis & accounting concepts and principles.
• Full use and application of standard, financial analysis principles, theories, concepts and techniques.
• Working knowledge of financial analysis policies, practices and systems
• Able to formulate study designs and conduct analyses.

Preferred Experience:
• Frequent use and general knowledge of advertising and health insurance industry practices, techniques and standards.

• Working knowledge of industry standard media & advertising vendor contracts terms, conditions, and billing practices
• Proficiency in the GL & AP modules of PeopleSoft Financials within a health insurance industry setting (or Kaiser OneLink)
• Proficiency in PC based word processing and spreadsheet applications, including advanced functions of Microsoft Excel.
• Proficiency in PC based word database applications, including FileMaker for use in project accounting
fields.title: Marketing-Finance Financial Analyst HPO

fields.description:
Are you ready to take your career to the next level?  Here at YuMe, we are!!!  With our recent IPO and a video advertising market that is expected to continue its rapid growth, YuMe is in a fantastic position to take advantage of this critical opportunity as the leader in the space.   Come join us as we make this vision a reality.  

As a member of YuMe’s Corporate Accounting team, this position is responsible for the management and integrity of international financial reporting functions.
 
 
 
Responsibilities:  

  • Provide leadership to the international financial reporting function 
  • Design, implement and maintain effective accounting policies, procedures and controls (“SOX-like”) 
  • Provide expertise on the treatment of accounting transactions and related financial reporting requirements 
  • Manage the monthly close process for the international books (calendar, journal entries, reconciliations, FX rates maintenances, intercompany accounts, consolidations, eliminations, analysis, reporting)
  •  “Own” the accuracy and timeliness of the international accounting function 
  • Assist with the production and preparation of consolidated financial statements 
  • Responsible for timely and accurate filing of statutory reports and accounts in applicable countries 
  • Work with local / foreign consulting firms on transfer pricing and  tax issues 
  • Design, implement and maintain general ledger reports and reconciliations 
  • Design, implement and maintain informative financial results reports to meet the needs of the business 
  • Provide analysis on financial results (historical trends, work drivers, benchmarks)
  • Evaluate the accounting or financial reporting impact of operational decisions 
  • Develop financial systems solutions and requirements for new applications or enhancements 
  • Assist finance and the operating business units with international accounting and reporting related matters
  • Assist with the execution of quarterly reviews and year-end financial audits 
  • Drive to continuously improve the international accounting and reporting process 
  • Ad-hoc projects as necessary 
  • Coach and develop the accounting staff

fields.description:
Greystripe, a division of ValueClick, is the largest brand-focused mobile advertising network in the US by reach. Greystripe delivers the engagement for brand marketers and performance for direct response advertisers via our sophisticated targeting platform that leverages proprietary data from all connected devices. Greystripe leverages billions of rich media impressions to 85 million users of touch-driven devices and through our synergies with the ValueClick enterprise link consumers across all devices at an individual level.

Greystripe was named one of the Top Ten Most Innovative Companies in Mobile by Fast Company in 2011, the MOBI Awards’ Best Mobile Rich Media Network in 2010, E-Tech CTIA award winner for the Mobile Marketing/Mobile Advertising category in 2009, AlwaysOn OnMedia 100 winner in 2009, AlwaysOn Global 100 winner in 2008, Red Herring Global 100 winner in 2007 and the Under the Radar Best in Show: Mobility winner in 2006.
As a competitive, motivated, sales pro, you will utilize your in-depth understanding of the online media industry and complexities of the underlying technology from either an ad sales or media planning perspective. Drive new mobile business and strategic engagements with top marketers and ad agencies. Work in an entrepreneurial environment that is performance-driven. With tremendous upside earning potential, you will enjoy delivering exceptional results and continually exceeding sales goals. You will utilize your strong problem-solving skills to provide custom solutions based on client marketing objectives while you proficiently communicate the subject of online advertising technologies, including cross platform solutions, optimization, advanced targeting, inventory sources, attribution analysis and trading desks.

Requirements

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

· Customarily and regularly exercises business discretion and independent judgment with respect to matters of significance related to sales.

· Build a business plan and develop strategy around core clients and prospects to foster growth and new business acquisition

· Drive business forward with agency and client direct relationships.

· Work closely with product marketing, business development and operations to enhance and refine sales products, sales offerings and sales materials.

· Proven ability to close new sales and maintain client relationships for repeat sales at all levels within buy side (marketing manager to CMO and planner to Group Media Director)

· Ability to hit quarterly target revenue quotas.

· Ability to work independently and be a self-starter.

· Special Projects as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.

· Strong business acumen

· Exceptional organizational, presentation, verbal and written communication skills

· Proven record in digital and interactive ad sales:

  • Must have met and exceeded prior sales goals
  • Large-account sales and sales program management necessary
  • Experience growing relationship value over time
  • Track record of strong revenue generating long term relationships – built from scratch

    • · You are a strategic thinker with the ability to translate marketer needs into compelling concepts and solutions

    · Understanding of mobile market place and technologies and willingness to learn quickly

    · Ability and desire to manage ad programs through the entire advertising cycle; from business relationship to sale, to launch to ad program management, final program reporting and up-sell

    · Ability to develop and cultivate deep relationships at all levels especially Brand Managers to Media Buyers

    · Proven collaboration skills, with ability to work with cross functional teams to achieve sales results

    · Excellent verbal and written communication skills required

    · Strong preference for rolodex of interactive advertising buyers

    · Must be comfortable with changing environments and responsibilities.

    · Must be technically proficient, including Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint

    · Ability to travel as necessary

    Experience and Education

    · Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.

    · 5+ years experience in a related environment, including experience in interactive sales and/or interactive account management
fields.title: Sr. Account Executive (GS)

fields.description:
The Accounting Manager position is a critical role for our client, and is responsible for providing technical accounting expertise, financial analyses, and improvement of financial processes and controls.  The Accounting Manager is a key member of the Finance team and participates in many important aspects of the financial operations of the Company.  

The Accounting Manager position is a critical role for our rapidly-growing company, and is responsible for providing technical accounting expertise, financial analyses, and improvement of financial processes and controls.  The Accounting Manager is a key member of the Finance team and participates in many important aspects of the financial operations of the Company.  Reporting to the VP of Finance, the Accounting Manager will own the development and maintenance of the organization's accounting principles, practices, procedures, and initiatives to produce accurate and timely financial statements in accordance with GAAP. 


Responsibilities

  • Own the monthly, quarterly and year-end close process, including year-end audit and the preparation of internal / external consolidated financial statements.
  • Manage an efficient organization responsible for general ledger accounting, accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll and stock-based compensation, fixed assets,  financial reporting, and variance analyses.
  • Proactively lead all aspects of technical accounting, including timely identification of and compliance with evolving accounting guidance, providing GAAP interpretation, and documenting issues appropriately.  Research technical accounting matters as they arise and determine accounting treatment for complex transactions based on such research.
  • Prepare standard and ad-hoc analyses of the Company’s cost structure and assist the FP&A manager as necessary with operational finance issues.
  • Develop Excel-based reporting tools that enable department heads / functional leads to understand and pro-actively manage their monthly spend.
  • Manage the development and implementation of internal controls and systems that meet the Company’s evolving business model and culture
  • Own the monthly, quarterly and year-end close process, including year-end audit and the preparation of internal / external consolidated financial statements.
  • Manage an efficient organization responsible for general ledger accounting, accounts receivable, accounts payable, payroll and stock-based compensation, fixed assets,  financial reporting, and variance analyses.

  • Prepare standard and ad-hoc analyses of the Company’s cost structure and assist the FP&A manager as necessary with operational finance issues.
  • Develop Excel-based reporting tools that enable department heads / functional leads to understand and pro-actively manage their monthly spend.
  • Manage the development and implementation of internal controls and systems that meet the Company’s evolving business model and culture.

fields.description:
Chase is the U.S. consumer and commercial banking business of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM), a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.3 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries We serve more than 50 million consumers and small businesses through more than 5,600 bank branches, 18,700 ATMs, credit cards, mortgage offices and online and mobile banking as well as through relationships with auto dealerships.

As a Chase employee, you'll be part of a company that makes a real difference every day for our customers, our communities and ourselves. With a focus on customer service, you'll put others first, do what's right and create solutions that make lives better. We invite you to build your career on our strong foundation and help shape what's next - for you and for us.

The Mobile Banking, E-Commerce and Payments (MEP) organization is a motivated, cross-functional team comprised of high-talent individuals with a concentrated focus on delivering innovative banking services to the most important platforms of today and tomorrow. The MEP team has grown from 50 to 150 employees in just over a year and is responsible for setting and executing the strategies behind Mobile Banking, Digital Marketing, Social Media, Web/Mobile Payments and Innovation.

As a Quality Assurance Analyst, you will perform risk based end to end system tests. You will also develop test scripts based upon communication and discussions with Business and End Users in line with defined workflows and use cases; process transactions from system entry to exit; test new and modified functionality delivered across applications and workflows; and test applications to demonstrate that relevant existing system functionality remains as expected.

Key responsibilities include:
  • Develop testing processes and approaches according to JPMC Chase standards.
  • Assist in designing and ensuring overall integrity of the testing strategy.
  • Work with appropriate business and technology leads to determine the acceptable range for test results and performance.
  • Help design, develop and implement test plans, scripts, tools using the detailed business requirements, functional requirements and design documents.
  • Work with business and technology leads to identify the appropriate data for testing, and prepare that data for the test cases.
  • Assist Application Developers and technical support staff in identifying and resolving problems.
  • Facilitate resolution and communication of cross-application/organization architectural issues and decisions.
  • Assess and revise test sequence and scope based upon test results and/or changes in product design.
  • Coordinate component, system and documentation testing with the appropriate technical groups.
  • Document test procedures and findings.
  • Reconcile test results from different tests and different groups.
  • Assess readiness and deviation of product/project performance based upon test results and product specifications.
  • Identify automation candidates

Qualifications

  • 5+ years applications development or quality assurance testing experience
  • 5+ years experience with manual testing, testing tools, writing test plans, and reviewing test cases for technical and/or business clients experience
  • Preferred skills:
    • 2+ year experience testing in Mobile Application
    • 3+ years experience in Banking and Finance
    • Online transaction processing
    • Credit/Debit card knowledge
    • Experience creating functional and technical documentation
    • Experience in an Agile environment
    • Performance/Load Testing
    • Experience testing Apache
    • Experience with Linux and Unix Command Line
    • Experience with WebLogic
    • Experience in testing high volume transaction systems
    • Experience in multi-site system testing
    • Experience with automated test tools (i.e. QTP, LoadRunner)
    • Experience with relational database management system

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V
fields.title: Quality Assurance Analyst

fields.description:
Software Engineer 

Department:  Ariba Network        

Reports To: Manager of Ariba Network

Job Description Overview

Company Overview

 

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

 

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billion dollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

 

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

 

  • Interesting, collaborative work with some of the best folks in the Bay Area
  • 21 paid PTO days
  • 10 holidays + winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day – all paid!
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
    • Bright, sunny, and spacious offices in central Sunnyvale with free parking, Caltrain shuttle, and transit subsidy
    • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
    • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help. 

 

The Ariba Network team is looking for an experienced Software Engineer who is passionate about finding elegant and scalable solutions to unique, complex and large scale problems. You can help build the next generation of the largest open business network that connects millions of business users around the world.

You will be responsible for the design, development and support of key functional areas across the entire Ariba Network stack.

fields.description:
This is an exciting opportunity to join our dynamic Accounting team in a leadership position. This position will own general Accounting Operations and a variety of special global and domestic projects.  He/She will drive improvements in an accounting function in a fast-pace environment with a company in a growing E-commerce market. 

 

Reporting to the Senior Controller, the successful candidate will have significant and demonstrated leadership, people management, team building and personnel development skills. This role also includes heavy cross functional interface with all corporate finance departments (including Tax, Treasury and FP&A), operational finance teams in the world-wide business units as well as internal/external stakeholders. This role is highly visible and is expected to drive process or skill/talent improvements and influence decision makers across the organization to align the Accounting group with the Company’s business. Major responsibilities include ownership of the month end closing and implementation of the company's accounting policies and standards to new and/or amended GAAP standards. This includes analyzing issues, leading the team to accurate and timely conclusions, and working with the external auditors, and refining internal and external reporting processes.
fields.title: Senior Director of Accounting
fields.skills:
Essential Functions:

  • Advance both the technical capabilities and value-driven behaviors of the accounting team
  • Lead and foster an open, collaborative, performance-based culture which recognizes and rewards demonstrated achievements
  • Engage and empower the team to maximize their contributions
  • Lead all month end close and general ledger reconciliation processes, in accordance with established internal controls
  • Implement the company's Financial Accounting Policies and Standards to ensure compliance with new and/or amended GAAP standards and interpretations.
  • Prepare monthly financial statements in accordance with GAAP guidelines
  • Coordinate and manage quarterly reviews and the annual audit performed by external auditors
  • Assist tax department with preparation of tax provisions and filings
  • Develop, implement and maintain internal accounting systems, controls, policies and procedures
  • Initiate and drive process improvements for greater accuracy, financial control and efficiency
  • Streamline/enhance processes and skillsets where required to increase efficiency and effectiveness of group's reporting and financial analysis
  • Lead financial systems implementations, including automation efforts
  • Drive special projects as needed to ensure that accounting and reporting issues are properly addressed

Requirements:

 

  • Exceptional leadership capabilities – ensures clarity of objectives and priorities; continually seeks to enhance employee fulfillment in their work
  • Passion and drive to deliver outstanding results
  • Substantial experience in and working knowledge of GAAP technical accounting research and application
  • Attention to detail, strong analytical problem solving, as well as collaborative skills
  • Strong organization, time management and project management skills
  • Excellent writing skills; proficient in technical accounting writing ability
  • Ability to identify and resolve conflicts in technical and management contexts
  • Ability to multi-task on competing and deadline-sensitive priorities
  • Ability to work independently and be self-motivated

 

Education & Experience:

 

  • BA/BS degree in Accounting or Finance
  • 8-10 years of relevant overall operational accounting experience (CPA preferred)
  • Demonstrated leadership, people management, teambuilding and personnel development skills
  • Demonstrated experience leading operational and system transitions
  • In depth understanding of ERP systems, Great Plains / NetSuite experience is a plus
  • Excellent technical accounting skills
  • Knowledge and experience in accounting operations with strong attention to detail and organization
  • Excellent verbal/written communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills; flexible, team player spirit, demonstrated ability to handle complex decision making

fields.description:
What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West.  There is a spirit here that drives us to do more.  Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank.  They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic.  We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world.  We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.

Responsible for providing financial analysis in support of the bank’s corporate financial analysis function, specifically focused on analyzing the performance of individual business lines, in the context of the performance of the bank as whole.  Position provides strategic insight to senior management by analyzing data to generate insightful predictive analysis that helps guide senior management’s expectations regarding current and expected future financial performance.

Performs a variety of highly complex and diverse analytical duties including the collection and analysis of financial data from reports and various sources; performs statistical analyses.  Interacts with business line senior management and serves as consultant to management.  May lead employees on projects

Responsibilities;

1.            Analyzes the results of business line performance including the comparison of actual results to budget and forecast.  The analysis produced is utilized to communicate corporate performance to the Bank’s shareholders, make strategic decisions and to serve as a control point to determine the accuracy of financial information.

 2.           Acts as primary liaison between corporate finance and business units within the Bank.  In the role as liaison the position focuses on communication and providing superior customer service to the business units.  Examples of the types of communication that the position is responsible for are: i) communicating significant changes to processes ii) communicating items identified in the review or analysis of monthly financial results iii) communicating ideas regarding how to use corporate tools (Hyperion, etc) to efficiently analyze results, etc.

3.            Analyzes proposed plans including pricing, products, programs, and investments to determine costs and profit; analyzes results of proposals implemented.

4.            May plan, conduct and supervise long term projects.

5.            Conducts research and complex studies involving financial analysis, strategic planning, and cost allocations. Prepares management reports and makes presentations on study results.

6.            Prepares the evaluation of transfer pricing methods and pricing alternatives.

7.            Analyzes and interprets financial data and compiles statistical reports on current financial developments, financial policies and plans, and significant organization developments.

8.            Assists in the development and implementation of customer and product profitability in conjunction with various other units.

9.            Researches relevant business developments in the organization and/or within the industry.

10.          Assists with the integration of acquired entities into the unit profitability reporting and budgeting processes.

11.          Performs other duties as assigned or requested.
fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst
fields.skills:
Qualifications;

•             Bachelors degree in Finance or Accounting is required or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Master’s Degree or CPA preferred

•             4+ years of experience in banking highly preferred/financial services industry preferred

•             6+years of financial analysis experience

•             Must possess thorough financial institution product level expertise

•             Thorough knowledge of transfer pricing and margin of financial institution products

•             Thorough knowledge of financial institution balance sheet and profit and loss analysis statements

•             Thorough understanding of regulatory issues such as capital issues and GAAP accounting issues as they relate to the banking industry

•             Thorough understanding and application of principles, standards, industry practices, techniques and concepts, as well as contributing to the development of new concepts, techniques and standards

•             Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results

•             Demonstrated ability to develop solutions to highly complex and diverse analytical problems which requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors

 

•             Time Management and organizational leadership skills

•             Ability to work effectively with diverse teams are required

•             Strong professional communication, presentation skills & ability to coordinate and lead meetings

•             Ability to Prioritize & Problem solve

•             Knowledge of Hyperion & Essbase a plus, extensive MS Office experience (Excel & PP)

•             May act in a lead capacity/instructional role for employees

fields.description:
The GeC Corporate Development team is responsible for advising business partners, leading strategic transaction execution (acquisitions, partnerships, joint ventures, etc.) and providing real-time business updates on competitive landscapes, industry events, and opportunities. From time to time, the team will work on cross-functional projects with the M&A teams supporting Walmart stores.

The Senior Analyst will be an individual contributor on strategic initiatives, often working on multiple projects at a time, typically partnering with senior leadership teams and business units across the enterprise.

Responsibilities:
• Evaluate and coordinate a review of potential opportunities with appropriate internal business partners
• Participate in all stages of transaction execution, including strategy, due diligence, valuation, financial impact analysis, negotiation, definitive documentation, and integration
• Perform valuation analyses using various methodologies including discounted cash flow, build vs. buy, leveraged buyout, trading and transaction comparables
• Develop detailed financial models to evaluate performance under various operating scenarios and analyze impacts of different transaction structures
• Supports business partners on one-off projects and analyses
• Works cross-functionally with other business and finance teams, and other segment teams
• Prepare presentation materials for management
• Responsible for compiling and disseminating Global M&A Update and public comparables analysis materials for senior leadership on a regular basis
fields.title: Senior Analyst, Mergers & Acquisitions
fields.skills:
• 3+ years of experience in corporate development or investment banking
• Corporate Development or Investment Banking experience, preferably in technology
• B.S. in mathematics, physics, engineering, business administration or related field
• Expert in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
• Strong financial acumen and quantitative analysis skills
• Ability to work well under pressure and deadlines, and have the aptitude to synthesize large amounts of information and develop innovative solutions.
• Physical Requirements: May include occasional travel

fields.description:
SENIOR TAX ACCOUNTING MANAGER

 

Want to work in a dynamic environment at the intersection of technology and creativity? Join the team that is revolutionizing television brand advertising across PCs, smartphones, tablets, set-top boxes, game consoles, Internet-connected TVs and other devices.

As a member of the Finance team, this position is responsible for managing the tax accounting, reporting and compliance process worldwide.
fields.title: Senior Tax Accounting Manager
fields.skills:
Want to work in a dynamic environment at the intersection of technology and creativity? Join the team that is revolutionizing television brand advertising across PCs, smartphones, tablets, set-top boxes, game consoles, Internet-connected TVs and other devices.

As a member of the Finance team, this position is responsible for managing the tax accounting, reporting and compliance process worldwide.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Provide leadership to the tax function
  • Company’s subject matter expert on tax accounting and related financial reporting matters
  • Provide tax information (footnotes, disclosures, checklists) for all periodic, quarterly and annual reporting SEC filings (Forms 8-K, 10-Q and 10-K)
  • Research new tax guidance from the FASB, IASB, SEC and other regulatory bodies, including evaluating the impact of new guidance on the Company’s financial statements
  • Prepare technical tax accounting memos documenting the Company’s tax accounting position/treatment of tax accounting matters as they arise
  • Responsible for the tax accounting and reporting of all equity based transactions and compensation on a worldwide basis for employees, Board of Directors and consultants in accordance with GAAP, as well as preparing schedules and footnotes disclosures for SEC filings
  • Support Company-wide educational efforts on tax accounting related issues, including existing and new accounting guidance/policies
  • Prepare reconciliations of deferred income taxes, income tax payable and income tax expense accounts and other tax related accounts
  • Responsible for Sarbanes-Oxley documentation and controls
  • Coordinate the global FIN 48 tax contingency assessment and reporting
  • Provide income tax accounting support and expert advice for acquisitions and divestitures
  • Assist CFO with the design, development and implementation of a global tax strategy
  • Assist with the structuring and planning for the creation or reorganizations of international entities
  • Responsible for timely and accurate international tax compliance
  • Oversee and support all components of the data collection and analysis with respect to the international affiliate's tax packages and international tax provision process in accordance with ASC 740
  • Mange compliance with all transaction-based (sales, use, VAT, etc.) taxes worldwide
  • Assist with and/or complete ad hoc projects as requested

 

Qualifications:

  • Degree in accounting or finance. Masters of Taxation preferred
  • CPA (active)
  • Minimum of 7 years income tax experience with public accounting “Big 4” and/or a large multinational/multicurrency corporation
  • Strong understanding of ASC 740, Income Taxes
  • Proficient in the use of computer based financial and tax applications
  • Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of technical accounting matters, US GAAP, SEC regulations
  • Ability to interact well with various levels of management and coordinate effectively with support departments, such as legal counsel (internal/external), auditors (internal/external)
  • Capable of keeping up with rapidly changing tax law and accounting standards
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and changing environment
  • Strong understanding of internal controls and SOX compliance
  • Strong analytical skills, accuracy and attention to detail a must
  • Ability and willingness to meet business critical deadlines
  • Hands on and detailed oriented
  • Strong time management and organizational skills

fields.description:
This position requires an energetic individual with a demonstrated ability to make key contributions in the analysis of financial and strategic issues within the Corporate Marketing Team.  The Sr. Financial Analyst will provide financial budgeting & forecasting, managerial reporting, business metrics & drivers, and assistance with other ad-hoc projects.  Reporting to the Director of FP&A, this individual will work closely with the CMO as well as various functional VP’s. 

 

Responsibilities:

-          Work with multiple stakeholders to identify key financial metrics; build charts, dashboards and other tools to ensure the marketing org is meeting stated objectives for marketing results as well as financial discipline

-          Work with the Marketing Leadership Team, Financial Planning & Analysis, Accounting, and other stakeholders to forecast spending, build annual/quarterly marketing financial plans and forecasts

-          Provide ad-hoc analysis and recommendations for resource allocation, project profitability, and other opportunistic/strategic decisions.

-          Generate ideas for process improvement and initiate changes in processes as necessary

Skills:
