fields.description:
Our group consists of 24 corporate credit analysts dedicated to the high yield and investment grade trading business. Credit analysts are responsible for making investment recommendations for the bonds, loans and credit default swaps (CDS) for issuers in specific industry groups (i.e. Technology). Credit analysts sit on the trading desks to facilitate a close working relationship with their trading and sales colleagues.

Specific Responsibilities for Full Time Credit Analyst
• Identify cash bond, credit default swap (CDS) and bank loan investment opportunities
• Effectively communicate investment ideas to internal and external clients
• Participate in the underwriting process inter-divisionally with counterparts in Global Capital Markets (GCM) for a new debt issuance
• Work closely with traders to manage risk positions

Summer Associate Program
A summer associate will sit on the trading desk and work closely with a senior credit analyst. During the summer, an associate is expected to accomplish the following:

• Develop increased knowledge of an industry/company
• Learn skills necessary to build a financial model of a company
• Develop an understanding of corporate capital structures, bond indentures and credit agreements
• Develop an understanding of relative value and asset coverage

At the end of the rotation, the summer associate will present a cash bond, credit default swap (CDS) or bank loan investment idea to members of the corporate credit group.

Skills Required
• Outstanding analytical/financial skills
• High energy, self-motivated, creative and organized
• Proven writing skills
• Strong focus on teamwork
• Strong verbal communication skills
• Very strong excel and data management skills
• Attention to detail
• Ability to multitask and reprioritize is a must
fields.title: 2014 Summer Associate Fixed Income Sales and Trading- Corporate Credit Analytics

fields.description:
Reporting to the Senior Director of Operations, the Financial Analyst plays an important role; you are the piece of the puzzle that weaves together our budget plans, actual spend, and forecasts. You need to be able to give us the narrative to that storyline so that non-financially trained folks understand what you’re saying. In collaboration with the Sr. Director of Operations and the Accountant, you will provide financial support to each functional unit across our organization and hold each Senior Director accountable for the financial health of their budget. You will also help us to manage various grant budgets and prepare financial reports for our funders and board of directors.

What You’ll Do:
* Play a key role in the annual budget and forecast preparation; conduct various Ad-hoc analyses and verifications to ensure the accuracy, rationality & achievability of budgets and long-term plans.
* Prepare various financial and statistical analyses for management meetings, grant reports and budget presentations.
* Work with the Accountant to establish a month end process within 5-10 business days of closing a month (including quarterly and yearly end closes as well).
* Prepare monthly cost center analysis for each team, delving into variances to understand the drivers, making recommendations and highlighting issues where applicable.
* Provide support by documenting and improving internal controls, processes, and reporting.
fields.title: Financial Analyst
fields.skills:
About You:
* You have strong oral and written communication skills, which help you to work closely together with various departments across the organization.
* You are detail-oriented and comfortable working with complex data, but also have the ability to step back and understand the big picture.
* You have proven success in supporting a nonprofit.
* You are a systematic and analytical thinker and problem-solver.
* You are well-organized with an ability to adapt and accept a wide-range of responsibilities and to multi-task with unwavering attention to detail.
* You have a solid understanding of accounting concepts and US GAAP.
 
Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or economics.
* You have 3-5 years of experience in a nonprofit.

fields.description:
Job Title – Senior/Staff

 

Job Description:

 

As a key contributor to our engagement teams, you will apply your educational background and the experience obtained from public accounting to some of the most exciting clients in the world. You will take direction from other, more experienced members of the team as you assist in problem solving and adding value by preparing our clients with an IPO, M&A transaction or an audit. You will be involved with various technical accounting projects, including revenue recognition, equity accounting, technical memos, audit preparation and writing technical accounting policies. A Senior/Staff may also be involved in S-1 drafting, research and improving close processes. We rely heavily on our seniors/staff and expect a high degree of professionalism and responsibility as we carry out the highest quality of professional service our clients require and demand.

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Add value through complex transactions including IPOs, M&A, Reverse Mergers, etc.
  • Add value to clients to successfully prepare and complete audits
  • Add value to public and private clients by assisting in any of the following:
    • Detailed revenue analysis and revenue recognition
    • Equity – stock compensation (FAS 123R), warrant accounting and EPS
    • Draft or review complex sets of financial statements with disclosures
    • SEC Reporting, including 10K, 10Q and other filings
    • Support of quarterly or month-end closes
    • Identification and application of technical accounting guidance to client situations
    • Global accounting activities including IFRS, foreign currency and consolidations
    • Apply knowledge and understanding of governing principles, apply these principles to client transactions and communicate an understanding and application of these principles
    • Identify, analyze and discuss generally accepted accounting principles for the client, when necessary, with the Manager, Senior Manager and engagement partner
    • Identify complex accounting issues and bring them to the attention of engagement leaders for resolution
fields.title: Senior - Technical Accounting
fields.skills:
Desired Skills & Experience:

 

  • GPA of 3.5 or better
  • Rated top 25% of Big Four class
  • 1-5 years of prior experience in public accounting required
  • CPA preferred or actively pursuing completion of certification
  • Ability to take responsibility and account for his/her own work
  • Hard working, detail oriented and ability to work independently
  • Ability to work well in a team atmosphere
  • Professional and personable demeanor
  • Proven solid verbal and written communication skills
  • Passion for helping clients with a strong interest in technical accounting
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite with strong Excel skills
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or equivalent required

 

 

Travel:

 

Ability to travel up to 20%

fields.description:
We are currently recruiting Research Analysts for the following investment strategies:

  • Matthews Japan Fund
  • Matthews India Fund
  • Matthews China Fund

 

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS:

 

These positions will report to a lead Portfolio Manager of one of the company’s investment strategies. 

 

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

We are seeking individuals to join the Matthews’ teams to perform fundamental research and investment analysis in support of the Portfolio Managers.

 

Specifically, this individual will be responsible for conducting both qualitative and quantitative analyses, focusing on industrial analysis, business models, products and services, management quality and competitive advantages for companies relating to the specific fund.

 

This role will be responsible for supporting and coordinating investment decisions for a series of SEC-registered mutual funds that specialize in international markets.

  • Perform fundamental research and investment analysis, and propose recommendations for prospective investments and/or existing investments in our portfolios
  • Conduct meetings both onsite and offsite (overseas) with company management teams, industry associations, regulatory bodies and consultants
  • Build financial and valuation screens/models, reflecting companies’ historical and forecast performance
  • Monitor fund and portfolio company performance, and assist Portfolio Manager in asset allocation and risk, return diversification and stock selection/portfolio construction proces
  • Support ongoing and ad hoc research efforts and periodical publications of the team
  • Assist in collecting, processing and organizing daily information on companies in the investment universe.
  • Conduct both qualitative and quantitative analyses, including analyses of current economic situations, industry sectors and a company’s business model, product and services, management quality and competitive advantages.
fields.title: Research Analyst
fields.skills:
• 4 year university degree, Masters degree and/or CFA preferred
  • Demonstrable conviction and interest in Asian markets
  • 2-5 years of prior experience in capital markets (asset management, equity research, investment banking, private equity, consulting)
  • Solid understanding of accounting and a keen interest in investing
  • Proven qualitative and quantitative analytical abilities
  • Must be an independent thinker and self-starter
  • Solid Excel skills and working proficiency using research tools, such as Bloomberg and Factset
  • High level of integrity
  • Team player
  • Communication skills - Ability to articulate clearly an investment case in writing and speech
  • Willingness to travel to Asia is required
  • Asian language skills (read, write and speak) preferred (language preference based on specific fund)
  • Understanding of Asian economies and regulatory environments
  • Must be a U.S citizen or authorized to work in the U.S on a permanent basis

You can find the full job descriptions and qualifications for each of our open Research Analyst positions on our website at: http://micm-llc.com/contact/employment-opportunities.fs

fields.description:
Team up with Apple, one of the most influential technology leaders in the industry. Join the Apple Finance organization and make a positive impact on a company that is known for its impressive lineup of products, including Mac, iPod, iPhone, iPad and iTunes. At Apple, you’ll share in a commitment to excellence by partnering with world-class managers, all with one unified vision—creating innovative products that delight customers. Finance is about “fueling innovation.” We do this by hiring quality individuals with integrity, personal accountability, teamwork, excellence, and proactive thinking. If you exemplify our values and want to be part of something big, contact us today.

Supporting the Technical Accounting team, this individual will provide technical accounting guidance for complex accounting issues for worldwide finance and business teams as well as play a key role in understanding and adopting new accounting literature. This is an excellent opportunity for a finance professional with the right background and skills to jump immediately into a critical role within Apple Finance.

Key Qualifications

  • To excel in this role, an individual must possess superior oral and written communications and presentation skills; therefore, candidates for this position should expect to be asked to demonstrate such skills.

Description

Specific areas of responsibility include:
•Support the technical accounting team on complex accounting issues for both existing and new FASB and IASB accounting standards;
•Research new accounting guidance from the FASB, IASB, SEC and other regulatory bodies, including evaluating the impact of new guidance on the Company’s financial statements;
•Assist in the preparation of Company-wide Accounting and Finance policies, including the revision of existing policies and creation of new policies as new convergence standards are adopted;
•Consulting with business units in the analysis and documentation of complex transactions, ensuring all relevant accounting issues are identified and resolved.
•Support the development and maintenance of standardized processes;
•This individual will support Company-wide educational efforts on finance and accounting related issues, including new accounting guidance or new corporate policies;
•Support the External Reporting team with technical reviews of complex financial statement footnotes in SEC filings.

Education

Bachelor's degree or higher in Accounting or Finance.
CPA with a Big Four audit practice focused on technology clients.
3-5 years of experience.
fields.title: Technical Accounting Analyst

fields.description:
Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world’s major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

Senior Financial Analyst – Global Revenue Operations

Responsibilities
  • Review newly executed Issuer, Acquirer and Merchant contracts to assess Visa's contractual pricing obligations
  • Log and maintain key contract terms in the contract database
  • Prepare complex pricing adjustment calculations (both accrual and cash basis) and develop methodology to automate workflow
  • Provide guidance to the Billing team on appropriate billing system changes related to contracts
  • Support Account Executives, Pricing Strategy and the Deal team on ad-hoc requests
  • Develop in-depth knowledge of Visa core billing and reporting systems
  • Develop new and maintain existing financial models to monitor revenue and pricing compliance on a monthly or quarterly basis
  • Perform ongoing reviews of billing systems, processes and controls through the interpretation of historical financial, operational and transactional data to mitigate the risks of potential billing errors
  • Provide insight and actionable recommendations to Finance Operations to improve billing processes and data integrity
  • Document significant findings and related recommendations
  • Maintain and update current Fee Guide contents on Visa Online (VOL)
  • Analyze revenue data and prepare customer/product revenue reports for Management
  • Support Revenue Project team and Financial Systems Strategy on Revenue Planning Analysis (RPA) initiatives
  • Assist with all other ad-hoc revenue projects


    • Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Auditing or Accounting (Advanced degree preferred)
  • 8+ years of relevant work experience (Card payment industry preferred but not required)
  • Advanced skills in both MS Excel and Access. Extensive data mining experience using OLAP tools is preferred
  • Must be comfortable working with a heavy volume of data; knowledge of Excel VBA or SQL would be extremely beneficial
  • Strong business analysis/problem solving skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, and upbeat customer-service attitude
  • Detail-oriented with proven ability to work independently and in a team oriented environment with minimal supervision
  • Ability to perform under pressure with tight deadlines in a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment to drive results
  • Self-motivated and be willing to utilize and learn new technology to solve problems
  • Proficient with other MS Office applications such as Word and Power Point
  • Prior experience with Cognos, MicroStrategy reporting tool and Oracle Financials is a plus
fields.title: Sr. Financial Analyst - Revenue Operations

fields.description:
Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world’s major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

Position Summary
Visa is looking for a Financial Analyst who will be part of the Revenue Operations team supporting Visa’s emerging products, which include V.me, Visa Offer, various mobile payment services, and other new businesses. The analyst will have visibility into the key strategic initiatives and will work cross-functionally with other stakeholders within the organization. The candidate must also be able to work with external clients. This role will also be responsible for several billing activities and projects related to Visa’s CyberSource business. CyberSource is a global leader in e-Commerce Payment Management.

Responsibilities
  • Develop in-depth knowledge of Visa’s emerging products
  • Manage all aspects of revenue operations which include reviewing potential contracts to ensure consistent billing process, setting up pricing in the billing system, invoicing, managing account receivables, and performing GL postings
  • Ensure that procedures and controls are in place; Ensure completeness and accuracy of billing and collection in accordance to the contract
  • Collaborate with internal and external partners; Proactively engage product, sales, and other internal functions for updates and to resolve issues
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously & meet all deadlines
  • Comfortable with working independently in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • Perform special projects and ad-hoc analyses as needed


    • Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Accounting
  • Master’s degree preferred
  • At least 4 years of relevant work experience in accounting or financial analysis
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills required
  • Must be comfortable working with a heavy volume of data
  • Detail-oriented, self-starter, with proven ability to work independently and in a cross-functional environment with minimal supervision
  • Ability to perform under pressure with tight deadlines and accustom to a fast-paced and often ambiguous environment to drive results
  • Ability to contribute new ideas and solutions for current processes and to address business challenges
  • Strong organizational and project management skills; Abilities to plan, organize, and adapt within a multi-tasking environment, requiring simultaneous management of multiple issues and projects
  • Eagerness to work with all levels and collaborate to accomplish the objectives
  • Self-motivated and be willing to utilize and learn new technology to solve problems
  • Expert in MS Excel. Knowledge of Excel VBA or SQL would be beneficial
  • Proficient with MS Word and Power Point
  • Good written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience working in a mobile/eCommerce environment with an understanding of payment industry is a plus

fields.description:
Are you a CPA with previous experience in public accounting, including public company audits? Do you have strong operational experience and previous experience in the accounting department of a large company? Do you want to work for an exciting, fast paced pre- IPO company? If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

Our Client, a fast growing internet company located in the heart of San Francisco is currently seeking a highly enthusiastic accounting professional to join their team as Accounting Manager/Controller. This person will be responsible for leading and managing all aspects of the Accounting and Reporting functions for the Company.  This role requires strong leadership, management, technical, analytical, problem-solving and process-orientation skills. The ideal candidate will possess all of the above and will have the ability to work in a demanding and intellectually challenging environment, and will enjoy dealing with special projects as they come up. This is a unique opportunity to join a team of highly committed professionals dedicated to building a high quality finance organization.

 

Duties of the position include but are not limited to:

  • Manage the operations of the accounting department, working to improve efficiency of processes and organizational structure to achieve department’s goals
  • Manage the monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting close process and ensure issues are resolved in a timely manner
  • Identify needs for financial controls, grow company’s infrastructure to adapt to growth
  • Prepare management reporting package, perform financial statement analyses and document meaningful explanations for fluctuations for management and auditors
  • Establish and maintain financial policies, procedures and internal controls
  • Ensure the successful preparation of external financial statements and, in post-IPO environment, SEC filings
  • Manage Payroll and Benefits, including 401K administration, insurance selection, and equity option grants

fields.description:
Overview:

Assess technical accounting implications for complex business issues and transactions. Ensure that the company’s public financial statements (U.S. and German) and other SEC filings are of the highest standards of quality, GAAP compliant and useful to management and the investing public. Prepare all SEC filings (Edgar and XBRL) including but not limited to 10-K, 10-Q, Proxy, 8-K, S-3 and S-8, in a timely manner to facilitate in-depth internal/external review and analysis. Manage the Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) compliance initiatives and reporting.



Responsibilities:

  • Research accounting literature and apply technical standards to complex business issues and transactions, including the areas of revenue recognition, clinical and R&D accruals, stock compensation, and tax.
  • Prepare written accounting and financial reporting position papers on an as-needed basis for review by management.
  • Assist in quarterly and annual process for filing the Form 10-Q and 10-K (Edgar and XBRL), including drafting and reviewing documents, ensuring quality, coordinating review by management and legal counsel, and administering strict timelines.
  • Prepare, review and file other periodic SEC documents including but not limited to Forms 8-K, S-3, S-8, and Section 16 Reporting.
  • Assist in monthly and quarterly close of the general ledger, including review of journal entries and account reconciliations.
  • Active role in updating/implementing accounting policies and procedures to respond to changes in the Company’s business, SEC/GAAP regulations, and SOX 404 requirements.
  • Perform tests of internal controls and update/maintain documentation in compliance with SOX 404 requirements.
  • Provide accounting support, including coordination with auditors and legal counsel, financial printer, stock transfer agent, and stock plan administrator.
  • Assist in preparation of quarterly Audit Committee materials.
  • Other special projects as required.


  • Subsidiary Reporting:
    • Ensure subsidiaries are compliant with US GAAP; review accounting for revenue recognition and foreign currency transactions.
    • Monitor foreign statutory requirements.
    • Assist management with maintenance of intercompany arrangements, transfer pricing agreements and other key agreements.
    • Equity Accounting:
      • Assist in performing calculations of equity compensation in accordance with FAS123R for stock options granted to employees and consultants, ESPP, restricted stock, and warrants.
    • Support the company in maintaining a work environment focused on quality and that fosters learning, respect, open communication, collaboration, integration, and teamwork.
    • Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:

  • BA/BS in business, accounting or related field.
    • CPA license preferred.
    • Experience with a Big Four certified public accounting firm is highly preferred.
    • 3-4 years of increasingly responsible accounting and reporting experience; biotech industry experience preferred.
    • 2+ years SEC reporting experience within a public company is preferred.
    • SOX 404 implementation and compliance experience a plus.
    • Computer skills: Experience with Equity Edge preferred, good working knowledge of Excel and Word.
  • Personal attributes include:
    • High level of attention to detail, aptitude for planning/managing deadlines,
    • Maintain confidentiality over all finance and accounting matters and information,
    • Exceptional communication skills, including the ability to effectively present information to various levels of an organization,
    • Creative approach to problem solving and the ability to think “out-of the box”,
    • Ability to self-motivate and function independently, driven towards superior effort and performance and the desire to work in a very dynamic environment,
    • Strong commitment to a team approach and awareness of team and individual success dependencies.

Director of Technical Support - Software Product - Saint Louis, MO - On-Site

Are you looking to take your next step closer to executive management in a software company? Do you have a technical and customer support background?

Are you willing to RELOCATE to St. Louis where housing is cheaper and the pace is much slower?

If so, we have an amazing role that just opened for you!

Based in St. Louis area, we are an exciting financial stock trading software maker looking to add on to our Senior Level Management team. Reporting to the COO, we are looking for a customer-facing software manager who can manage our technical support and technical sales teams. This is a technical role and will require someone with a technical background (C++/Network Protocols) and also the desire/ability to manage teams and interact with customers.

Three (3) technical teams will be reporting to you. (Technical Sales, QA and Technical Support). You will be reporting to the COO and have 15 resources.

Curt.Weigel@CyberCoders.com

fields.description:
As Airbnb continues to expand our business globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest to drive strategic business decisions. To this end, the Financial Planning & Analysis team is looking for a highly qualified Senior Financial Analyst to join the team to support its forecasting and financial analysis efforts.

This position will be responsible for monthly performance reporting and forecasting, annual budgeting, long range planning, and on-going projects and analyses contributing to key operational decision-making. 

Specific Responsibilities:

  • Serve as valued business partner (and finance liaison) to various areas of the business;
  • Ownership of planning and forecasting process for various areas of the business, inclusive of monthly reporting and forecasting as well as annual budgeting, long range planning for these areas;
  • Provide consolidated global view of risks and opportunities and advise on operational decision-making through financial insights and applying business judgment;
  • Provide analysis and modeling on investments and project planning;
  • Support management reporting efforts driving visibility to key areas of the business;
  • Recommend, develop, and implement process enhancements and financial plans as required;
  • Articulate real-time status to Sr. Management as required; and
  • Support Ad hoc financial and non-financial analysis.

Qualifications:

  • 3-5 years of experience in financial planning and analysis; desired experience includes investment banking, management consulting, and/or strategic planning;
  • B.A. or B.S. in Business, Finance, or Accounting; a MBA, or CPA a plus;
  • Strong interpersonal and team building skills - ability to work with a diverse team and influence/drive change across functional and business boundaries;
  • Strong project management, planning, and organization skills, including ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment;
  • Strong analytic skills, including superior financial modeling, Excel, and database skills;
  • Continuous improvement attitude; ability to seek out and implement internal or external best practices;
  • Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office and financial analytics/modeling;
  • Knowledge of SQL a plus;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills;
  • Self-starter and effective manager;
  • Unquestionable integrity.

Chase is a leader in the financial services industry, providing banking, mortgages, credit cards, loans, payment processing and investment services to 50 million customers - 1 out of every 6 Americans. As a division of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM), we:

While we operate across a broad range of businesses, our mission at Chase is quite simple: to be the industry leader in customer service. Our employees put the firm's resources to work every day for our customers.

Chase offers a dynamic environment and the training and support to meet your full potential. Our company is widely recognized as a great place to work, to grow and to invest for the future. Join our team.

You will be on a team responsible for cross-selling the Liquidnet trading system, CMS, Algo Trading Suite and other core Liquidnet products to buy side institutions/hedge funds in various geographical regions and owning the client relationship through the entire sales cycle. 

You will provide product demonstrations to prospects and be able to explain the value of Liquidnet and what differentiates it from other trading systems and traditional brokerage firms.  Once a firm is trading on the system, you will serve as a point of contact with these institutions and your focus will be to increase the traders’ comfort level on the system in an effort to increase their use of the product and drive trading revenues.

fields.description:
Company

Pacific Gas and Electric Company, a subsidiary of PG&E Corporation (NYSE:PCG), is one of the largest combined natural gas and electric utilities in the United States. Based in San Francisco, with 20,000 employees, the company delivers some of the nation's cleanest energy to 15 million people in Northern and Central California.

Pacific Gas and Electric Company is an AA/EEO employer that actively pursues and hires a diverse workforce.
Department Overview

PG&E's Sourcing organization manages nearly $5 billion of annual company spend. The department provides the following services to internal clients: procurement of goods and services, strategic sourcing and cost savings, contract management, supplier relationship management, supplier diversity planning, execution and outreach, compliance management, ongoing procurement field support and management of the procure to pay cycle.


Position Summary

We are seeking a FINANCIAL ANALYST- SOURCING, EXPERT in San Francisco, CA. This position will provide economic value analysis savings opportunities, financial and market analysis, data compilation and strategic sourcing portfolio support to the Sourcing Organization. The Financial Analyst-Sourcing, Expert will report to the Manager, Supply Chain Analytics.

This position is located in San Francisco, CA.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
---------------------------
- Bachelor's degree in business, economics, engineering, or mathematics (or related industry experience).
-7 years experience in business, economics, financial, or market analysis.
- 7 years qualitative and quantitative skills, with demonstrated proficiency in data analysis (SAP/MS Access), modeling (MS Excel), and presenting (MS PowerPoint).

Desired Qualifications
--------------------------
- MBA in business or Master's degree in finance, engineering, economics, mathematics, or other related field.
- 3 years Supply Chain experience
- 10 years of demonstrated experience in finance, economics, or a senior data analysis role with increasing leadership responsibilities.
- 10 years of excellent qualitative and quantitative skills and experience, with demonstrated knowledge of financial management, and statistics.
- Ability to create and present executive level presentations to drive agreements with Lines of Business
- Advanced MS PowerPoint/Excel/Access skills (pivot tables, V/H-lookups), SQL server.
- Strong interpersonal skills, a team focus, and the ability to work in a fast paced environment with cross-functional teams.
- Solid understanding of financial management, management consulting or strategic sourcing experience.
- Understanding of procurement processes, policies and procedures, and contract management.
- Expertise in competitive analysis and industry/market research approaches.
- SAP/SRM user proficiency.
- Six Sigma, CPSM, PMP, or other business related certification.
- Utility industry experience is a plus.


Responsibilities

-ECONOMIC DATA ANALYSIS AND VALUE ADD PROPOSTIONS: Lead on value add business opportunities for sourcing portfolio savings. Identify new cost and effective savings opportunities to the supply chain organization. Secure management sponsorship and buy in of major sourcing initiatives from Lines of Business and Sourcing Leaders. Validate savings risk/opportunities for business case approvals and implementations.

-MARKET AND DATA INTELLEGENCE LEAD FOR STRATEGIC SOURCING: Lead the development of savings program opportunities that are developed and implemented, benchmarking opportunities, and business case development. Identify potential cost savings, spend analysis, and spend reduction, and supplier consolidation opportunities. Utilize market intelligence tools to track, trend, and recommend potential new realized opportunities to support the development of sourcing strategies. Drive savings opportunities with Sourcing Portfolio Manager and Category Leads with recommendations including: qualitative and quantitative analysis, selection criteria, long range opportunity planning, supplier consolidation, and other strategy planning.

-SOURCING DATA COMPILATION, ANALYSIS, AND PRESENTATION: Track and develop key performance indicators and commodity indices to verify supplier increase requests, identify cost saving opportunities, elevate possible threats/risks. Create new opportunities and processes where needed to support business objectives. Preforms highly complex data analysis and distills it into easy to understand ideas and executive level presentations to drive decision making. Maintains and develop key sourcing and savings reports for management presentations.

-SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOURCING STRATEGIES AND EXECUTION: Serve as the expert liaison to all key stakeholders on Supply Chain Analytics. Act as the thought leader to apply extensive knowledge on the development of strategy or resolution of complex sourcing issues. Drive these issues into opportunities and management execution.
fields.title: Financial Analyst-Sourcing, Expert

fields.description:
Morgan Stanley’s Public Finance Investment Banking group raises capital to fund projects for public sector entities and not-for-profi t institutions. The group plans financial strategies and structures tax-exempt and taxable offerings along with derivative solutions to meet the needs of state and local governments, hospitals and health care organizations, higher education and cultural institutions, housing authorities, transportation agencies, water and sewer systems, power utility systems and student loan agencies. All of these are essential to fund vital projects and services with the least burden on public resources.

PLACEMENT AND DURATION.
The Public Finance Investment Banking Summer Analyst Program provides undergraduate students an opportunity to master the analytical, quantitative and interpersonal skills necessary to develop an exciting and rewarding career on Wall Street. Summer Analysts joining Public Finance will participate in a 10-week intensive Program alongside Sales & Trading Summer Analysts, based in San Francisco. The Summer Program is designed to provide a realistic view of our businesses by having Summer Analysts assume the functions of Full-Time Analysts. Summer Analysts are placed directly with a group in Public Finance, where opportunities exist in one of the following product areas: Municipal Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Higher Education, Public Power and Utilities, Housing, Student Loans, Health Care and Sports.

TRAINING PROGRAM.
All Summer Analysts participate in an orientation program that covers the Firm’s businesses
and the transition from the academic to the corporate world, creating the chance to establish a network throughout the Firm globally. Public Finance Summer Analysts then attend divisional training where they learn the core skills required to be successful on the job. The curriculum includes daily market updates, accounting, credit risk analysis, business overview speaker series, fundamental and advanced product and technical training and registration preparation. In addition, Summer Analysts have several opportunities to network with peers, mentors and managers through teambuilding sessions, learning lunches, community service, social events and more.

RESPONSIBILITIES.
Summer Analysts in the Public Finance group will collaborate with full-time employees to
develop the skills they will need to have a successful summer, including:
• Develop structuring, cash flow financial models.
• Draft presentation materials, memos and proposals to generate new business.

CONTACTS.

Skills Required

• You are pursuing an undergraduate degree, generally as a junior or sophomore, with a minimum 3.0 GPA.
A concentration in Government, Political Science, Public Policy or Economics is preferred.

fields.description:
Department Overview

 

We have a talented team of analysts, technologists and marketers who are pushing the boundaries of digital analytics. Following a recent business-wide implementation of Adobe/Omniture, we’re now in the position to expand the extent to which digital analytics data is consumed and used throughout the company. We’re seeking an expert to lead the charge in managing Apollo’s growing appetite for this valuable data.

 

Under the management of the Sr. Director, Analytics, the Media Analyst will assist in the optimization of digital media for the Apollo Group, regarding online marketing for higher education for the University of Phoenix and other brands under Apollo. The Analyst works collaboratively with the Analytics and Digital Media teams and is responsible for tracking key digital media metrics around user behavior, marketing campaign performance and return on investment.  The Media Analyst is responsible for regular digital media reporting and first level analysis relating to Apollo’s digital media spend.

fields.description:
As Netflix continues to grow streaming video domestically and expand internationally we are encountering increased operational complexities and challenges in our Procure-to-Pay process and accounting infrastructure. We need to work with business partners internally and externally to design processes and establish best practices that achieve:
- Economic efficiency
- Maximum automation and Scalability
- Compliance
- Alignment with Netflix culture


This position will report to the Director of Accounting Operations. Accounting Operations encompasses global accounting of Marketing, Tech and Dev, and G&A expenses, as well as Global AP operations. This person will oversee the Tech and Dev and G&A component of the operations and manage two accountants. Today we are managing the basic blocking and tackling needed to close the books, but we need to build an organization and processes that are sustainable, simple, and scalable. We are accountants with reporting and compliance responsibilities, but we are also a value-added service organization that understands and meets the needs of our business partners and challenges the status quo.


This position is process improvement and operations intensive, but requires a fundamental understanding of US GAAP and the ability to research and conclude on accounting issues. We need someone that enjoys thinking independently and creatively and working and collaborating across various organizations (Accounting, FP&A, Tax, Legal, IT, Purchasing and general business partners) to establish best practice and implement new process. We have a lot of interesting ideas and initiatives we'd like to implement and we expect this person to identify even more opportunities. We'll provide the context, you go get it done.


We operate in a dynamic environment with a high performance culture built around freedom and responsibility. See the two slide decks at http://www.netflix.com/Jobs describing our culture and the business opportunity which should answer a lot of questions about what we do and how we do it.


Responsibilities:
- Accounting operations and infrastructure:
- We need to rethink and redesign how transactions are processed. This requires teaming with AP, legal, purchasing, IT and business partners.
- Team with business to design a contract management system that ensures accounting has reviewed all contracts, T&C's and minimum commitments.
- Implement optimal P2P information flow and control design based on needs of different functions. Balance compliance with efficiency.
- Ensure timely, accurate close and reporting for Tech and Dev, and G&A line items of our P&L, and balance sheet accounts around all PP&E, Prepaids and Accruals, among others. Own, design and develop accounting policies and operations in these areas.
- We are moving our finance systems to Workday, a Cloud-based ERP system. Plan, test and make sure we are ready to go-live Jan 1.
- Facilitate close meetings and design close packages and information to be reviewed.
- Open Connect accounting (this is our streaming delivery infrastructure). Drive process improvement and automation. Understanding of inventory accounting is a must.
- Vendor Accruals and Assets: Team with business partners to understand business and establish processes that ensure appropriate asset recognition, accruals at month end and tracking of PO's, invoices and budget to actual expenses.
- KPI's: Create, measure and distribute KPI's. Drive KPI improvement.
- Analytics. Develop other analytics and ad-hoc analysis as necessary.


To be successful:
- 6 – 10 years of related experience. Big 4, CPA, MBA – all very helpful.
- Consulting experience is great too.
- Demonstrated ability to drive improvements and continuously simplify processes.
- Out-of-the-box, independent thinker that can collaborate and build consensus.
- Process driven, extremely organized and detail oriented.
- Can organize, summarize, clarify and communicate ideas simply, succinctly and accurately.
- Has a quick intelligence, is fast on the feet and quickly responds to issues and questions.
- Has a big capacity to both think and do. Flourishes in a ‘hands on' role and adding value at different levels.
- Demonstrated ability to think innovatively—connecting the dots when others cannot. Able to make the leap from information to insight. Able to identify, nurture, refine and implement compelling creative ideas and concepts.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to communicate effectively with senior management, team, peers, cross functional teams, service providers.
- Enjoys having multiple projects going at once. Can change course and get things done on short timeframes.
- Says it like it is; not wrapped in political niceties.
- Is motivated by what is best for Netflix.

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billion dollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

 

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

fields.description:
We all know someone who’s gotten a bad break from the law. We may also know someone else who’s made the law work for them—from the inventor with a valuable patent, to the employee with stock options, to the non-profit organization that receives legal and financial support for society-changing projects. Every day we spend our time and resources making it easier for people to get the legal help they need. If you’d like to spend your time with us, then join our team. You will work in a growing company, surrounded by the best talent. If you can contribute to an already strong environment, we want you and will compete for your skills.
 
About this position:
 
Rocket Lawyer is seeking a dynamic and hands on individual who is interested in driving change within a fast paced rapidly growing environment. This person will direct and manage the overall accounting operations of the company. This is a great opportunity for someone with 8+ years of progressive professional experience and who possesses the desire to grow within an industry leading e-commerce legal services company. The ideal candidate will have strong technical accounting knowledge, a breadth of accounting experience and a proven record of executing process improvement initiatives with significant impacts. This role will report directly to the Chief Financial Officer and manage the accounting team.
 
Responsibilities: 

  • Assume responsibility for accounting team of 3 (presently outsourced) with the goal to eventually bring the function in-house
  • Evaluate existing financial system and lead the process of migrating existing system in-house or evaluation and implementing of an alternate system
  • Develop a team by building out the tax, treasury, financial reporting and compliance functions
  • Manage monthly close process and creation of monthly financial statements
  • Implement controls, policies and procedures appropriate for an early-stage company but scalable to support a public company control environment
  • Ability to oversee external, SEC, reporting function
  • Close business partner with FP&A, HR, external auditors, outside legal counsel, internal legal and executive management
  • Perform analysis of new accounting pronouncements. Be the technical accounting expert within the company. The responsibilities include researching (GAAP, IFRS) accounting questions and issues as well as keeping up-to-date with current legal reporting requirements and trends
  • Set up infrastructure to support international expansion
  • Prepare presentations to the company’s executives and/or Audit Committee, as necessary
  • Lead efforts to streamline billing, collections, chargeback process with merchant banks
  • Partner with engineering and product teams on billing system implementation
  • Lead on Risk mitigation efforts through various operating units within the company and in negotiation of our Insurance policies
  • Primary point person for external auditors. Plan, coordinate and support annual audit and statutory requirements

fields.description:
Chief Accounting Officer – Position Description

 

Saba Software is looking for an accomplished financial executive who can drive best practices, and instill world class accounting standards and practices in a complex multinational company. As Chief Accounting Officer (CAO) you will oversee all world-wide accounting operations, tax, and treasury functions. This position reports to the CFO and is located in Redwood Shores, California.

 

The CAO will be responsible for regulatory compliance, develop and enforce accounting policy, and ensure accounting and business controls are in place. The CAO will architect and drive systems and process improvement needed to keep pace with the evolving nature of the business

 

The CAO will have strong technical accounting skills balanced with a practical business mind. He/she will be a business partner to FP&A and all business functions to develop management information and support business decisions needed to drive a successful business.

Job Duties

 

In this senior finance role you will have the following responsibilities:

  • Ensure timely and accurate monthly accounting close
  • Ensure you have the proper human capital in place to support the organization
  • Working with the CFO architect the accounting, tax and treasury functions to support an company of Saba’s size and complexity
  • Ensure proper business controls are in place
  • Oversee all audits and SOX compliance
  • Oversee SEC reporting
  • Review the existing systems and accounting process and make the changes needed to properly support the company
  • Be a partner to the FP&A organization to improve overall management reporting and decision making.
  • Oversee WW Treasury including bank relations and loan covenant compliance

fields.description:
The Senior Manager, Accounting Policy & Controls will be responsible for determining the appropriate/required accounting treatment for all new financial transactions related to eCommerce.

The Senior Manager must possess significant business acumen to understand business initiatives and their respective impact to accounting and controls. The Senior Manager will be required to perform all necessary research with the appropriate accounting bodies; to benchmark eCommerce industry practices, to document findings, to communicate recommendations to executive management and governing Walmart bodies for approval; create the policy documentation and finally to oversee communication to the eCommerce business and implementation of the new policy.

This position will also be responsible for reviewing current practices and policies to ensure the accurate treatment of transactions as related to Walmart"s eCommerce business. The ideal candidate will have an in-depth knowledge and experience in the area of US GAAP and technical accounting as related to eCommerce and/or the internet industry. Research, communication and collaboration skills will be instrumental in the success of this role. Other success factors for this role include being comfortable with change, being resourceful, having a global mindset and exhibiting profession curiosity.

An individual must be able to successfully perform the essential functions of this position with or without a reasonable accommodation. Manages and maintains compliance with accounting standards across the global organization by implementing new accounting standards as required; assisting in the development of training programs related to high risk areas; and monitoring policy compliance on an ongoing basis. Manages the Company's assessment of internal controls over financial reporting (Sarbanes-Oxley Section 404) by providing input and recommendations for defining the scope of management's internal control assessment; coordinating assessment activities among process owners and between internal and external auditors; ensuring timely execution of assessment activities; and reporting assessment results to the Disclosure Committee.

Oversees the management and maintenance of Company Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance software (for example, Risk Navigator) by developing and delivering training courses to the entire user base; ensuring certifications are being performed; managing the development of reports for business owners and management; overseeing quarterly archives; and overseeing the administration of system or process changes. Ensures Company Associates are provided technical guidance on the generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) by ensuring Associates are educated on current GAAP concepts; evaluating and identifying solutions to technical or routine accounting issues; and researching and providing input on complex accounting matters.

Ensures Company Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) internal controls are established and risks and exposures are minimized by consulting business process owners on how to identify, document, and remediate potential risks, exposures, and controls; and providing training on new controls and processes. Drives the execution of multiple business plans and projects for accounting policy and controls by identifying Customer and operational needs; developing and communicating business plans and priorities; removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance; providing resources; identifying performance standards; measuring progress and adjusting performance accordingly; developing contingency plans; and demonstrating adaptability and supporting continuous learning.

Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by selecting and training; mentoring; assigning duties; building a team-based work environment; establishing performance expectations and conducting regular performance evaluations; providing recognition and rewards; coaching for success and improvement; and ensuring diversity awareness. Promotes and supports company policies, procedures, mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by training and providing direction to others in their use and application; ensuring compliance with them; and utilizing and supporting the
Open Door Policy.

Ensures business needs are being met by evaluating the ongoing effectiveness of current plans, programs, and initiatives; consulting with business partners, managers, co-workers, or other key stakeholders; soliciting, evaluating, and applying suggestions for improving efficiency and cost-effectiveness; and participating in and supporting community outreach events.

fields.description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

 

Title:               Accounting Manager

 

Department:   Finance

SUMMARY

This position will lead and manage the general accounting transactions, monthly close process and financial statement preparation.  In addition, this position will manage and help maintain intercompany accounting records for US entities and preparing analysis and providing explanations of balances and variances in monthly intercompany financial reports.  This position reports to the Director of Finance.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Applies working knowledge and technical accounting principles and practices, financial close processes and controls and financial statement preparation to daily work
  • Prepares more complex journal entries
  • Reviews more complex transactions and prepares reconciliations, adhering to compliance standards
  • Researches variances and proposes corrections
  • Applies knowledge and judgment of accounting practices in the preparation of financial statements. Seeks input from others
  • General Ledger Responsibilities include:
    • Complete month-end rollforwards
    • Assist with the monthly close and consolidation
    • Tie various legal entity trial balance loads to consolidated general ledger
    • Assist with accounting for non-recurring transactions and review of qualification of costs in accordance with company policy
    •  Forecasting of costs associated with Non-Recurring projects
    • Prepare journal entries and post transactions
    • Preparation of balance sheet fluctuations analysis
    • Provide research, guidance and technical memos to worldwide businesses and business function
    • Research and implement new accounting standards
    • Intercompany Responsibilities include:
      • Prepare monthly Intercompany reconciliations and confirm Intercompany balances with subsidiaries.
      • Record intercompany journal entries including accruals and adjustments to clear intercompany transactions with other affiliates and maintain Intercompany accounts in balance on a monthly basis.
      • Responsible for accuracy and detail review of Intercompany billing, including billings for non-inventory activity.
      • Analyze intercompany balances with other affiliates and coordination of intercompany wire payments and intercompany settlements to comply with Company and/or statutory requirements.\
      • Complies with internal and external audit requests related to Intercompany accounts.
      • Accounts Payable Responsibilities include:
        • Manage Accounts Payable Department

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS

  • Bachelor’s      Degree in Accounting or related field
  • CMA/CPA      strongly preferred

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

fields.description:
Senior Financial Analyst

Provide analytical support to the Real Estate Strategy & Services executives and management of the People & Performance Division regarding expense, Provides direction and leadership in developing and creating effective organization structures and work units through the implementation of financial planning and analysis and best practices relating to modeling, forecasting, budgeting, cost allocation and performance tracking and reporting that are aligned with overall business strategy and corporate objectives. Provides technical advice to lower level associates and other functional area.

The position consists of developing complex financial and operational analysis for senior management and internal clients. Uses information to develop reports in order to drive results and behaviors, facilitates the budget and forecast process with a thorough understanding of budget templates, participates in the resolution of issues and process improvement opportunities, and creates presentations for senior management.

Essential Functions

The Financial Analyst III manages and coordinates planning deliverables to meet corporate objectives and deadlines. This includes annual budget, quarterly forecasts, the 5 Year & 10 Year Business Plans. This position reports to the Operations Finance Manager for People & Performance and supports the VP of Real Estate Strategy & services and People & Performance division.

  1. Prepare monthly analysis of actual vs. budget expense by department and category, analyzing and interpreting key variances, issues and trends. Develop quarterly forecasts and prepare presentations outlining business issues and recommendations.
  2. Participate in the Operational expense Planning and Budgeting process working to provide key information, tools, analysis, insights, etc. to the organization influencing the development of overall objectives and goals of the division.
  3. Design and build complex financial models. Support the organization in the analysis and management of expenses and workforce. Provide solutions/recommendations, strategies and actions to senior and executive management.
  4. Participate in expense initiatives to lower expense ratio, benchmarking, best in class targeting and activity based costing efforts
  5. Develop reporting, automating processes wherever possible, manage and reconcile data from multiple sources, provide reporting (qtrly forecasts, operational plan, budget, actuals, variance tracking, etc.) to cost center/budget managers and executives. Perform complex analyses

Knowledge and Skills:

· Strong understanding of business strategy and its application to finance and operational goals

· Strong analytical skills to effectively interpret problems and develop solutions

· Advance knowledge in the use and development of financial models.

· Strong interpersonal and inter-departmental skills that support effective relationship with team and other departments

· Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines and timelines, with proven experience in meeting goals on time.

5-10 yrs of experience in finance or related area required. Bachelors degree with emphasis on Business Admin, Finance, or Accounting or equivalent experience and education required. Real Estate experience highly desired. Excellent analytical, reporting, data manipulation and problem solving skills required. Advance PC modeling skills. Excellent communication skills required.
fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst

fields.description:
Riverbed delivers performance for the globally connected enterprise. With Riverbed, enterprises can successfully and intelligently implement strategic initiatives such as virtualization, consolidation, cloud computing, and disaster recovery without fear of compromising performance. By giving enterprises the platform they need to understand, optimize and consolidate their IT, Riverbed helps enterprises to build a fast, fluid and dynamic IT architecture that aligns with the business needs of the organization. Riverbed offers the rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry who are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. If you are a cross-functional collaborator with the ability to see and link the pieces of the big picture together, join and help us create the world of the future.

The Financial Analyst position is a key role within the Riverbed corporate FP&A team. This person will partner with one of our business units at our rapidly growing and dynamic company. The business unit (BU) Financial Analyst will be responsible for the annual budgeting process as well as monthly updates for one of our business units. This individual will be involved in business forecasting, headcount management and expense analysis to ensure that all activities are compliant with approved budgets and Riverbed policies. An important element of the Financial Analyst’s responsibility will be the development of strong business partnerships with operational BU management. By working closely with the BU management team and providing relevant information and financial support, the BU financial analyst will contribute to enhanced business unit performance.

The BU Financial Analyst will be involved in the creation and development of reliable and easily-understood monthly management reports for the BU management team. This individual will provide financial analysis? to assist business partners with operational decisions to ensure cost control and productivity optimization. Additional responsibilities include business development, margin analysis and ad hoc projects. This individual will work closely with Accounting and will be responsible for cost, T&E and Marketing accrual management.

Responsibilities:
• Act as a trusted finance business partner for one of our business units
• Perform inancial analysis, business modeling and decision support for senior executives and managers o enables performance monitoring and business management
• Develop metrics and forecasting models that drive improved performance
• Deliver accurate expense reporting to assist with forecasting of projected expenditure and actuals
• Provide variance analysis of actual spending vs. budget and forecast. Highlight potential issues, risks and opportunities and make recommendations to business partners
• Partner with Accounting to understand and meet deadlines for financial close
• Ad hoc projects and analysis

Requirements:
• 3+ years FP&A experience required; experience supporting a business unit preferred
• Strong Excel, PowerPoint, ERP and reporting system skills (Oracle/Hyperion preferred)
• High growth, high technology experience preferred including knowledge of hardware and software businesses
• Must have the ability to adhere to deadlines in a fast-paced and changing environment
• Strong attention to detail and understanding of business processes
• Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
• Ability to interact well across different functions, levels and personality types
• BS or BA in Finance, Accounting and/or Economics; MBA preferred

This is a summary only. Duties and responsibilities may change over time.

Riverbed Technology, Inc. is a San Francisco company near CalTrain, Muni and BART), with excellent salary, options and benefits. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V

Location: This position is 100% San Francisco.

www.riverbed.com

fields.description:
Responsible for providing Quality Assurance services to projects, maintenance activities and taking ownership of the quality of multiple applications while conducting Quality Assurance development processes, developing test solutions, and assisting in the development, implementation, and maintenance of Quality Assurance best practices and testing standards. Analyzes business requirements for completeness, testability and develops test plans, test scenarios, test cases, test scripts, test data and will carry out the Quality Assurance testing activities to ensure the applications and products and/or releases are in compliance with the Quality Assurance standards of the organization.

Responsibilities;
1. Analyzes business requirements, design documents for completeness and testability.
2. Develops test plans, test scenarios, test cases, test data and test scripts for different types of testing activities.
3. Performs execution of test cases, test scripts, captures test results, test metrics and reports them.
4. Identifies and tracks system defects, Performs root cause analysis of the defects and works with the development team to resolve them.
5. Partners with test leads and architects to develop and establish Quality Assurance standards and best practices.
6. Performs and coordinates system verification and validation test activities utilizing various tools such as HP Quality Center/Application lifecycle Management.
7. Performs Quality Assurance testing activities to ensure the applications and products and/or releases are in compliance with the Quality Assurance standards of the organization.
8. Provides mentorship to more junior Quality Assurance Analysts as needed.
fields.title: QA Analyst II
fields.skills:
Qualifications;
• Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field required.
• 5+ years of experience in the Information Services field, focusing on Quality Assurance activities and testing.
• Minimum 5 years of experience with Quality Assurance processes and testing methodologies.
• Performs Black Box testing of different applications and products for multiple projects.
• Performs white box, grey box testing of applications and products for multiple projects.
• Defines, documents Quality Assurance testing processes, best practices and test governance.
• Develops procedures, templates and work instructions for implementing Quality Assurance best practices and testing standards.
• Provides guidance, training and mentoring to Quality Assurance and project teams.

fields.description:
Position Summary:
Responsible for determining and documenting the business, data and functional requirements to support the development of certain PD, LGD and EAD models. Will collaborate with business, risk personnel and a model development team to determine and analyze the information needs and functional requirements and document these requirements in business requirements/ functional specification documentation.

Responsibilities:
1. Responsible for relaying information to the technology team in easily understood terms for both technology and business.
2. Liaise with the business, development team and technology on an ongoing basis.
3. Evaluate data gathered from multiple servicing and other source systems reconcile differences, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to understand, and distinguish optional user requests from what is required.
4. Conduct user acceptance testing as it relates to the technology solutions.
5. Work independently with users to define concepts and under direction of project managers.
6. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
7. Will form part of a project team and will be expected to interact with the team on a daily basis.
8. Will report to a manager in the business line.
9. Perform other duties as assigned.

Requirements:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field.
• 3-5 years of relevant experience preferably in the banking industry.
• An ideal candidate will have a working knowledge of the Bank’s loan products.
• Prior experience working with large implementation projects would be beneficial for the candidate.
• Must have solid organizational skills, with the ability to handle complex projects in a multi-tasking environment and meet deadlines with quality results
• The candidate must possess strong written and verbal communication skills for report writing, business requirement proposals, client interaction, and methodology documentation.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with thoroughness and attention to detail is highly desired.
• The candidate must be able to work independently and proactively to take initiative to solve problems quickly.
• The candidate needs to have a desire and ability to work closely with the data and technology specialists on project assignments.
