• The candidate will have experience in database software e.g. Access/ ACL etc

What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.

fields.description:
Wize Commerce is looking for a talented Financial Analyst to join our Finance & Strategic Planning team.  This is a very visible position with direct line of sight to the CFO and sales executives.  The position reports into the Director of Finance & Strategic Planning and has significant impact on the company’s performance and strategy.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Partners closely with leadership in sales to conduct analyses, including gap analysis and revenue projections, that identify opportunities for improving account growth and profitability
  • Define and maintain weekly revenue reports and large merchant dashboards
  • Attend sales meeting to be the expert of Wize Commerce’s revenue ‘horizon’ and large merchant activity
  • Assist in the implementation of new optimization methodologies for all merchants to maximize revenue
  • Analyzes competitive and market research data against Nextag’s offerings
  • Leads weekly financial and performance metrics reporting & analysis for senior management team
  • Develop financial models to support pricing analysis, budgeting, forecasting, sales account planning
fields.title: Financial Analyst
fields.skills:
Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in technical or business related field with excellent academic record from top tier university.
  • 1-3 years of experience in sales strategy & planning, financial planning & analysis, management consulting, investment banking, corporate strategy or equivalent experience
  • Working knowledge of ecommerce and digital marketing sectors preferable
  • Distinctive problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to manage large sets of data and articulate meaningful analyses
  • Demonstrated strong performance in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence
  • Superior financial modeling skills in Excel; Proficient in PowerPoint and SQL; Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques/tools is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required
  • Superior attention to detail and quality
  • Aptitude for financial and data analysis & reporting tools including planning systems, reporting applications, business intelligence software applications, etc.

fields.description:
Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world’s major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

Position Summary
The Associate will be a part of the Business Development and Strategic Initiatives team. The team reports directly into the Group President, Strategy and is responsible for mission critical global strategy projects.

The Associate will have visibility into the key strategic issues of the business comprising the majority of Visa’s revenue and gain exposure to senior leaders across the company. Example projects and responsibilities include developing a new merchant go-to-market strategy, regulatory response strategy, new product/platform strategy, and support of top client negotiations.

The team is comprised of individuals with experience at top tier consulting and banking firms who have made the transition to industry and continue to place a high premium on team work and critical thinking. The position will be based at Visa’s headquarters in Foster City, California (30 minutes south of San Francisco. Visa offers convenient complimentary shuttle service from several locations in the Bay Area).

Job Scope
Specific responsibilities include:
  • Lead or support analysis and strategic projects related to Visa Inc.'s business with a view across both mature and fast growing emerging markets
  • Engage with client facing teams to collaborate on business strategy development and analysis to support the card issuer and merchant sales process, potential strategic alliances, and/or other key client facing initiatives
  • Create, develop and manage executive level reporting to support C-Level decision making
  • Develop strong cross-functional and cross-regional relationships across the business
  • Team with the Corporate Strategy, Pricing, Interchange, Core Product, Emerging Product, and M&A groups on projects and for continuous training
  • Example projects: Product Growth Strategy, Go-to-Market Strategy, Business Model Strategy, Regulatory Business Response
  • Potential career path for this role includes moving into business (e.g. product, pricing) or senior roles in other strategy teams


    • Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree from top-tier institution or similar academic experience required
  • Management consulting, investment banking or equivalent analyst experience (2+ years required)
  • Superior analytical and problem solving skills along with willingness to learn the payments business
  • Ability to work independently within a complex and often ambiguous environment
  • Personal presence and ability to communicate clear, compelling messages in written and verbal communications
  • Ability to prioritize across multiple projects and responsibilities, with proven ability to analytically evaluate business performance information and synthesize it logically
  • Eagerness to work in teams at all levels and collaborate to accomplish project objectives
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to build credibility across all levels
  • Payments industry experience a plus, but not required
  • Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel
fields.title: Associate - Business Development & Strategic Initiatives

fields.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a driven and dynamic individual to join the Trading team and be responsible for creating, optimising, and maintaining sales planning and performance for NOW TV.

This is a high profile role with touch points across the business including; Marketing, Insight, and Finance, and will also work closely with the Business Science team of our media planning agency. The role will initially have line management responsibility for one commercial analyst

NOW TV is the new internet TV service from Sky, offering access to Sky content on a wide range of broadband-connected devices. NOW TV provides instant access to some of Sky’s most popular content, including hundreds of films from Sky Movies and for the first time ever, Sky Sports on a pay as you go basis with the new Day Pass. With a distinctive look and identity, it stands out from the existing Sky TV service and offers even more choice and flexibility to customers.

We are currently in an exciting period of rapid growth as we expand our product offering and routes to market in which we sell, and joining the NOW TV team at this early stage provides a real opportunity for individuals to directly contribute to the future success of the service.

You will own the sales performance and forecast for NOW TV; balancing plans, targets, budgets and performance across all our online and offline media channels to achieve the most efficient sales plan.

Planning
*Together with our media agency, utilise headroom insights and econometric analysis to forecast future quarter sales scenarios with different inputs.
*Use insight from previous quarters to inform future strategy and most efficient use of budgets and present rationale to the leadership team.
*Identify sales strategies and offer plans which deliver the best cost per acquisition and continuously improve this metric quarter on quarter.
*Provide input to the the annual and quarterly sales planning process, working closely with the marketing team and our media agency to pull together the overall sales plans for customer acquisition.
*Support finance in the budget management and forecasting cycle.

In Quarter Management
*Deliver accurate latest views for customer acquisition, providing detailed analysis of trends and variance.
*Build and maintain the sales plan to forecast and drive the repeat purchase rate of Sports passes by existing customers.
*Continuously review performance, anticipate issues and plan mitigation activity where required.
*Set up and run weekly trading meetings across departments to track and manage performance.
*Actively manage and optimise budgets in-quarter and re-allocate budgets to best performing activity where required.
*Provide a quarterly summary of performance across all key metrics and campaigns, to inform future planning.

The Trading Controller will need to have great analytical skills, attention to detail and an innate ability to spot trends within large amounts of information and data. You’ll have excellent communication skills and be able to present complex ideas simply. Previous team management experience is preferred but not essential.
It is essential that you have a proven track record of building sales plans to deliver sales targets, have the ability to present forecasts and sales activity and explain financial models to senior stakeholders. Knowledge of sales & marketing principles and sales pipelines is a must and it would be highly desirable if you had an understanding of digital marketing principles and web analytics and an understanding of multichannel attribution. Strong excel skills modelling and manipulation skills are key requirements.

On top of great training and development opportunities, discounted subscription TV, Broadband and Talk services, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlements, enhanced Maternity & Paternity benefits , contribution pension scheme, a share-save scheme, plus Sky Choices, a benefit scheme to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.

Sky delivers some of the most diverse content and services on the planet, and we value the same diversity within our business. We provide a culture of entrepreneurialism and opportunity for one and all.

It’s our people that make Sky the UK and Ireland' leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best

Believe in Better – Join In!

Due to the fast paced nature of Sky’s Businesses our vacancy close dates may be subject to change.
fields.title: Sales Trading Controller - NOW TV

fields.description:
Google accountants are a savvy bunch who handle the core accounting responsibilities at Google. As a member of this team, you know your accounting principles and the full accounting process end to end. You'll advise on financial reports required by governmental regulations, and you'll review, analyze, and interpret financial and budgetary reports -- and all this sounds like fun to you. Every day is a new challenge, and you're continually looking for ways to help our team get better at what we do, in the most efficient way possible. A team player at heart, you collaborate with our global team, evangelize best practices and roll up your sleeves to pitch in when it's all hands on deck. You move fast while keeping your attention to detail, and you tap into your problem-solving skills to support Google's business objectives.

You will join a team in the Accounting and Controls organization consisting of experienced, motivated, creative, self-sufficient performers. Our team handles the Revenue Accounting for all Google hardware products globally. We have a preference for those who are enthusiastic about working on a collaborative global team while performing a broad array of accounting activities. We also seek candidates that continually look to improve processes and find more efficient ways to utilize resources.

The Hardware Revenue Lead provides financial support and accountability for Google’s consumer hardware inventory which includes Chrome, Android, Enterprise, Glass and any other future hardware products. This individual will work closely with Product Areas, IT and Finance partners to ensure accurate revenue accounting of Google’s consumer hardware products.


Responsibilities
  • Establish worldwide processes for the tracking and accounting of consumer hardware revenue for different products (e.g. Android, Chrome, Google Glass, etc.) Send to BPO established or mature processes where appropriate.
  • Work with engineering and business partners to define and establish revenue/inventory accounting systems, processes and procedures in Oracle and billing systems with proper account mappings to the general ledger.
  • Work closely with technical accounting team to establish the appropriate accounting for our hardware business and help document the accounting policies for hardware.
  • Ensure cost effective performance and on-time delivery of information during monthly close cycle. Identify opportunities and implement programs to eliminate, automate or outsource activities for area.
  • Work closely with Operations, Tax, Product, Legal, IT and other Finance groups to identify partner needs and ensure high level of service. Prepare and present financial information to key business partners in the product area (i.e. variance analysis, gross margin analysis, etc.)



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance or Accounting or equivalent practical experience..
  • 5 years of relevant work experience, preferably in the high volume manufacturing industries.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • CPA and/or MBA.
  • Experience in hardware revenue accounting.
  • Demonstrated job stability with increasing levels of responsibility and a track record of successfully managing cross-functional initiatives.
  • Proven ability to work in a cross-functional, fast-paced environment, and to lead and drive complex operational initiatives.
  • Strong analytical skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate effectively with senior management.
  • Collaborative style and ability to work with cross functional teams and international teams.


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
fields.title: Hardware Revenue Accounting Lead

fields.description:
Director of Technical Accounting & SEC Reporting

The Manager of SEC Reporting and Technical Accounting will be a key member and the primary person responsible to ensure the company’s compliance with all technical accounting and SEC financial reporting requirements. The primary responsibility of this role is the development and management of the external reporting process including all required technical accounting support. This person will also partner with payroll for stock option/equity accounting.

Job Description:
* Responsible for the preparation of all SEC filings. This includes 10‐K, 10‐Q, 8‐K,
earnings releases including development of the company’s Financial Reporting Policies and Standards, and ensure they are in compliance with US GAAP
* Coordination with third party services providers to prepare documents for filing with the SEC and earnings release
* Support the external SEC filing process for the Company’s IPO effort and ensure quality and timeliness of the filing
* Responsible for researching and analyzing technical accounting issues and their application to internal and external reporting and US GAAP compliance. Summarize the resulting analysis and conclusion for both executive review and to record in the general ledger
* Take ownership to collaborate with other groups and/or departments to assess the reporting implications of changes in US GAAP, ensure compliance with new and/or amended standards/interpretations, coordinate changes, and ensure availability of requisite information for financial reporting
* Collaborate with business and FP&A to understand budget implications and implement planning strategy for accounting issues
* Support month end and quarter end close and related reporting
* Ensure compliance with FAS 123R as the primary owner of for stock‐based compensation accounting (including valuation and forecasting) and administration and collaborating with HR.
* Be assigned other special projects as required

Job Requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance; CPA required.
* Minimum 7-10 years’ experience with at least 2 years of experience at Big 4 public accounting firm, preferred.
* Demonstrated proficiency in SEC reporting and accounting research.
* Strong project management, leadership, relationship development and people management skills.
* Results orientation with an ability to manage the overall project, collaborate with different individuals across the organization, and “roll‐up the sleeves” in order to accomplish all necessary tasks.
* Technology and Real Estate industry experience preferred.



*MON
fields.title: Sr. Manager of Technical Accounting & SEC Reporting

fields.description:
FP&A BPC ADMINISTRATOR / FINANCIAL ANALYST #1624151

The Corporate Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) organization leads the company-wide financial forecasting, budgeting and reporting processes. This organization also provides analytics to support decision making, benchmarking, and improve business results. Our finance FP&A team has the critical role for a Business Systems Analyst to support our Financial Systems, SAP Business Objects Planning (BPC) financial forecasting and reporting system. Additionally, this person will also provide support to the Corp FP&A team with financial forecasting and reporting processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- SAP BPC Finance System administrator responsible for maintaining the financial models, security and all system administrations roles
- Maintain Nvidia's BPC Database which includes Models for Labor Planning, OPEX, Capital Spending, Product Development (Non Labor R&D Costs), Supply Demand Optimization, Profit and Loss.
- Partner with Finance, IT and other stakeholders organizations assessing finance system process issues, identifying improvements, and implementing new solutions.
* Leveraging existing finance systems, support new biz model development, financial modeling and derive necessary changes.
* Drive process innovation activities to improve FP&A forecasting accuracy and efficiency. (ex: Inventory reserve/release forecasting)
* SDO - Administer/improve product margin forecasting process using Supply Demand Optimizer Engine. Analyze BU finance report requirement and work with IT to develop more BI reports.
* Revenue Recognition System Upgrade to latest offering
- Communicate and execute BPC finance system updates, monthly forecasting and reporting process support requirements.
- Develop and maintain user BPC documentation (Ex. inputs sheets, reports, templates, etc.) for system users, and provide training on SAP BPC software to system stakeholders.
- Provide forecasting, reporting and analytical support to Corp FP&A, as needed, for our Corporate and Business Unit P&Ls, Operating Expenses, Capital Spending, and Headcount Planning.
- Become knowledgeable of all Nvidia Financial Systems SAP R/3, BW, Product Costing, FI/CO, HR systems which interface with Finance systems

REQUIRED SKILLS:
- Superuser in the use of OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) database software tools, such as BPC.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Must be able to summarize complex and technical issues / analysis into simple and clear messaging for senior management.
- Strong financial analytical and modeling skills
- Proactive and independent person who identifies issues and drives them to resolution
- Demonstrated ability to establish effective relationships at all levels of an organization.
- Ability to prioritize and organize assignments and execute in a fast paced environment.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
- Bachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, Computer and Information Sciences, Management Information Systems, or related field.
- Strong financial systems background and expertise.
- 4 yrs. Financial Systems experience with SAP Data warehouse and forecasting tools (at least one of the following&BPC, Hyperion, Business Objects, Cognos).
- SAP FI/CO, BPC implementation experience
- SAP BW/BO super user level experience
- IT system project or process improvement project leadership experience.

EOE

fields.description:
The Senior Financial Analyst is responsible for efficiently providing detailed analytical support to senior management to improve business performance.  The person in this position provides financial and operational analytics, budgeting and forecasting, trend analysis, business insights, qualitative assessment of risks and opportunities, and recommendations based on advanced financial analysis. Serves as a strategic thought partner to senior management team for financial operations of the business.                                                                                                          

ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
• Act as a trusted advisor and thought partner to assigned areas of the business.
• Report on actual financial and operational performance against targets and provide variance analysis and guidance on future trends. 
• Ensure key business performance risks, issues, and opportunities are highlighted to management.
• Prepare robust and meaningful budgets and forecasts, integrated with core business strategy, targets, and processes.
• Act as an advocate and role model for understanding revenue, cost and profitability drivers – both at a corporate and client level.
• Drive processes to improve efficiencies and reduce time spent on low-value activities so that more time can be spent creating value for business partners and ultimately, shareholders.
• Generate insight and drive outcomes by challenging assumptions, scoping and framing problems, and analyzing and delivering solutions. 
• Influence strong cross-functional communications and enhance efficiencies by leading teams through process improvement efforts.
• Actively engage in the ongoing improvement of TriNet’s financial, planning and business intelligence systems.
• Provide support to other Finance departments and functions, such as Accounting, during month end close and external audits.
• Perform ad-hoc projects, analytics and provide recommendations as identified by management team.

JOB REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Education: Master’s degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or related field
Training Requirements (licenses, programs, or certificates): None
Experience:
• Minimum 8-10 years’ experience in in a similar environment, directly supporting senior management (both financial and operational management)
• Experience defining and communicating requirements for finance processes and working with developers to implement and update financial applications 
• Experience in Public company
Other Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Working knowledge of MS Office applications: Advanced in Excel, Intermediate in PowerPoint, and Basic in Word
• Strong knowledge of Essbase, Hyperion Planning, Hyperion Strategic Finance, PeopleSoft Financials preferred
• Excellent verbal, written, presentation and facilitation skills
• Ability to communicate with employees at all levels of the organization
• Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
• Excellent collaborative partnering work style
• Customer-focused
• A demonstrated commitment to high professional ethical standards and a diverse workplace
• Ability to adapt to a fast paced continually changing business and work environment while managing multiple priorities

WORK ENVIRONMENT/OTHER INFORMATION (Travel required, physical requirements, on-call schedules, etc.)
• Some travel required (5-25%)
• Overtime as required (0-25 hours per month)
• Work in clean, pleasant, and comfortable office setting
• Noise level in the environment is usually moderate
• The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

This role offers you the opportunity to partner with the sales team and become an expert on our ads products (Search, Display, Mobile). You will work side by side with the Sales Strategy team for your respective area and enable decision making through appropriate analysis. You will also act as a key advisor to sales management on issues related to market investment strategies, business profitability, and resource allocation.


Responsibilities
  • Provide executive management with clear insights into drivers of revenue, risks, and opportunities.
  • Develop analyses/tools to track revenue for Google’s properties to better understand the drivers of that revenue.
  • Partner with leaders in sales organization to understand sales drivers of revenue, build tools that create accountability against agreed objectives and implement methodologies to measure success.



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree in CS, EE, Math, Economics, Finance or related quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant experience, specific expertise with time series analysis and large scale data systems.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured environment; comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Desire to attack large, complex problems.
  • Proficiency with spreadsheets and presentation software.
  • Prior software programming experience and/or skill with scripting languages.


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst, Display Advertising

fields.description:
Job Summary:

Reporting to a senior manager within Enterprise Risk Reporting & Analysis (ERRA), the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Analyst will advance the Bank’s Risk Management culture, structure, processes and tools in support of the bank’s Risk Vision. This position is part of a team of risk professionals responsible for supporting the Bank’s Enterprise Risk Management framework, which may also include validation of its effectiveness. 

 

This Enterprise Risk Management Analyst is expected to provide expertise and analysis to the Enterprise Risk Reporting & Analysis (ERRA) team in one or more of the following areas:   Risk Identification, Risk Inventory and Risk Appetite; Basel/Advanced Approaches for bank regulatory capital; ICAAP, CCAR and Stress-Testing; bank risk and capital regulation and regulatory supervision; financial institution enterprise risk and capital management processes and tools, including GRC tools; and similar expertise.

 

The Enterprise Risk Management Analyst will assist the ERRA team in the design, development, implementation and execution of the strategy, processes and tools necessary to operationalize and enhance the Bank’s Enterprise Risk Management framework in collaboration with ERRA team members and with other groups across the Bank.  Additionally, the person in this role will gather, analyze, aggregate and report on risk data and information to senior management. The work of the Enterprise Risk Management Analyst may span across all risk types throughout the Enterprise.

 

Major Responsibilities:

 

ERM Analysis:

With some direction from management, this position will:

  • Develop, implement and maintain ongoing risk analyses to ERRA and other Bank senior management.
  • Lead key aspects of designing, developing, implementing and maintaining policies, processes, systems, tools and reporting to support and enhance the Enterprise Risk Management Framework. 
  • Lead key aspects of ERM validation program including facilitation of self-assessments of Basel/Advanced Approaches capabilities by key Advanced Systems process owners across the Bank.
  • Lead workshops, meetings and other forums for coordination and information-gathering with appropriate parties across the Bank.
  • Develop solutions to analytical, implementation, and/or execution problems.
  • Identify, analyze and map key ERM and/or ICAAP processes end-to-end.
  • Use the Bank’s GRC tool to support key deliverables, including: extracting and analyzing relevant data from the tool; populating data and analysis appropriately in the GRC tool; and managing/maintaining ERRA data and applications within the GRC tool.
  • Evaluate, document, support and understand team deliverables and how they relate to the Enterprise Risk Management initiatives.

 

 

Reporting:

With some direction from management, this position will:

  • Liaise with Risk Owners across the Bank to collect information to support ERM functions, such as risk measures for various risk categories.
  • Gather, analyze, aggregate and report on key enterprise risk information to ERRA and other Bank senior management.
  • Design, develop, prepare and maintain periodic risk reports or presentations to keep all levels of management abreast of key risk levels, trends, strategies, and potential issues.

 

Projects:

With some direction from management, this position will:

  • Lead and participate in ERM-related projects and assist the ERRA group in project execution.
  • Provide project management, problem resolution and comprehensive analysis and direction for multiple concurrent mission critical projects.
  • Work to assure project deliverables and goals are met or exceeded.  
  • Define project plan(s) to meet the project goals and objectives as established by Executive Management.
  • Use Bank approved project management techniques to track progress against planned targets throughout the lifecycle of the project.
  • Prepare periodic project status reports or presentations to keep all levels of management abreast of key milestones, alternatives and potential risks.

 

Documentation:

With some direction from management, this position will:

  • Generate and maintain key ERM documentation including documentation to support compliance with regulatory requirements, stress testing models, and other documentation as needed. 
  • Maintain inventories of key ERM information, such as risk models used for ICAAP purposes or risk and capital related regulatory issuances, and other information inventories as assigned.
  • Manage records, data and documentation for regulatory communication.
  • Generate and maintain documentation and process management to support the bank's qualification for US Advanced Approaches for regulatory capital.

fields.description:
Financial Analyst

Prepares and maintains financial models and reports for the shared services divisions. These include CFO, IT and CMO. Generates new financial models (may design from existing template or create from scratch) and reports with oversight from Manager. Manages information for reports, models, and special projects. Works on financial planning and the preparation of operating budgets.

Essential Functions

The Financial Analyst supports the Operation Finance Managers II teams by: (i) driving month-end close activities through reviewing expense accruals/prepays (ii) financial review of new SOWs/ contracts and purchase requisition/PO set-up (iii) supporting the Shared Services Divisions planning processes i.e. forecasts updates and tactical plans (v) financial performance reporting and variance analysis (vi) actively leads/participates in process improvement projects within the Operation Finance team.

  1. Prepare monthly financial reports and variance analysis comparing actuals to latest forecast and budget, and provide insight into remaining forecasted spend and other ad hoc analysis to understand trends and activities. Explain variance comments on the pre-close reports for the assigned divisions and prepare/research follow up variance questions for the controller’s group. Prepare the monthly Business Performance Report (BPR) for review and publication.
  2. Develop reporting, automating processes wherever possible, manage and reconcile data from multiple sources, provide reporting (quarterly forecasts, operational plan, budget, actuals, variance tracking, etc.) to cost center/budget managers and executives.
  3. Support the Operational expense Planning and Budgeting process working to provide key information, tools, analysis, insights, etc. to the organization influencing the development of overall objectives and goals of the division. Provide analysis of key assumptions during the planning process and review plans and budgets for consistency.
  4. Help to develop presentation materials for managers and must be able to help identify and frame important issues, include appropriate content, as well as refine existing presentations.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Self- starter with impeccable ethics and integrity, as well as proven communication skills, verbal and written, with a clear ability to effectively communicate amongst different levels of the organization.
  • Strong analytical skills to effectively interpret problems and develop solutions
  • Advance knowledge in the use and development of financial models.
  • Strong interpersonal and inter-departmental skills that support effective relationship with team and other departments.
  • Experience in preparing monthly financial management reports using Hyperion
  • Demonstrated ability to work within tight deadlines and timelines, with proven experience in meeting goals on time.

3-5 yrs of experience in finance or related area required. Bachelors degree with emphasis on Business Admin, Finance, or Accounting or equivalent experience and education required. Experience supporting the G&A functions highly desired. Excellent analytical, reporting, data manipulation and problem solving skills required. Advance PC modeling skills. Excellent communication skills required.

fields.description:
Sr. Treasury Analyst

ID 2013-2045 Job Location US-CA-San Francisco

Category Accounting/Finance

Options:
- Apply for this job online
- Email this job to a friend

Socialize this job opportunity to a friend, colleague, or family member:

More information about this job:
Overview:

Join the leader in entertainment innovation and help us design the future. At Dolby, science meets art, and high tech means more than computer code. As a member of the Dolby team, you’ll see and hear the results of your work everywhere, from movie theaters to smartphones. We continue to revolutionize how people create, deliver, and enjoy entertainment worldwide. To do that, we need the absolute best talent, including professionals in finance, the backbone of the company. We’re big enough to give you all the resources you need, and small enough so you can make a real difference and earn recognition for your work. We offer a collegial culture, challenging projects, and excellent compensation and benefits.

This position plays a key role in Dolby’s Treasury Operations. The Senior Treasury Analyst will support all aspects of Treasury operations, cash, foreign exchange and investment management activities.

In this position, you will work collaboratively on all projects with other Dolby’s Finance functions in an effort to scale the Treasury infrastructure in a growing business while still responding quickly and soundly to day-to-day needs. In a Sarbanes-Oxley environment, process controls and discipline are essential. The person in this role should be familiar with Treasury systems and controls that provide accurate and timely information within the bounds of regulatory compliance

Responsibilities:
- Execute daily Treasury operations activities for global cash management and short-term investments. Oversee global daily cash position and monitor global cash status, including short-term investing of excess cash. Execute wire transfers for Treasury related transactions
- Oversee the investment of Dolby’s corporate cash and manage external portfolio managers, establish performance benchmarks and review results with management
- Monitor daily compliance for Dolby’s investment portfolios
- Manage the Custodian’s relationship and prepare monthly/quarterly investment reports for accounting and management
- Prepare short term cash forecast and interest income forecast
- Design, implement, and operate treasury operations processes, taking into considerations of best practices and business needs
- Work with Accounting and Audit to ensure accurate and timely reporting of cash and investments
- Serve as primary liaison between A/P, A/R, Payroll, and the bank service providers
- Assist in day to day insurance risk management activities
- Develop and maintain Treasury policies and procedures
*LIaise with External Reporting on footnotes and disclosures for Treasury investment and foreign exchange sections of SEC filings
*LIaise with IT to oversee company’s banking platform. Ensure the setup meets SOX and applicable policy.
- Participate or lead the implementation of various Treasury systems

Qualifications:
- A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in business finance or accounting. CTP/CCM qualification is preferred
- A minimum of 5 to 6 years finance experience, preferably in domestic and international Treasury with a multinational company
- Must have a basic accounting knowledge and an excellent understanding of macroeconomics including financial markets, financial instruments and investment theory. A strong knowledge of Treasury related FASB is preferred
- Possess knowledge of banking and treasury systems. Prior experience with SAP is a plus
- Must be a critical thinker with attention to details who can seek innovative solutions to complex business/technical issues
- Must be a self-starter, have own initiatives, and possess strong prioritization and organization skills. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and can handle multiple projects simultaneously
- Must have good verbal, written, and presentation skills to articulate ideas and plans clearly, accurately, and effectively with all levels of internal and external audiences
- Must be a team player adept at facilitating an open exchange of ideas and know how to build win/win relationships

fields.description:
About Schwab:

 

Charles Schwab has been a leader in financial services for over four decades, working to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable to all. Driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity, we’re committed to providing an environment that respects and appreciates the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. Our goal, as seen through clients' eyes, is that Schwab continuously improves on being a premier financial service provider through best in class service, technology, products, people and advice.

Organizational Objective:

 

The Information Security Risk Management (ISRM) Strategy team is responsible for establishing the strategy and defining the policies, processes, and procedures to govern the CS&Co. Information Security (IS) function; conducting the annual Risk Assessment (RA) and ensuring compliance with the Policy across the organization.  We collaborate with other IS teams to influence and monitor the progress of significant IS-related initiatives.  We also maintain regular communications with Executive management and the organization's Board of Directors to demonstrate that the IS program continues to perform effectively and efficiently over time.

Brief Description of Role:

 

Our Information Security Risk Team is looking for an Analyst to support their growing team.  The Risk Analyst will be responsible for the firm wide Annual Risk Assessment (RA).  The RA is a key driver of the Information Security program and provides a lens for what future priorities across the organization should be.

The primary responsibilities of the Analyst will include, but not be limited to: 

  • executing the annual Risk Assessment process;
  • gathering information including interviewing staff members;
  • analyzing the resulting data;
  • compiling a draft version of the Risk Assessment report;
  • evaluating software tools that can be used to automate the process over time;
  • providing consulting services in support or RA efforts that are underway at Schwab Bank and other subsidiaries.  

This is an individual contributor role reporting into the Managing Director of Information Security Risk Management.
fields.title: Information Security Risk Analyst - Risk Assessment
fields.skills:
Qualifications:

The following qualifications are required;

  • At least 5 year experience as an Information Security practitioner.
  • Experience using IS Risk Assessment technologies such as Archer GRC and OpenPages.
  • Experience working with IS Risk Assessment methodologies such as ISO 27005.
  • Experience working with IS control frameworks such as ISO 27001/27002, PCI DSS, or NIST 800-53.
  • Experience with implementation of IS best practices for key areas such as network controls, including IS concepts in all phases of the software development life cycle, logical access controls and data protection.
  • Experience interfacing with auditors in support of audits and external regulatory exam processes.
  • Experience evaluating audit reports, network penetration test results, application security assessments and regulatory exams to determine remediation priorities.
  • Ability to effectively communicate with technical and executive audiences, both oral and written.

The following qualifications are preferred;

  • CISSP, CISA, CISM, SANS GIAC or equivalent certification is desirable
  • Experience with Archer GRC and OpenPages.

fields.description:
Marin Software is seeking a Sr. Financial Analyst to join the Finance team, supporting Sales & Business Operations team. The analyst will report to the FP&A Manager – Revenue Analytics with a dotted line into sales organization and work closely with Marin executives across account management, sales, client services, marketing and finance.

We are seeking an individual who is passionate about turning data into actionable insights that would influence operational and strategic goals by which to drive the growth of our business. This critical role will deliver the business analysis and models to support strategic and tactical decisions of how Marin Software sells products and delivers service to the largest advertisers and digital agencies. You will work directly with internal clients and manage the entire end-to-end process of defining, developing and automating/streamlining a solution to meet these analytical needs. The scope of this role will also include data collection from various systems, ad hoc analysis, reporting, and creation of executive level presentations to share progress of business health specifically with Sales, Account Management, Support, Marketing and Finance.

This is a unique and great opportunity to join Marin Software, the leading online advertising management platform solutions provider. The role will have significant career growth opportunities in addition to having the ability to make a real impact to the business and see results of one’s work immediately taking effect.

Responsibilities:

  • Work closely with Finance, Sales and Account Management team to define analytic requirements and needs to develop data collection techniques, analysis, reports, dashboards and methods to present metrics and key insights that evaluate Marin Software user trends, revenue, customer satisfaction surveys, and other business related performance needs.

Specific projects include:

  • Forecast revenue and related key metrics by analyzing trends and business insights from the sales team, and other key stakeholders
  • Scope, collect, analyze, evaluate and report on Marin Software revenue and service trends
  • Perform ad hoc analysis to answer business questions and evaluate strategic opportunities
  • Develop and maintain forecasting dashboards based on seasonality, growth, and up-sell (ROI Analysis)
  • Develop financial models to highlight opportunities with key strategic initiatives such as increase revenue, increase margin

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Math or other quantitative fields
  • 5-7 years progressive financial analysis experience with some focus on revenue analytics
  • Strong Excel skills required. Must be comfortable with creating and maintaining complex financial models and developing business metrics
  • Intermediate to Advanced experience working in Tableau, Access, Word, and PowerPoint
  • Experience with forecasting and statistical modeling and analysis
  • Ability to write own SQL code to extract, manipulate, and analyze data across multiple online or offline databases a plus
  • Experience creating and developing automated reports and dashboards
  • Proven track record of tackling complex business questions, mining data, and generating business relevant insights that are communicated in a simple to consume and thorough fashion
  • Comfortable sharing analysis insights and key findings to internal clients and executives
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to quickly identify and resolve data issues/needs

Key Competencies:

  • Proven organizational skills to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines effectively
  • Able to present complex ideas concisely
  • Able to evangelize and commercialize one’s work, thought, and methodologies
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent communicator/information sharer
  • Problem/Solution oriented

Must be independent, self-motivated and success-driven, and willing to work in a team environment

Compensation

This is an on-site, full time salaried position located in the financial district of San Francisco, (one block from Bart station). Marin Software pays market-leading compensation based on prior experience. In addition to providing a great work environment, Marin Software provides Equity participation, pays 90% of comprehensive health plans (medical, vision and dental), along with a generous PTO.

About Marin Software
Marin provides a leading revenue acquisition management platform used by advertisers and agencies to manage more than billion in annualized ad spend. Offering an integrated platform for search, social, display, and mobile advertising, Marin helps advertisers and agencies improve financial performance, save time, and make better decisions. Headquartered in San Francisco, with offices worldwide, Marin's technology powers marketing campaigns in more than 160 countries. For more information about Marin’s products, please visit: http://www.marinsoftware.com/solutions/overview . Marin's common stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol MRIN.

Title: Software Engineer (UI Framework) Department:  Platform       

Location:  Sunnyvale, CA

 

Company Overview

 

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

 

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billion dollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

 

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

 

  • Interesting, collaborative work with some of the best folks in the Bay Area
  • 21 paid PTO days
  • 10 holidays + winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day – all paid!
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
    • Bright, sunny, and spacious offices in central Sunnyvale with free parking, Caltrain shuttle, and transit subsidy
    • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
    • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.  


Duties and Responsibilities

Your job will be to play a critical role in the development of the future of the Ariba UI framework.

You will help build the core components of the framework, including AribaWeb (Ariba’s open-source core UI framework, more at www.aribaweb.org), the Ariba Dashboard, and the Ariba Administration framework. Day-to-day your job will be to work with a close, tight-knit team of talented and experienced developers to prototype, build, iterate on and ship, great code. The kind of person we are seeking is high-energy and fun, quick-witted and curious and an excellent problem-solver and an awesome team-player.

•               Passion for UI development, UI “smarts” and a bias toward building frameworks

•               Excellent communication skills

•               BS or MS in CS or equivalent

fields.description:
Summary of Role

The Director of Technical Accounting & Reporting is responsible for external / internal reporting, the oversight of the close process, maintaining technical accounting policies, and evaluating / documenting new technical accounting matters.  The Director will also work closely with preparation of S-1 filing and, thereafter, be responsible for all SEC filings. On an ongoing basis, individual will oversee the Company’s accounting for stock based compensation and equity transactions.  The individual will also oversee the hedge accounting program.

 

This positions reports to the Vice President, Controller.

 

Specific Responsibilities of Role

  • Manage the year-end audit / quarterly reviews with external auditors.
  • Manage close calendar and the monthly financial review process.
  • Implementation of controls for the financial reporting, equity and hedge accounting function.
  • Compile S-1 filing in conjunction with Controller, CFO, Internal Audit, legal team, and any advisory groups.
  • Develop monthly and quarterly management reporting package.
  • Oversee application of hedge accounting program.  Work with Treasury to monitor  portfolio and maintain reporting to support disclosures.
  • Research and draft accounting memos on complex accounting matters.
  • Prepare financial information for quarterly earnings release.
  • Maintain documentation of accounting policies.  Evaluate impact of any new pronouncements on existing policies or practices.
  • Prepare earnings per share calculations.
  • Prepare monthly stock based compensation and related disclosures.
fields.title: Director, Technical Accounting & Reporting
fields.skills:
Required Experience

  • Total Accounting Experience.  10+ years of accounting experience (required).
  • Public Accounting Experience.  3+ years of Public Accounting experience (required).  Big 4 experience (preferred).
  • CPA License.  Active CPA license (required).
  • Technical Accounting Research Experience.  Deep understanding of technical accounting research (required).
  • Internal / External Reporting Experience.  Internal and external reporting experience (required).
  • S-1 Filing Experience.  Experience with S-1 filings (required). 
  • SEC Experience.  Prior experience preparing SEC filings for public companies or prior experience reviewing SEC filings in public accounting (required).
  • Hedge Accounting Experience.  Experience with hedge accounting (required).
  • Equity / Stock Compensation Experience.  Previous technical experience with equity transactions and stock based compensation (required). Previous experience with Equity Edge (preferred).
  • Derivatives Experience.  Prior experience with commodities derivatives (preferred).

Location: San Jose, CA, United States
Type of Employee: Full Time

Vocera empowers integrated, intelligent communication for mission-critical workflows in healthcare, hospitality, energy, retail and other mobile work environments. One of the fastest growing mobile technology companies, Vocera is widely recognized for developing smarter ways to communicate that improve patient and customer satisfaction. Exclusively endorsed by the American Hospital Association, Vocera® Voice Communication, Secure Messaging, and Vocera Care Experience solutions are installed in more than 1,000 organizations worldwide. Vocera is headquartered in San Jose, Calif., with offices in Tennessee, Canada, and the United Kingdom. For more information, visit www.vocera.com and @VoceraCom on Twitter.
 
Position Description:  Vocera is seeking a Manager, Accounting to become a key member of the Finance team.  In this position, you will be primarily responsible for the day-to-day general accounting requirements including: supervising staff, managing  AP, fixed asset and general ledger systems, etc.  You will be the accounting lead on our Sarbanes Oxley implementation.  This position reports to the Director, Accounting.
 
Responsibilities

  • Oversee and ensure accurate and timely monthly close process, including the preparation and review of journal entries, account reconciliations, and analysis
  •  Oversee accounting procedures and internal controls (implementing, monitoring, and enhancing), including systems access controls and minimizing segregation of duties issues
  • Oversee fixed assets and accounts payable function, including the review and posting of vendor invoices
  • Develop, maintain, and ensure our technical accounting policy, procedures and internal controls are in accordance with US GAAP
  • Drive the design, implementation and maintenance of SOX 404 to ensure compliance with accounting and control systems
  • Prepare monthly consolidated financial statements, including all international operations
  • Prepare year-end audit, tax schedules, footnotes and assist in the preparation of other reports as required

fields.description:
As a Financial Analyst you provide financial support and/or analysis in budgeting, planning, business processes, or reporting to a portion of a functional organization or to more senior finance staff. You will perform economic research and studies and financial modeling to help future business planning decisions, and create reports and summaries as required by corporate procedure or compliance regulations. You will interface with cross-functional peers and managers and have an opportunity to contribute across various business challenges. In this entry-level role, you will have the opportunity to build customer service and financial analysis skills as you contribute directly to department goals and deliverables.
We are seeking full time University hires that are pursuing or possess a degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or an equivalent degree with a tentative start date of May/June 2014. These positions are located in our Sunnyvale, CA.

Essential Functions:
- The Financial Analysts role has responsibility for a wide range of financial support and analysis tasks. You will help to ensure that departmental objectives and project deadlines are met. The essential functions of the department include:
- Prepare and drive operational and financial metrics in support of key decision making.
- Participate in projects related to financial systems or business processes.
- Gather, analyze, prepare and summarize recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.
- Work with cross-functional groups to provide technical support to business units including:
- Forecasting
- Budgeting
- Variance analysis
- Cost analysis
- Product pricing
- Financial/Tax reporting
- Regulatory/compliance analysis and reporting
- May focus on an area of specialization.
- Integrate financial processes and operations of the business.

Job Requirements
Requirements:
- Good written and verbal communication skills.
- Good interpersonal communication skills as needed to work successfully with staff and managers within and outside of function.
- Strong analytical skills and ability to work both independently and on cross functional teams.
- Ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization, including remote areas.
- Ability to function well in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with competing priorities.
- Ability to work in a project based environment.
- Ability to follow standard accounting and finance practices, and departmental procedures and processes.
- Strong Microsoft Office skills including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint.

Responsibility and Interaction:
Responsibility:
- The types of tasks this individual is responsible for are well defined and utilize and build understanding of standard principals and practices within a team environment.

Interaction:
- This individual interacts primarily with their direct manager and the technical team on assigned projects, and may communicate with employees in other functions as required.
- Regular and detailed direction is provided, as well as on-going review of activities and priorities.
- The ideal candidate will be an important contributor to team projects.

Education and Experience
- Must be pursuing or possess a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or an equivalent degree with a tentative start date of May/June 2014.
- No prior experience is required. Most new employees in this position have 0-2 years of experience.
- Generally, a Financial Analyst at this level is learning the practical basics of field in an environment where they can be an important contributor.

fields.description:
Requirements Risk Management Credit Strategies Manager

Summary:
Responsible for overseeing and developing strategic credit policies for managing the bank’s credit risk. Directs the execution of developed credit strategies and risk mitigation activities. Ensures proprietary models used to devise and initiate stress tests measure the impact of economic and other variables on the credit portfolios.

Responsibilities:
1. Creates proprietary models such as: loss forecasting models for multiple asset classes (i.e. C&I, CRE, credit card, autos) for used for estimating and forecasting the impact of the macroeconomic environment on credit performance; top-down econometric models driven by macro factors; and/or bottom-up fundamental models will be constructed depending on suitability.
2. Synthesizes market data and internal portfolio data in forming a credit outlook. Ensures this outlook is communicated and debated with both risk and line of business executives. Guides senior management towards applying a singular view on credit that will improve internal consistency in strategic decision-making.
3. Identifies emerging credit risks and implements transactions (both in cash and synthetic markets) that reduce default risk and enhance return relative to risk within the portfolio.
4. Develops core set of surveillance tools to identify deteriorating portfolios, excess concentrations and low risk-adjusted return businesses.
5. Advises business partners in Scenario Planning. Develops multiple scenario descriptions and estimates the impact on the firm’s credit portfolio under each. Regularly discusses findings with senior management and business partners. Works closely with Treasury on scenario planning to ensure specific actions are developed to respond to a scenario should it arise.
6. Assists in the development of House Limits (i.e. by asset class, industry, geography, single-name, product, etc.)
7. Covers asset classes at the bank, both commercial and consumer and all credit risk, both loan and non-loan (i.e. loans, bonds, structured securities).
fields.title: Risk Management Credit Strategies Manager

• 7+ years experience in credit risk management
• Management experience; will supervise a team of 2+ professional staff
• Aptitude for credit market valuations and exposure to portfolio analysis or quantitative portfolio modeling
• Experience with credit capital markets; particularly credit default swaps, bank loans, fixed income or structured credit products
• Proficient at working with, and analyzing, large relational databases
• Bachelor’s Degree required
• Required license(s) or certifications Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) preferred

What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.

fields.description:
As a key contributor to our engagement teams, you will apply your educational background and the experience obtained from public accounting to some of the most exciting clients in the world. You will take direction from other, more experienced members of the team as you assist in problem solving and adding value by preparing our clients with an IPO, M&A transaction or an audit. You will be involved with various technical accounting projects, including revenue recognition, equity accounting, technical memos, audit preparation and writing technical accounting policies. A Senior/Staff may also be involved in S-1 drafting, research and improving close processes. We rely heavily on our seniors/staff and expect a high degree of professionalism and responsibility as we carry out the highest quality of professional service our clients require and demand.

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Add value through complex transactions including IPOs, M&A, Reverse Mergers, etc.
  • Add value to clients to successfully prepare and complete audits
  • Add value to public and private clients by assisting in any of the following:
    • Detailed revenue analysis and revenue recognition
    • Equity – stock compensation (FAS 123R), warrant accounting and EPS
    • Draft or review complex sets of financial statements with disclosures
    • SEC Reporting, including 10K, 10Q and other filings
    • Support of quarterly or month-end closes
    • Identification and application of technical accounting guidance to client situations
    • Global accounting activities including IFRS, foreign currency and consolidations
    • Apply knowledge and understanding of governing principles, apply these principles to client transactions and communicate an understanding and application of these principles
    • Identify, analyze and discuss generally accepted accounting principles for the client, when necessary, with the Manager, Senior Manager and engagement partner

Identify complex accounting issues and bring them to the attention of engagement leaders for resolution

The Sr. Financial Analyst has ownership of business partner relationships with Lifecycle Leaders and their teams.  This individual will partner with different functional groups (Marketing, Pricing & HECON, Project Management, Research, Development, Operations, and Medical Affairs) to deliver information that enables a thorough understanding of project costs and product expectations.  This includes but is not limited to project planning and resource analysis, preparation of detailed risk assessments, understanding of underlying assumptions, and revenue forecasting. The Sr. Financial Analyst is expected to present findings and provide recommendations to key stakeholders. 
 

In addition, this role works as a member of the Business Area Finance team to facilitate decision making through sales reporting, target setting and forecast support, and long-range business planning.  Together with the team this individual maintains an overall awareness of company performance and direction to keep business partners and leadership aware of financial risks and opportunities.  Further areas for contribution include methodology enhancement, process improvement, and special projects.

You will be uniquely positioned to not only lead our accounting department but also apply your strengths to other areas of the company, opening doors to other potential roles in operations or general management. As we continue our rapid growth, you will enjoy a dynamic and constantly evolving role with plenty of potential for future advancement.

The Senior Financial Analyst plays a key role in providing financial insights and business decision-making support as well as driving process improvements and day-to-day analytical and forecasting support for the company. The candidate will report directly to the Director, FP&A and support the company’s overall financial reporting, long-range planning and expense management activities. While this person will have direct responsibility within the finance functions, this role will require collaboration with leaders and staff in areas across Blurb’s functional groups to develop actionable metrics and recommendations.

fields.description:
We have an exciting opportunity for a driven and dynamic individual to join the Trading team and be responsible for creating, optimising, and maintaining sales planning and performance for NOW TV.

This is a high profile role with touch points across the business including; Marketing, Insight, and Finance, and will also work closely with the Business Science team of our media planning agency. The role will initially have line management responsibility for one commercial analyst

NOW TV is the new internet TV service from Sky, offering access to Sky content on a wide range of broadband-connected devices. NOW TV provides instant access to some of Sky’s most popular content, including hundreds of films from Sky Movies and for the first time ever, Sky Sports on a pay as you go basis with the new Day Pass. With a distinctive look and identity, it stands out from the existing Sky TV service and offers even more choice and flexibility to customers.

We are currently in an exciting period of rapid growth as we expand our product offering and routes to market in which we sell, and joining the NOW TV team at this early stage provides a real opportunity for individuals to directly contribute to the future success of the service.

You will own the sales performance and forecast for NOW TV; balancing plans, targets, budgets and performance across all our online and offline media channels to achieve the most efficient sales plan.

Planning
*Together with our media agency, utilise headroom insights and econometric analysis to forecast future quarter sales scenarios with different inputs.
*Use insight from previous quarters to inform future strategy and most efficient use of budgets and present rationale to the leadership team.
*Identify sales strategies and offer plans which deliver the best cost per acquisition and continuously improve this metric quarter on quarter.
*Provide input to the the annual and quarterly sales planning process, working closely with the marketing team and our media agency to pull together the overall sales plans for customer acquisition.
*Support finance in the budget management and forecasting cycle.

In Quarter Management
*Deliver accurate latest views for customer acquisition, providing detailed analysis of trends and variance.
*Build and maintain the sales plan to forecast and drive the repeat purchase rate of Sports passes by existing customers.
*Continuously review performance, anticipate issues and plan mitigation activity where required.
*Set up and run weekly trading meetings across departments to track and manage performance.
*Actively manage and optimise budgets in-quarter and re-allocate budgets to best performing activity where required.
*Provide a quarterly summary of performance across all key metrics and campaigns, to inform future planning.

The Trading Controller will need to have great analytical skills, attention to detail and an innate ability to spot trends within large amounts of information and data. You’ll have excellent communication skills and be able to present complex ideas simply. Previous team management experience is preferred but not essential.
It is essential that you have a proven track record of building sales plans to deliver sales targets, have the ability to present forecasts and sales activity and explain financial models to senior stakeholders. Knowledge of sales & marketing principles and sales pipelines is a must and it would be highly desirable if you had an understanding of digital marketing principles and web analytics and an understanding of multichannel attribution. Strong excel skills modelling and manipulation skills are key requirements.

On top of great training and development opportunities, discounted subscription TV, Broadband and Talk services, private medical insurance, generous holiday entitlements, enhanced Maternity & Paternity benefits , contribution pension scheme, a share-save scheme, plus Sky Choices, a benefit scheme to help you make valuable tax and national insurance savings.

Sky delivers some of the most diverse content and services on the planet, and we value the same diversity within our business. We provide a culture of entrepreneurialism and opportunity for one and all.

It’s our people that make Sky the UK and Ireland' leading entertainment company. That’s why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best

Believe in Better – Join In!

Due to the fast paced nature of Sky’s Businesses our vacancy close dates may be subject to change.
fields.title: Sales Trading Controller - NOW TV

fields.description:
Facebook is seeking to fill a full-time position of an Associate Manager, Infrastructure Accounting. In this specific role, you will join a team that manages the financial reporting for one of Facebook’s largest investments that helps connect more than a billion users. The successful candidate will be on the team responsible for the accounting of Facebook’s investment of infrastructure fixed assets, ranging from buildings, leasehold improvements to data center equipment and our vast networks. This position will be based in Menlo Park and will report to the Infrastructure Controller.

Responsibilities
  • Be responsible for multiple balance sheet accounts of medium to high level of complexity and materiality.
  • Prepare, upload and review journal entries into the General Ledger to ensure accurate, timely and reliable recording of transactions.
  • Monitor the compliance of capitalized assets with approved capitalization policies.
  • Coordinate with the Infrastructure Accounting team to drive and contribute to the month end close process of Oracle Fixed Assets to ensure the timely and accurate reporting of financial information. Reconcile the Infrastructure sub ledger to the General Ledger on a monthly basis.
  • Monitor, coordinate, and book monthly expense and key Company accruals in accordance with the established close process.
  • Coordinate with Accounting and FP&A to ensure accurate and timely completion of monthly close and reporting items.
  • Help develop and maintain accounting practices in accordance with GAAP, maintain timely and accurate financial records, prepare routine financial analysis and ensure that the Infrastructures sub ledger is properly stated.
  • Assist in the design, enhancement and implementation of accounting policies and operating procedures for the infrastructure accounting.
  • Independently perform research on accounting standards as related to emerging issues and reach conclusion with adequate level of rationale and documentation for review with the Infrastructure Accounting Team members as required.
  • Coordinate with external and internal auditors to ensure timely completion of audit requests, and aid in the research and analysis of audit issues raised. Participate in the review of annual and quarterly financial statements and footnotes and provide support for disclosures, as needed.
  • Effectively partner with business to influence and to provide needed guidance.
  • Maintain and ensure compliance with all SOX documentation and requirements.
  • Assist in special projects and other duties as assigned.

Requirements
  • BA/BS degree in Accounting or Finance
  • Big 4 audit experience and CPA license preferred -minimum of 3-5 years of financial accounting experience required
  • Experience with Oracle Financial and Hyperion a plus
  • Solid knowledge of GAAP, including fixed assets and accrual accounting
  • Related industry experiences a plus
  • Strong computer and analytical skills, including proficiency in Excel
  • Strong team player
  • Self-starter with superb attention to detail yet possesses an understanding of the "big picture”

fields.description:
Title:  Principal Software Engineer

Organization:  Ariba Network

Reports to:  Director

Location:  Sunnyvale

FLSA Status:  Exempt

 

Company Overview

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billiondollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.

Position Overview

The Ariba Network Engineering team is looking for a talented, passionate Principal Software Engineer with proven architecture, design and implementation skills to join the team.  Be a part of the team that is bringing ongoing innovation to a network of buyers and sellers that is growing at an unprecedented scale.

Duties and Responsibilities
