fields.description:
Symmetricom (NASDAQ: SYMM), a world leader in precise time solutions, sets the world's standard for time. The company generates, distributes and applies precise time for the communications, aerospace/defense, IT infrastructure, high frequency trading/financial, power and metrology industries. Symmetricom's customers, from communications service providers and network equipment manufacturers to governments and their suppliers worldwide, are able to build more reliable networks and systems by using the company's advanced timing technologies, atomic clocks, services and solutions. All products support today's precise timing standards, including GPS-based timing, IEEE 1588 (PTP), Network Time Protocol (NTP), Synchronous Ethernet and DOCSIS® timing.
 
The Sr. Product Manager will be the product champion for mature products in the Government and Communication segments. This position will focus on driving the success of existing products to maximize revenue and margin for the company through product enhancements, competitive positioning, solutions white papers and demos, and superb customer and field support to win deals. This person will be responsible for developing product strategy, establishing product enhancement requirements, pricing, and ensuring continous supply through meticulous forecasting and other operations related aspects of the product line. 


The product manager will be responsible for managing the product lines from the current sustaining stage through to end-of-life  and oversee and coordinate other functions involved with the product including engineering, sales, outbound marketing, finance, production, and service.  This position will be responsible for providing customer satisfaction while at the same time delivering satisfactory operating income to the company for the product line.  Local candidates in San Jose CA or Boulder, CO. 

Inbound Marketing (strategy)

  • Develop a business plan for the product line, which aligns with the overall business unit objectives and strategy
  • Effect the transition from Engineering to Manufacturing to support new software product releases
  • Work with Sales to manage the customer experience through end-of-life
  • Support product positioning and outbound marketing activities with the product marketing organization
  • Keep abreast of new technology developments in the field and continually monitor and assess Symmetricom relative to the competition
  • Keep abreast of the industry, trends, macro and micro economic factors that will affect the product line
  • Represent Symmetricom in conferences, industry technical forums, standards bodies
  • Understand a “day in the life” of our customers and the application of our products including who they are, what their problems are and how we can improve their business through our solutions
  •  

Product Management (management)

  • Familiarity and analysis of all competitors in the market place
  • Managing product life cycles including obsolescence and product rationalization on an on-going basis
  • Proactively participate in the product hold process to address the issue and keep the management informed of the status
  • Work with Sales and business develoment to develop pricing and discounting strategies, and help to approve sales specials
  • Track and manage various reports on product sales history
  • Forecasts sales of new and existing products in collaboration with sales
  • Work with the business unit management on product profitability, product line financials and health of the product line
  • Be the focal point to facilitate specials and custom engineering in partnership with sales and R&D
  •  

 Other Marketing (Marketing)

  • Support outbound marketing efforts managed by product /channel marketing team
  • Participate and support sales conference and channel training efforts
  • Support the sales force worldwide regarding products and their applications when expert advice is needed

Job Requirements

Education:
A technical bachelor's degree is expected and an advanced degree in marketing (MBA) or a related field is highly desirable.

Core Competencies and Personal Attributes

In addition to having a solid professional background and deep domain experience, the successful candidate will need to possess the following personal qualities and competencies in order to establish credibility and positively impact customers, partners, employees, and the management team:

  • Strong interest in Symmetricom’s technology, market, and its future – and the willingness to convert that interest into a passion; strong inner drive to achieve, a determination to win
  • Excellent communication skills, and ability to work cross-functionally and at all levels within the organization
  • Good influencing skills and an ability to sell concepts and ideas both internally and externally
  • Understanding of product management “best practices” that would be applicable to Symmetricom based on experience in similar situations
  • Someone with a “can do” attitude who can figure out how to get things done quickly and effectively
  • Creativity imagination, and commitment to the highest standards of excellence and integrity.
  • Excellent powerpoint skills are highly desireable, but not essential

 

 

 

Apply Here: http://www.Click2apply.net/sqrnhz8

fields.description:
“Exciting opportunity for success and career advancement with one of the largest FX Brokers in the world”

FXCM (NYSE:FXCM) is one of the world’s largest currency trading brokers seeking career-oriented, entry-level candidates ready to start a career in financial services.

Top Benefits:

  • Paid travel to Texas office for training
  • Quarterly bonuses for top performers
  • Strong team dynamic with frequent outings
  • Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco

High performing employees within the Financial Services Representative team have historically been promoted into a wide range of positions including management, sales, trading education, private client services, marketing, training, and even travelled to some of our worldwide offices!

Starting a career in the global currency market - The top two reasons candidates apply to work within the currency (Forex) market are Growth and Opportunity.

 

How the Forex Market is Growing

  • Over 4 Trillion in volume done each day – compared to 150 Million in global stock markets
  • Retail traders accounting for 18% of daily volume during 2011; up from 10% in 2010
  • Join a Team at FXCM with Record Growth every year since 1999 – even during 2008 and 2009’s global financial crisis

Description of Ideal Candidates:

 

  • Market Junkies.  You actively follow financial markets, financial news, and can easily name 2-3 stories at a minimum that you’ve recently read.  You’d love to talk about opinions on global markets, trading strategies, and current world affairs.
  • Career Minded.  You are interested in starting a long-term career with FXCM and within finance and (most importantly) you are able to articulate how FXCM fits in your long-term plans.
  • Entry-Level Applicant.  You have 0-3 years professional experience in a full-time position and have a genuine interest in working your way up.

 

Unique Opportunities that FXCM Provides

  • Develop an array of Skills in: Customer Support, Sales, Trading, and many more
  • Meritocracy – 2 years or less is the usual time frame for top performing employees to be promoted to more senior roles
  • Opportunities abound with an increase in global partnerships

To learn more about the forex market and FXCM, please visit this link: http://www.fxcm.com/forex-educational-videos.jsp

Key responsibilities include (not limited to):

  • Provide our clients with best-in-class service on phone, chats, and email.
  • Intelligently articulate financial and market-related concepts
  • Mediate difficult situations, conversations and customers with composure and resolve
  • Consistently take initiative to learn about the markets, FX industry and new FXCM platforms and products such as the FXCM Trading Station, Meta Trader 4, or the latest iPad release
  • Be a team player and proactively collaborate with the Financial Services Team to manage time, resources, volume, and customer feedback
  • Consistently achieve specific deposit, retention, and customer satisfaction benchmarks
  • Act upon constructive criticism to improve on-desk client conversations and to build on personal and department-wide performance figures
  • Go beyond “customer service.”  Skillfully probe for, listen, and understand client needs to provide resources and solutions to improve clients’ trading experience and results

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

Google Fiber is an exciting new business for Google aiming to deploy next generation, gigabit Internet speeds to the home. In this role you will support the planning, reporting and analysis needs of the business.


Responsibilities
  • Support monthly, quarterly and annual financial planning cycles and drive visibility into business performance and resource planning decisions
  • Identify and implement metrics and reporting tools to measure Google Fiber business results and success
  • Support the day-to-day operations of the businesses by providing visibility into the performance of the business (expenses, usage metrics) with insightful analytics.
  • Calculate and track the Sales team quarterly quotas



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years relevant work experience


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven spreadsheets skills and other database, automation or business intelligence skills (e.g. SQL, TSL, Hyperion Essbase)
  • High attention to detail with excellent organizational and analytical skills, and the capability to handle multiple projects and stakeholders
  • Understanding of accounting processes and terminology


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

fields.description:
Morgan Stanley’s Public Finance Investment Banking Group raises capital to fund projects for public sector entities and not-for-profit institutions. The Group plans financial strategies and structures tax-exempt and taxable offerings along with derivative solutions to meet the needs of state and local governments, hospitals and health care organizations, higher education and cultural institutions, housing authorities, transportation agencies, water and sewer systems, power utility systems and student loan agencies. All of these are essential to fund vital projects and services with the least burden on public resources.

Placement. The Public Finance Investment Banking Full-Time Analyst Program provides undergraduate students an opportunity to master the analytical, quantitative and interpersonal skills necessary to develop an exciting and rewarding career on Wall Street. Analysts joining Public Finance will participate in a six-week intensive Training Program alongside Sales & Trading Analysts, based in New York and beginning in late June. Analysts are then placed directly with a group in Public Finance where opportunities exist in one of the following product areas: Municipal Capital Markets, Infrastructure, Higher Education, Public Power and Utilities, Housing, Student Loans, Health Care and Sports.

Training program. Public Finance Analysts participate in an orientation program that covers the Firm’s businesses and the transition from the academic to the corporate world, creating the chance to establish a network throughout the Firm globally. The Analysts then attend divisional training where they learn the core skills required to be successful on the job. The curriculum includes daily market updates, accounting, credit risk analysis, business overview speaker series, fundamental and advanced product and technical training and registration preparation.
In addition, Public Finance Analysts receive training in municipal finance, municipal bond math, credit derivatives, options and yield curve fundamentals. Analysts have several opportunities to network with peers, mentors and managers through team-building sessions, learning lunches, community service, social events and more.

Responsibilities. Analysts in Public Finance will be an integral member of the Investment Banking coverage team and will be expected to:
• Develop structuring, cash flow financial models.
• Create presentation materials, memos and proposals to generate new business.
• Communicate complex ideas and solutions with potential and existing clients.

Application process. Students must apply online at www.morganstanley.com/careers. If Morgan Stanley recruits on your campus, you may also be required to apply through your school’s on-campus system.

Contacts. For questions, please email MSCampusRecruiting@morganstanley.com.

Skills Required
Qualifications/skills/requirements
• You are pursuing an undergraduate degree, with a minimum 3.0 GPA. A concentration in Government, Political Science, Public Policy or Economics is preferred.
• You have at least one internship in a finance-related field (preferred).
• You know Bloomberg, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.
• You are a highly focused, goal-oriented, insightful, creative, quantitative and detail-oriented team player and multi-tasker.
• You possess a strong work ethic, initiative, enthusiasm, strong verbal and written communication skills, and a compelling interest in and knowledge of the financial markets, specifically in municipals and public finance.
• You have excellent decision making abilities.

The Accounting and Compliance Manager will be responsible for AP accounting and general compliance issues including, monthly and quarterly financial close cycles, 1099 and 1042 reporting, SOx controls, master vendor data compliance, drafting and review of AP policies and procedures.

This position will report to the Sr. Manager Procure to Pay (PTP) Operations, and will manage a staff of 2 to 3 full-time accountants as well as periodic direction of 4 analysts as the project need arises. The Accounting and Compliance Manager provides oversight on all AP general ledger/sub-ledger accounting activities, review of account reconciliations, accruals and final approval of journal entries. This position will serve as a technical expert in US reporting to other functions. Interacts and influences peers across the Company/plant functions to ensure successful accounting close process and completion of special projects as needed.

The Accounting and Compliance Manager must be able to work in a fast-paced and team-oriented environment with a customer focus and attention to detail. The position requires the ability to effectively manage staff and projects, prioritize work, demonstrate strong accountability and good judgment, and meet established deadlines.

The successful candidate must demonstrate the ability to:

  • Effectively manage resources and processes to achieve targets and meet deadlines
  • Analyze operational and accounting/business issues. 
  • Understand and leverage Oracle and ERP system functionality
  • Supervise or prepare ad-hoc reporting and analysis.
  • Coach and manage staff to meet goals and deliver strong support to business partners
  • Work independently with little day-to-day oversight
  • Determine methodology, approach and work plan within own area of expertise. 
  • Proactively raise issues and concerns with stakeholders and management regarding compliance, process, and business and accounting risks, and to formulate plans for resolution. 
  • Anticipate issues that may arise within the AP Accounting Function in the short-term and develop solutions, sometimes without similar precedents 
  • Gather feedback from stakeholders, and research best practices. 
  • Develop desk procedures and policies as necessary to support goals
  • Lead and drive action plans to increase operation productivity, process scalability and compliance

Title:  Architect

Department:  CTO

Location:  Sunnyvale, CA

Reports To:  CTO

FLSA Status:  Exempt

 

Company Overview

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billiondollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.

Position Overview

The Ariba Engineering team is looking for a talented, passionate senior level software architect with proven architecture, design and implementation skills to join its technology architecture team.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Define the strategy and architecture for Ariba’s next generation mobile and web UI
  • Provide technical leadership across all of Ariba Engineering
  • Partner with executive management on Ariba’s future strategy
  • Coordinate technology adoption and feature designs across product lines
  • Drive cross-company technology initiatives
  • Provide leadership in all areas of the development process, including development standards and practices, system architecture and design, functional and technical design and implementation, and unit and regression test design
  • Represent technology externally to customers, prospects, and the field organization

Area of Interest: Accounting

Description: KPMG’s Advisory Services Practice focuses on fundamental business issues — managing risk, increasing revenues, controlling costs — that organizations, across various industries, should address in order to help them flourish. We help companies to identify and manage risks inherent in business processes and technology systems that support business objectives, and provide them with the information needed to help them meet their strategic and financial goals. Services are specialized to help clients mitigate risks across an overall risk spectrum. We are currently seeking a Senior Associate in Transactions-Accounting Advisory Services (AAS) for our Transactions & Restructuring practice to join us in our San Francisco with other locations available.

Responsibilities:
  • Provide accounting advisory support and research to clients, including implementation assistance with new accounting standards
  • Assist with Securities Exchange Commission (SEC) regulatory filings for spin-offs, carve-outs, initial public offerings (IPO), debt offerings, and other acquisition filings for both domestic and cross-border transactions
  • Provide conversion services to U.S. and foreign registered companies that need a change in their financial reporting to U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) or International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS)
  • Provide transaction oriented accounting and reporting assistance for mergers and acquisitions, divestitures, complex capital raising and financing structures, financial instruments, revenue recognition, and provide fresh-start accounting support to clients upon emergence from bankruptcy
  • Prepare and present accounting findings and concepts

  • Bachelor's degree in an appropriate field from an accredited college/university

  • Strong knowledge of U.S. GAAP and IFRS

KPMG offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package.

This role is responsible for the project oversight of the Risk Management Modeling for Forecasting and Stress Testing program including the planning and managing as well as incorporating best practices into the process. This role sits in the Risk Management organization and reports into the Risk Program Manager.

Responsible for managing the Enterprise Risk programs. In this role you will be responsible for:
• Assisting management in annual project planning
• Actively providing project oversight of the demand management process
• Working with business and technical partners on capacity management
• Providing tactical project management on key initiatives
• Managing Business Analyst(s) in the execution of projects

Projects include:

In Addition- in this role you will:

Develops and presents written project plans and develops and delegates project tasks including test plan and acceptance testing.

Full-Time in Santa Clara, California

ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications. fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst, Sales

fields.description:
Position Responsibilities

SunGard Financial Systems provides mission-critical software and IT services to institutions in virtually every segment of the financial services industry. The primary purpose of these systems is to automate the many detailed processes associated with trading, managing investment portfolios and accounting for investment assets. These solutions address the processing requirements of a broad range of users within financial services, including asset managers, traders, custodians, compliance officers, treasurers, insurers, risk managers, hedge fund managers, plan administrators and clearing agents. In addition, we also provide professional services that focus on application implementation and integration of these solutions and on custom software development.

About SunGard's Solutions for Asset Management:

SunGard’s asset management solutions help institutional investors, hedge funds, private equity firms, fund administrators and securities transfer agents improve both investment decision-making and operational efficiency, while managing risk and increasing transparency. SunGard's solutions support every stage of the investment process, from research and portfolio management, to valuation, risk management, compliance, investment accounting, transfer agency and client reporting. For more information, visit www.sungard.com/assetmanagement.

Position Overview:

SunGard is seeking a proven sales professional with a demonstrated track record successfully selling premier software and services into the Financial Services industry. As a SunGard Sales Executive you will use your deep industry knowledge to sell our highly rated software and services to new business accounts. This is an exciting opportunity to sell multi-functional software solutions and services. Your clear understanding of your customers' marketplace and their business drivers will be the key to penetrating target accounts.

We are looking for a highly dynamic individual with strong relationship and negotiation skills. The SunGard Sales Executive is responsible for owning the client relationship at the C-level, increasing revenue and profit within assigned territory through share growth, and building the highest levels of customer satisfaction in our targeted enterprise accounts in the Alternative Investment space. The role encompasses the Asset Management portfolio of software offerings and services.

Essential Responsibilities Include:

• Build business through proactive customer contacts, which result in meeting/exceeding annual quota targets through sales to new customers
• Leverage research skills, intra-company contacts, market data to qualify prospects and develop a calibrated target client list
• Utilize strong lead generation capabilities to successfully penetrate client at all levels of organization through and including C-suite
• Ability to identify different buyer motivations across various client bases and levels in order to expand potential revenue drivers
• Adjust sales approach and strategy accordingly to various client drivers to solidify role as customer advocate
• Incorporate customer perspective, drivers, product/service relevancy to deliver persuasive client presentations
• Demonstrate customer advocacy by emphasizing those features/benefits of relevant SunGard software, service offerings which meet specific customer’ needs
• Conduct business in a profitable, ethical manner
• Must have excellent verbal, written, presentation and negotiation skills in order to perform as a world class customer advocate
• Willing to travel minimum 30%

Key Characteristics:
• Adjusts to new, different, or changing requirements
• Listens with objectivity and checks for understanding
• Persists despite obstacles and opposition or set backs
• Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure
• Displays a relentless commitment to win
• Demonstrates a passion for profession and a drive to improve
• Displays personal & corporate integrity
• Takes initiative to accomplish set objectives and deliver resolution on priority issues
• Ability to understand objective and work independently or in collaboration with all internal partners, both horizontally and vertically within the organizational to successfully deliver objective

Position Requirements

Knowledge and Experience Requirements:

The successful candidate will have a minimum of seven (7) years proven track record in strategic selling to C level executives, strong interpersonal and communications skills, demonstrated team building, leadership and the ability to manage multiple complex sales engagements concurrently. Candidate must have an entrepreneurial approach that is imaginative, smart, passionate, and approachable. Successful candidate will design, implement a sales strategy and effectively manage the sales cycle to include: lead generation, prospecting, qualifying, business development and closing sales within an assigned geographic territory.

SunGard’s asset management solutions help institutional investors, hedge funds, private equity firms, fund administrators and securities transfer agents improve both investment decision-making and operational efficiency, while managing risk and increasing transparency. SunGard's solutions support every stage of the investment process, from research and portfolio management, to valuation, risk management, compliance, investment accounting, transfer agency and client reporting.



Recruitment at SunGard Financial Systems works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. SunGard does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Capitalize on Change

In speaking to our customers, we hear three universal business challenges that need to be addressed in an ever-changing financial services landscape: delivering transparency to internal and external stakeholders, increasing efficiency for cost management and leveraging networks for growth. Please join the conversation at www.sungard.com/ten .

SUNGARD IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. M/F/D/V

Employment contingent upon successful completion of background investigation and pre-employment drug screen.

As part of the selection process this role may require an assessment to determine suitability.

The Business Development Executive will identify, create and pursue new business opportunities in the corporate foreign exchange sector. The incumbent will be responsible for establishing new business relationships and effectively identifying and communicating appropriate foreign exchange solutions. The goal of the BDE is to establish rapport and build credibility with clients through effectively presenting solutions that encompass clients' entire international payment needs and establishing Western Union Business Solutions as the primary provider. The ability to communicate, present and negotiate with executive level positions within a prospective company both over the phone and in person is essential for success in this position.  

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

  • Contact prospects and set appointments with new business opportunities.
  • Market and close sales opportunities for Western Union Business Solutions' foreign exchange products and international payment services.
  • Build and maintain strategic business relationships with existing and prospective clients.
  • Develop and utilize networking opportunities to establish Western Union Business Solutions as a credible member of the professional community and to identify and create new business opportunities.
  • Research and analyze clients' business objectives, identify their foreign exchange and international payment requirements, and design a benefits-based solution and action plan demonstrating how Western Union Business Solutions can meet client needs.
  • Develop sales strategies and plan to best position products and services.

  • Represent Western Union Business Solutions in a professional manner at all times.

  • Establish a productive sales/dealer relationship.
  • Demonstrate commitment to continuing education and knowledge of Western Union Business Solutions' products and services, as well as the foreign exchange industry in general.
  • Cold calling and participation in telemarketing activities and initiatives to prospective clients.
  • Develop and maintain sales pipeline through Western Union Business Solutions' CRM system.
  • Perform all other reasonable duties as requested by management or management delegate.

[Are you looking for a career in a challenging and creative work environment at a company with award-winning technology? Are you looking for a company that values and recognizes your contributions and encourages you to shape your own career path? ]

 

Are you looking for a career in a challenging and creative work environment at a company with award-winning technology? Are you looking for a company that values and recognizes your contributions and encourages you to shape your own career path? If so...

 

We are looking for a Sr. Technical Accounting Mgr in our Controller’s organization reporting to the Assistant controller. This person will be leading Consolidation and US General Ledger team and is responsible for a variety of technical accounting areas including: Stock Based Compensation(FASB 123R), M&A accounting activity, assisting with SEC reporting, providing ad hoc technical research along with worldwide consolidated financial results as well as processes and procedures in our current ERP systems.

 

Main responsibilities/expectations:

 

  • Leader of worldwide accounting recording and reporting including managing the closing and audit, defining the reporting requirement, and standardizing account and entity set up in ERP system.
  • Manage Consolidation and US General Ledger team with the responsibilities including worldwide consolidated results and variance analysis, foreign currency hedging and restructuring accounting as well as America region financials.
  • Calculate and support Stock Based Compensation accounting, basic and dilutive share account (both actual and forecast) and produce related roll-forward and analysis schedules.
  • Provide SEC reporting assistance with regards to equity accounting and stock plans, acquisition disclosures and various footnotes.
  • Participate on due diligent on potential acquisitions and purchase agreement review
  • Owner of full acquisition accounting including purchase price allocation and engaging with third party’s for the valuations.
  • Provide technical research along with writing detailed memos that support various positions
  • Owner of Sarbanes-Oxley compliance for worldwide general ledger and equity related controls.
  • Lead finance integration for newly acquired companies
  • Participate in company-wide projects that directly or indirectly impact technical accounting and analysis

  • 5 to 8 years of finance and accounting experience, including at least 2 years of stock based compensation.

 

Why Work for EFI?

EFI understands that employees drive the success of a company. EFI strives to provide a work environment that offers challenging and rewarding opportunities, while encouraging open communication, teamwork, and diversity. We offer:

 

  • Unlimited Opportunity - EFI offers challenging assignments in all professional areas. EFI is the place where YOU make a difference.
  • Our People - EFI employees are smart and incredibly diverse. EFI employees are innovative, friendly, passionate and fun.
  • Open Communication - We encourage employees to share ideas with each other. The executive team holds quarterly meetings to give business updates and answer employee questions.
  • Teamwork – Collaboration and cooperation remain essential to EFI’s success.
  • Our technology is fun and creative
  • Flexible work arrangements

 

Headquartered in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices worldwide, EFI researches, invents and delivers next-generation digital technology that brings brands, ideas and images to life for businesses globally. Driven by our entrepreneurial spirit, EFI helps drive our customers’ business success with a scalable digital product, solution and service portfolio that increases their profits, cuts costs, improves productivity and optimizes their performance on every job from creation to print. EFI’s award-winning, integrated product portfolio consists of industrial inkjet printers and inks, powerful digital front ends, precise color management tools, eCommerce, web-to-print and productivity software for business automation, and mobile and cloud printing products. We are an equal opportunity /affirmative action employer.

 

EFI  is a world leader in customer-focused digital printing innovation. EFI's award-winning solutions, integrated from creation to print, deliver increased performance, cost savings and productivity. The company's robust product portfolio includes Fiery® digital color print servers; VUTEk® superwide digital inkjet printers, UV and solvent inks; Rastek UV wide-format inkjet printers; Jetrion® industrial inkjet printing systems; print production workflow and management information software; and corporate printing solutions. EFI maintains 25 offices worldwide.

Lam Research develops semiconductor manufacturing solutions for the world’s leading chipmakers.
We make the tools that make the chips that power your world.

Our continuous improvements in the efficiency of the semiconductor manufacturing process have supported increased chip performance and reduced power consumption, driving the global boom in smartphones, tablets and computers. Lam Research – a company where successful people want to work

Position is with the North America management region and the position will support the Lam team for a major global customer.  Responsible for preparing financial forecasts (twice/quarter) and for quarter-end accounting close entries.  Prepares and interprets bi-weekly flash reports showing financial and operational metrics and reviewing these with internal business partners to understand variances and assess corrective action plans. fields.description:
Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world’s major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

POSITION SUMMARY
Visa Client Consulting is a nearly 100 person strong team which combines deep industry expertise and consulting skills to drive tangible impact and financial results for Visa’s clients. With a broad range of strategy consulting, data analytic, brand management, and marketing experience across financial services Visa Client Consulting can solve our clients’ most strategic problems.

JOB SCOPE
The Senior Analyst plays a key role on the Benchmark Consulting team. This is a unique opportunity for the Senior Analyst because it includes involvement in all aspects of a client-facing organization, helps to further develop professional services skills, and provides an opportunity to gain in-depth knowledge of the payments industry. Engagements are typically staffed with 10 team members serving 5 or more clients at a time and can last up to twelve months. This individual will focus in practice areas including marketing, risk, operations, technology, or processing. Prior consultant experience is preferred.
  • Play an integral role on a team of experienced professionals in delivering revenue-generating consulting services to key Visa clients
  • Complete consulting engagements with senior level clients, including participating in interviews, reviewing confidential client data, and summarizing key findings
  • Responsible for completing detailed analysis on client data, identifying interesting trends and anomalies, and creating new ways to view current analyses
  • Create and propose high-impact strategic and tactical performance improvement recommendations for Visa clients
  • Develop client-specific presentations which address executive’s needs and deliver presentations to clients and internal Visa partners
  • Build and maintain relationships with internal Visa partners, including Visa Product Management, Visa Account Executives
  • Develop industry analysis to share internally at Visa for a variety of products (credit, debit, prepaid, and commercial)


    • Qualifications

  • 8-10+ years of experience with a minimum of 2-4 years of experience with management consulting or investment banking equivalent experience preferred
  • Demonstrated track record of effectively integrating information from a wide variety of sources to analyze and assess business performance
  • Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor addressing a wide variety of problems.
  • Exceptional team working skills and ability to drive consensus in cross-regional and cross-functional teams
  • Interest in working in a highly collaborative team with an ability to develop relationships across both Visa and Visa’s client organizations
  • Highly effective written/verbal communication skills including the ability to present with impact to executive level clients and internal stakeholders
  • Advanced proficiency with all Microsoft products including Excel, Word, Access and PowerPoint
  • SQL, Visual Basic programming experience is not required but is also desired
  • Willingness and ability to travel 35-50%

fields.description: Global investment bank seeks a supervisory professional for their fixed income sales and trading division.
fields.title: Supervision – Fixed Income Sales & Trading
fields.skills:
The Supervision Team plays a key role in helping the company withstand regulatory scrutiny through a myriad of responsibilities including: performing supervisory reviews delegated by Desk Supervisors, following-up on and resolving exceptions, identifying patterns of unusual behavior or technical problems with trading/reporting systems, developing surveillance tools, providing real-time support to sales and traders around regulatory/internal policy questions, documenting supervisory reviews, and interfacing with legal/compliance on new regulations and/or rule interpretations. This position entails the delegated supervision of a high paced trading floor environment supporting the efforts of front-office supervisory and regulatory controls associated with fixed income products The Fixed Income Business Supervisor will be responsible for serving as the primary liaison between the Fixed Income Division and Compliance by providing supervisory support to the Fixed Income Division. 


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

The support includes oversight of fixed income groups distinguished by product, structure and strategy including performing supervisory monitoring around various regulations including the Dodd Frank Act and the Self Regulatory Organizations. The role entails opining on the effectiveness of supervisory processes and establishing and administering supervisory procedures. Additionally, the role will be involved with the supervision of Trader Mandates, TRACE, ACT, overall Written Supervisory Procedures, employee trade approvals, facilitating responses to regulatory inquiries, conflict advisement, identifying and assessing patterns of exceptions, developing and implementing tools to address supervisory gaps, new regulations and/or interpretations, organizing supervisory structure, email review, fraud monitoring, training and escalating potential concerns while interfacing with Desk Managers and Desk personnel on a regular basis.

The Business Supervisor will implement new procedures according to new regulations and changes to existing regulations, evaluate new products and services from a regulatory prospective while working with control groups such as Compliance, Legal, Middle Office, Technology and Senior Management. 

The experienced candidate should:

• Have in depth knowledge of regulations related to Municipal Securities, Corporate Bonds, HY Bonds, Treasuries, Agency Securities, Derivative Products, Preferred Stock, Swaps and other affiliated debt instruments.
• Have ability to assess exceptions and identify potential trading concerns and be able to promptly respond to questions from trading desk personnel; 
• Be able to provide judgment in handling complex and highly confidential matters with unquestionable character, integrity and professionalism. 
• Have excellent communication, leadership and relationship building skills to engage the business, compliance officers and support areas. 
• Capability to drive consensus and, where appropriate, to take a firm position even in the absence of broad-based support. 
• Be a self starter and have competence to engage with Senior Management on a variety of sensitive topics.


QUALIFICATIONS:

• Must have the Series 7, 63, and ideally 24 or 9/10
• If no Series 24 or 9/10, must be capable of immediately obtaining the Series 24 or 9/10
• 8+ years of experience working with Fixed Income instruments, and rules and regulations relating to broker dealer activities
• Must have a Bachelor’s Degree; MBA or JD a plus
• Must be proactive and take initiative
• Must have excellent writing and communication skills 
• Must be detail-oriented and well-organized
• Must be comfortable speaking with trading desks and senior management
• Must be familiar with order management and booking systems such as Bloomberg, TradeWeb, etc.



To apply please submit your resume to Jack Kelly - JKelly@ComplianceSearch.com

fields.description:
Prudential Real Estate Investors (PREI) is the real estate investment management business of Prudential Financial. PREI is comprised of fund management centers in the US located in Madison, New Jersey, Atlanta, Chicago, New York and San Francisco. PREI has multiple global offices including: Munich, London, Singapore, Mexico City, Sao Paulo, Tokyo, and Hong Kong. PREI's specialized operating units offer a broad range of investment opportunities and investment management services in the United States, Europe, Asia, Latin America and Australia. PREI’s Principles of Business include doing the right thing, building bridges, valuing our people and working to win; we also place high importance on sustainability.

 

As of March 30, 2013, PREI managed over $52.2 billion in gross real estate assets ($36 billion net) on behalf of clients worldwide and ranks among the largest real estate investment managers. For more information, please visit http://www.prei.com/.

 

Investment Analyst Program:

 

PREI has an Investment Analyst program in the US with positions in all of its US offices. Analysts work with small teams of investment professionals in the Asset Management, Marketing, Merchant Banking, Research, and Transactions units.

 

There currently is an Investment Analyst position available in the Transactions group in San Francisco, CA.

 

Duties and Responsibilities may include:

Analyze and underwrite investment opportunities for the acquisition and development of commercial properties across all property types, investment structures, and risk profiles

Create cash flow models, sensitivity tables, rent roll analyses, joint venture waterfall models, and other financial analyses required to evaluate and pursue commercial real estate acquisition opportunities

Prepare Investment Committee memoranda and related materials through market research, risk analysis, and in-depth understanding of investment factors 

Analyze economic, market, legal, and political conditions within assigned areas 

Assist senior transactions professionals in leading the due diligence and closing processes for acquisitions in conjunction with portfolio and asset management teams 

 Assist asset management teams in property financings, appraisal review, and other activities that may require feedback from the Transactions group

Monitor and/or track acquisition and disposition activity

Assist in property and portfolio level financing

Research and analyze potential new partners and investment ideas

 

Training Opportunities:

 

·         The Analyst Program is designed to immerse Analysts in PREI's business strategy, principles, and values

·         Analysts are encouraged to participate in the CFA program to enhance their knowledge of finance principles

·         Analysts are also are eligible to participate in the Regional Mentor Program, an opportunity to be coached by more experienced professionals with whom they can develop insightful one-on-one relationships and ensure continued professional progress to suit long-term career interests

fields.description:
Professional Services Technical Analyst

Company Profile

Founded in 1997, Calypso Technology is a leading global application software provider for the capital markets industry, delivering an integrated suite of trading, risk and processing applications within many of the premier financial institutions including banks, asset managers, hedge funds, and other companies participating in the world’s financial markets.

Its innovative platform is the industry’s first integrated application suite with the ability to support the trading, risk management, and processing of various financial products such as Interest Rate, Credit, Foreign Exchange, Commodity and Equity and their derivatives.

With strategically based offices in global financial centers in San Francisco (headquarters), New York, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Moscow, Johannesburg, Sydney, Tokyo, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Mumbai and Chennai, our 500+ employees include some of the best talent from the capital markets and technology industries. Our global presence offers international exposure, experience and travel for many of our employment positions.

Calypso Technology's clients are industry innovators and leaders — from 8 of the world’s top 10 banks to regional and local banks, and the world’s largest asset managers , leading hedge funds , and insurance companies. With over 110+ customers and 18,000+ users around the world, we are extremely proud of the relationships we have developed. A partial list of our clients can be found here : www.calypso.com/customers/

With a world-class team of professionals who share a passion to succeed, Calypso places a high value on providing equal employment opportunities and maintaining a diverse workforce.

We invite you to explore the Calypso website and discover how our organization can help you to navigate your journey in finding a rewarding career and achieving your own personal and professional goals.

Job Description Overview

Calypso Technology is seeking is seeking a Post-Sales Senior Technical Analyst with relevant work experience in the capital markets or at a financial software company. The ideal candidate will have strong Java development skills with enterprise application experience.

Responsibilities

  • In-depth, hands-on involvement directly with customers implementing the Calypso system. A key responsibility will be working directly with the customer project team implementing the Calypso system, and assist them in implementing their users’ requirements. The technical analyst will then typically follow up with the users to test the implementation, achieve signoff, and continue to move the system toward go-live.
  • Assist developers in understanding the API required to extend the Calypso system, add data to the Calypso system, and build interfaces between Calypso and external systems.
  • Train users and customer developers on the basic use of the system, particularly with the technical setup.
  • System installation, including Java JRE download and installation, relational database installation, data model installation and upgrade scripts, setup and configuration of event-driven framework, configuration of real-time market data feed, etc.
  • Work hands on with the system, configuring it and testing that it meets the customer’s technical requirements.
  • Work with Calypso business analysts, Calypso core development, or customer development to code prototypes of enhancements to ensure they will meet business requirements.
  • Some technical project management work will be expected. In particular, managing the technical issues and tracking the timeline of technical deliverables, in order to keep the customer informed of progress. Assist customers with development of their own internal project plan, including identification of key setup and configuration tasks, scope considerations, timeline and scheduling, and resource requirements.

Skills & Requirements:

  • 4+ years working in systems or technical analysis, preferably in the capital markets industry
  • 5+ years of experience in commercial software including Java, C++, Swing, JDBC, RMI, J2EE, Linux, Sybase, XML (exceptional candidates with less experience will be considered)
  • Strong GUI and server side development
  • Excellent object-oriented analysis, design & development skills
  • Knowledge of relational databases and SQL including working experience with Sybase and/or Oracle
  • Preference for domain experience in developing software or implementing software in support of any or all of the following asset classes: credit derivatives, interest rate derivatives, equity derivatives, fixed income, or FX.
  • Experience designing/building front-to-back capital markets trading systems will be especially valuable.
  • Strong business skills – even though this is a technical position, the candidate must be very “business savvy” – ability to comfortably interact with end users on business operations will be highly valued. Particular value will be placed on understanding basic concepts of trade capture and trade workflow management, market data capture, cash flow generation, trade valuation, sensitivity analysis, payment advice and settlement creation, general ledger accounting, and securities position management.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills. The person in this role will spend significant amounts of time working hands-on educating and training customers, and patience will be key to success.
  • Willingness and ability to travel periodically, as required.

Benefits

Calypso offers career development opportunities, a competitive compensation package, and a comprehensive benefits package

Calypso Technology is an equal opportunity employee (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.
fields.title: Professional Services Technical Analyst

fields.description:
What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.

Position Summary

The IT Business Intelligence & Data Management (BIDM) team is responsible for developing and executing on strategies for collecting, accessing, and using enterprise-wide data by business units across Bank of the West and its affiliates through the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), the Finance Data Mart (FDM) and other data assets. The Business Analyst Manager reports to the BIDM Business Engagement Lead and is responsible for:
• Managing the Business Analysis (BA) team and functional area for BIDM which:
o Works with business partners to identify and document requirements for data and Business Intelligence (BI) projects.
o Profiles new data sources and performs data analysis in response to business inquiries.
o Performs quality assurance testing on data and BI project deliverables to ensure requirements are met.
• Collaborating with business partners on data warehouse efforts and assisting with smooth execution of project deliverables.
• Engaging with internal development and data architecture teams to ensure project deliverables meet specified requirements and business partner expectations.
• Working with group management and team members to enhance internal development processes and improve quality of deliverables.
• Performing above BA role functions on business projects as well as assisting with BA responsibilities where needed on projects.

Position Accountabilities

1. Manages employees directly. Establishes performance goals, allocates resources, assesses annual performance and recommends individual merit and promotional increases.
2. Assists with the preparation of project plans including scheduling, costs, resources and other operational concerns.
3. Analyzes management needs regarding information retrieval, data control and use of computing and data processing resources and processes. Maintains knowledge of emerging technologies and recommends/evaluates technologies.
4. Directs and/or assists in the continuing review of the data asset effectiveness and usability, examining use and determining appropriate changes to effect improvements, reduce costs and enhance efficiency.
5. Ensures proper coordination between assigned staff and all interfacing staff and groups.
6. Ensures adherence to bank and information systems policies and procedures, security measures and audit standards.
7. Provides expertise in the examination and definition of objectives of existing or proposed systems and in the design of improved systems utilizing information technology.
8. Assist in the development of operational budget plan for the area.
9. Performs other duties as assigned.
fields.title: Business Analyst Manager

• 3-5 years of experience in leading Business Analysts in a data warehouse or BI setting.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

fields.description:
Title:  Sr.  Sales Executive – Hedge Funds

 

Segment/BU: Asset Management - InvestOne

 

 

SunGard Financial Systems provides mission-critical software and IT services to institutions in virtually every segment of the financial services industry. The primary purpose of these systems is to automate the many detailed processes associated with trading, managing investment portfolios and accounting for investment assets. These solutions address the processing requirements of a broad range of users within financial services, including asset managers, traders, custodians, compliance officers, treasurers, insurers, risk managers, hedge fund managers, plan administrators and clearing agents. In addition, we also provide professional services that focus on application implementation and integration of these solutions and on custom software development.

 

About SunGard's Solutions for Asset Management:

 

SunGard’s asset management solutions help institutional investors, hedge funds, private equity firms, fund administrators and securities transfer agents improve both investment decision-making and operational efficiency, while managing risk and increasing transparency. SunGard's solutions support every stage of the investment process, from research and portfolio management, to valuation, risk management, compliance, investment accounting, transfer agency and client reporting. For more information, visit www.sungard.com/assetmanagement.

Position Overview:

 

SunGard is seeking a proven sales professional with a demonstrated track record successfully selling premier software and services into the Financial Services industry.  As a SunGard Sales Executive you will use your deep industry knowledge to sell our highly rated software and services to new business accounts.  This is an exciting opportunity to sell multi-functional software solutions and services.  Your clear understanding of your customers' marketplace and their business drivers will be the key to penetrating target accounts. 

 

We are looking for a highly dynamic individual with strong relationship and negotiation skills. The SunGard Sales Executive is responsible for owning the client relationship at the C-level, increasing revenue and profit within assigned territory through share growth, and building the highest levels of customer satisfaction in our targeted enterprise accounts in the Alternative Investment space. The role encompasses the Asset Management portfolio of software offerings and services.  

 

Knowledge and Experience Requirements:

 

The successful candidate will have a minimum of seven (7) years proven track record in strategic selling to C level executives, strong interpersonal and communications skills, demonstrated team building, leadership and the ability to manage multiple complex sales engagements concurrently. Candidate must have an entrepreneurial approach that is imaginative, smart, passionate, and approachable. Successful candidate will design, implement a sales strategy and effectively manage the sales cycle to include: lead generation, prospecting, qualifying, business development and closing sales within an assigned geographic territory.

Essential Responsibilities Include:

 

  • Build business through proactive customer contacts, which result in meeting/exceeding annual quota targets through sales to new customers
  • Leverage research skills,  intra-company contacts, market data to qualify prospects and develop a calibrated target client list
  • Utilize strong lead generation capabilities to successfully penetrate client at all levels of organization through and including C-suite
  • Ability to identify different buyer motivations across various client bases and levels in order to expand potential revenue drivers
  • Adjust sales approach and strategy accordingly to various client drivers to solidify role as customer advocate
  • Incorporate customer perspective, drivers, product/service relevancy to deliver persuasive client presentations 
  • Demonstrate customer advocacy by emphasizing those features/benefits of relevant SunGard software, service offerings which meet specific customer’ needs
  • Conduct business in a profitable, ethical manner
  • Must have excellent verbal, written, presentation and negotiation skills in order to perform as a world class customer advocate
  • Willing to travel minimum 30%

 

Key Characteristics:

  • Adjusts to new, different, or changing requirements
  • Listens with objectivity and checks for understanding
  • Persists despite obstacles and opposition or set backs
  • Conveys a sense of urgency and drives issues to closure
  • Displays a relentless commitment to win
  • Demonstrates a passion for profession and a drive to      improve
  • Displays personal & corporate integrity
  • Takes initiative to accomplish set objectives and deliver resolution on priority issues
  • Ability to understand objective and work independently or in collaboration with all internal partners, both horizontally and vertically within the organizational to successfully deliver objective

fields.description:
First Republic Bank is looking for a talented Business System Analyst to join our Residential Lending Support team.  As a Lending Support Business Analyst, you will aid in compliance-driven modifications to and essential maintenance for the legacy residential loan origination system.  Further, you will be a key contributor in the evaluation, selection, and implementation of a new real estate loan origination system.  You will also have an opportunity to hone your training and leadership skills by providing program and systems support to all end users.  Additionally, you will:

  • Conduct implementation using proven Project Management techniques, including:
  1. Producing process and procedure documentation.
  2. Testing solutions.
  3. Designing and providing training to users in forums ranging from one-on-one to formal classroom sessions.
  4. Authoring and publishing communications to the user community as appropriate.
  5. Providing regular, clear, and concise status updates to business partners and management.
  • Gather, analyze, and clearly document business requirements, ultimately obtaining end user approval.
  • Document business workflow and complete process analyses by identifying, assessing, and cataloguing process changes.
  • Manage cross-organization relationships and prioritize requests with business partners as well as development and technology teams.
  • Document and ensure resolution of change management requests and risk management issues. 
  • Respond to end user inquiries concerning application functionality and business procedures, conduct root-cause analysis, and recommend both short- and long-term solutions.
  • Perform duties and responsibilities specific to department functions and activities or as assigned by supervisor.
  • Responsibilities include the following: 1) adhering to and complying with all applicable federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.); 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures; 3) completing required training; 4) identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer; and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.

fields.description:
Title: Principal Software Engineer (Sourcing)

Department:  Ariba Sourcing 

Location:  Sunnyvale

Reports To: Sr. Development Manager

 

Company Overview

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billiondollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.

Position Overview:

The Ariba Sourcing team focuses on designing and implementing cutting edge solutions to automate the complete Sourcing lifecycle – from supplier discovery and negotiation to award optimization and savings tracking.  A unique Software-as-a Service (SaaS) solution, Ariba Sourcing is the most widely adopted and complete strategic sourcing offering in the marketplace used by thousands of companies to create and implement competitive best-value agreements.

We are looking for a technically gifted, highly motivated, principal software engineer capable of making an immediate impact, contributing to the expansion and fulfillment of the team’s vision. As a Principal Software Engineer you will be responsible for the design, development and support of key functional areas for the Ariba Sourcing product. Bring your passion for solving business problems which will make a huge impact in how business sourcing works. Your responsibilities include:

- Leadership role in analysis, design & implementation of the Sourcing product

- Gain strong functional knowledge of Ariba Spend Management suite of applications

- Work with cross product, cross functional teams

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the design, development and support of key functional areas for the Ariba Sourcing product

For immediate attention, send resume directly to: sconlon@ariba.com.
fields.title: Principal Software Engineer (Sourcing Development)

  • 12 or more years of software development experience
  • Proficient with OO programming and Java/J2EE

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Successful track record in writing high quality code and large scale components in a SaaS environment.

Ariba, Inc. is an EEO/Affirmative Action employer and does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected category.

 

For immediate attention, send resume directly to: sconlon@ariba.com

fields.description:
The Sr. Manager/Manager, Corporate Treasury Accounting is responsible for assisting the Director of Corporate Treasury Accounting with overseeing the accounting function of the Corporate Treasury Center, ensuring that monthly deadlines are met and that accurate and complete accounting records are produced.  In addition, he/she is responsible for overseeing the preparation of periodic internal and external reporting and ensuring that contributions by Corporate Treasury Accounting are complete, correct and in accordance with US GAAP, as well as responsible for mentoring, developing and recruiting staff.   

 

Responsibilities include:  

 

Monthly/Quarterly Accounting/Reporting:

  • Assist the Director of Corporate Treasury Accounting with oversight of the accounting for all consolidated and non-consolidated investments worldwide, including related eliminations and US GAAP adjustments.
  • Lead the evaluations of investments as variable interest entities and determination of whether Franklin Templeton Investments is the primary beneficiary.
  • Ensure that accurate and complete accounting records and 10Q/K  contributions are produced.

Ad-hoc Accounting Projects/Issues Resolution:

  • Lead efforts to create and implement processes for new transactions, accounting pronouncements or policies.
  • Perform and document research relating to accounting and reporting issues in accordance with US GAAP and IFRS and SEC disclosure rules.
  • Lead team to resolve any issues and complete materiality assessment, if needed, within tight timeline.
  • Participate in Finance team projects, such as the 10Q Filing Acceleration project.

Improvements:

  • Lead team to evaluate and implement automation of treasury accounting processes and reports.
  • Continuously identify opportunities for process improvements and drive implementation.
  • Continuously evaluate accounting practices and drive improvements.

Talent Management:

  • Partner with leaders and HR to determine and meet staffing need, handle staff issues/development, manage IPP process, etc.
  • Supervise and train and provide guidance to Corporate Treasury Accounting staff.

Communication & Relationship Building:

  • Represent Corporate Treasury Accounting and independently liaise with internal and external contacts at all levels, including members of consolidation, accounting policy, financial reporting, corporate accounting and corporate tax.
  • Independently coordinate and lead meetings with internal and external contacts.
  • Provide timely updates to and discuss issues with various individuals/groups.
  • Create and give presentations as requested.
  • Present results at monthly variance meetings and address or follow up on any questions.
fields.title: Sr. Manager/Manager-Treasury Accounting
fields.skills:
Ideal candidates will have:  

 

Education & Experience:

Desirable Qualifications:

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

  • Strong leadership skills
  • Ability to work with cross-functional teams and build consensus to accomplish goals
  • Solid project management skills
  • Thorough knowledge of U.S. GAAP and SEC regulations

fields.description:
The Director, Technical Accounting & Financial Reporting will contribute toward the development of a world-class technical accounting and financial reporting function, including identifying best practices, formalizing processes, standardizing documentation and partnering with various business functions to deliver timely and accurate information. Reporting to the Corporate Controller, the successful applicant will play a pivotal and highly visible role as Atlassian continues to thrive in a fast-paced environment. If you're interested in working for an amazing company, that values playing as a team, and being the change you seek, then Atlassian might be a great home for you. Read on to find out if this role is for you......In this role, you will:

  • Manage the external financial reporting process; prepare the external statutory financial statements and related disclosures on a quarterly and annual basis (Australian Securities and Investments Commissions (ASIC and SEC)
  • Partner closely with CFO, corporate controller, bankers, legal counsel, external auditors and others within the organization to prepare registration and other filings as needed.
  • Responsible for ensuring Sarbanes-Oxley Act Section 404 compliance in the consolidation and financial reporting process
  • Research accounting literature and apply technical standards to complex business issues and transactions, including the areas of revenue recognition, stock compensation, and business combinations
  • Prepare written accounting and financial reporting position papers on an as-needed basis for review by senior management and external auditors
  • Manage and oversee monthly/quarterly worldwide revenue close activities
  • Supervise equity accounting responsibilities and preparation of associated accounts; review and validate calculations of equity compensation in accordance with IFRS 2 for stock options granted to employees and other equity compensation instruments
  • Keep business partners abreast of developments in accounting and financial reporting and related company policies and positions
  • Take ownership to collaborate with other departments to assess the reporting implications of changes in IFRS, ensure compliance with new or amended standards/interpretations, and coordinate changes to ensure continuous compliance in all areas
  • Oversee the preparation of quarterly Audit Committee material
fields.title: Director of Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting
fields.skills:
What You've Done

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent; CPA required
  • 8-10+ years of overall combined accounting experience in public accounting (Big 4 preferred) and industry
  • Consistent track record as a top performer throughout his or her career, with demonstrated proficiency in SEC reporting and complex technical accounting research
  • Strong conceptual and practical experience in understanding and communicating technical accounting issues specific to the technology industry
  • Proficiency with researching accounting literature including FASB, SEC, PCAOB, AICPA and IFRS rules and regulations, with excellent knowledge of US GAAP and IFRS. Must have thorough knowledge of ASC 985-605 (fka SOP 97-2), ASC 605-25 (fka EITF 00-21), and IFRS 2 (Share-based Payment)
  • Strong project management, leadership, relationship development and people management skills
  • Effective problem solving, methodical, detail-oriented, and analytical, with the ability to manage cross-functional projects and collaborate with different individuals and functions across the organization
  • Software industry experience, preferably in a multinational environment

fields.description:
The Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager is an individual contributor responsible for key accounting areas overseeing the day to day accounting operational activities and related systems. 

The Senior Accountant / Accounting Manager position is an individual contributor who will make an immediate difference.  Significant daily contribution, a mentor to other team members, team player, and professional resource with direct responsibility for ensuring all assigned key accounting areas are completed timely and accurately. The candidate will be responsible for assisting the Controller in a timely monthly and quarterly close process.  The candidate will be responsible for:

  • Assisting in the preparation of internal and external financial reporting and preparation/review of all corporate and consolidated financial statements.
  • Assisting with revenue recognition. Customer contract review and technical accounting write ups for accounting treatment.
  • Ownership of all balance sheet accounts and reconciliations, weekly cash reporting and planning, weekly check runs, T&E reporting including concur system review with NetSuite integration.  Wells Fargo banking platform.  Journal Entry preparation and review.
  • Generating all sales invoicing coordinating with Sales / Customer Service departments.
  • Creating accounting procedures and policy formulation.
  • Preparing balance sheet and P&L budget-to-actual / period-over-period explanations.
  • Assisting with accounting systems and reporting tools.
  • Interfacing with external auditors in the conduct of quarterly reviews, annual audits and various other filings.
  • Researching accounting principles as required maintaining financial statements in accordance with GAAP. 

Monthly close check list management for no more than a four day close. A contributor/leader who wants to make a difference, improve process, documentation and find efficiencies. Supervision of Accounts Payable and Payroll.

Confident presentation skills
fields.title: Sr. Accountant / Accounting Manager

Expert with computer systems and accounting.  Ability to maintain confidential information.

He/she is a key advisor on US GAAP matters and partners with the various finance groups to determine the accounting and reporting of unusual transactions. He/she develops working relationships with cross-functional partners and various levels of management.
