fields.description:
Shutterfly is recruiting a Manager of Technical Accounting and External Reporting.  This position is a key member of the Financial Accounting / SEC Reporting team at Shutterfly, and will assist in all technical accounting research and its application to both internal and external reporting.  This position offers the successful applicant the opportunity to leverage an extensive background of technical accounting and SEC reporting with the intensity and dynamics of a high-growth e-commerce company.  This position will report to the Director, Financial Accounting and Reporting.    Responsibilities  

  • Manage the preparation of external financial reporting documents, including 10Q's, 10K’s and 8K's.
  • Ensure compliance with SEC and GAAP reporting requirements including evaluating the impact of recent and proposed pronouncements on SEC reporting.
  • Manage the XBRL process.
  • Provide accounting and finance support for M&A transactions, including due diligence and purchase accounting.
  • Manage stock-based compensation accounting, including working directly with the legal and stock administration teams
  • Key member of broader business and corporate development team charged with reviewing contracts to ensure consistent and appropriate accounting treatments. 
  • Prepare data and other support information requests as needed for audits and reviews conducted by external auditing firm, PricewaterhouseCoopers.
  • Key member of broader team driving the quarterly earnings release process, including tie-out and review of financial information in earnings release and script.
  • Ensure Sarbanes-Oxley requirements are met for relevant areas (e.g. disclosure controls).
  • Act as a technical accounting resource for the company by researching and documenting accounting issues, as well as application to the general ledger group.
  • Assess the impact of new accounting pronouncements.
  • Assist business operators and FP&A to understand budget implications and implement planning strategy for accounting issues.
  • Other special projects as required.

fields.description:
Within the different business functions the following roles exist for Analysts joining the programme:

Salespeople Communicating value-added ideas to their clients based on their own opinions and the firm’s research, and managing client relationships
Traders Providing liquidity for our clients and managing the firm’s residual risk positions
Sales Traders Interacting with the trading desks of our clients, giving market insight and facilitating customer orders
Research Work with traders and salespeople to provide sophisticated investment strategies
Structured Product Groups Integrate the structuring, marketing and origination of products, such as structured interest rates, credit derivatives, and asset-backed securities

Roles and responsibilities depend on the product or function that you join but may include:

Developing research into actionable trading ideas and pitching them to clients
Designing new structures and payoffs for the sales force to market to clients
Running pricing models
Acting as a middle-man between the client and our trading desk to manage currency trade executions
Actively managing the relationship between the firm and the hedge funds to attract more business

Salary is competitive with excellent benefits.

We operate on-going recruitment; therefore early application is strongly encouraged. Deadline for applications is Sunday 3rd December 2013.

Skills Required
- You are able to analyse and interpret complex information quickly and accurately.
- You have a strong aptitude for numbers.
- You actively generate and share new ideas.
- You can communicate complex ideas clearly and succinctly.
- You thrive under pressure and changing situations.
- You are committed and work hard toward the achievement of goals

An outstanding academic record with a minimum 2.1 honours degree or equivalent and a keen interest in the financial markets. Candidates from all degree disciplines are encouraged to apply.

fields.description:
Director of Product Marketing for Advertisers - San Mateo, CA

Adap.tv is seeking a Director of Product Marketing to position its groundbreaking video advertising platform and solutions to leading brands and advertising agencies in all geographies.   We are looking for a proven leader in the online advertising industry with deep knowledge of ad technologies and solutions across different devices (e.g. pc, mobile, TV).  This role needs to make sure Adap.tv understands the unique needs of brands, agencies and trading desks, and addresses them with industry leading products that are positioned well in the marketplace. 

Adap.tv has an amazing opportunity to dramatically mpact the $240 billion TV and digital video advertising industry.   This is a unique career opportunity.   

Among other key responsibilities, you will be involved in the early stages of our work to combine the reach of linear TV with the audience targeting capabilities of digital advertising across screens.   Since Adap.tv supports 83% of the AdAge 100 and 72% of the comScore 50, you will be able to influence some of the largest publishers, portals, advertisers, and agencies globally.

Reporting to the VP Product Marketing, this person will work with the product team to ensure we are developing a competitive offering for each audience, work with sales to validate with customers, develop go to market plans that include product positioning and messaging, and execute them with corporate marketing.
fields.title: Director of Product Marketing for Advertisers
fields.skills:
Job Responsibilities:

Market intelligence:
Build deep knowledge of trends in the video and ad technology industries.  Identify market opportunities and determine their relevance to Adap.tv.  Do detailed competitive analysis and provide regular updates on any changes in the competitive landscape.   Develop sales and marketing tools to address new opportunities or respond to competitive threats.

Customer Insights and Segmentation: 
Build knowledge of the different customer segments and needs across brands, agencies, trading desks.  Develop personas and segmentation profiles for each target segment and audience.  Develop strategies and plans for how Adap.tv will address each target segment and audience.   Validate with internal stakeholders and develop appropriate marketing and sales tools and collateral.

Market Planning:
Work with Product Management to maintain a high-level roadmap of products for each business and customer segment that include positioning, messaging, value proposition.  Develop a Market Requirements Document (MRD) for new products or features.  MRDs should include target segments and customer personas, business value for customers and Adap.tv, competitive analysis, product and feature requirements, value chain analysis, pricing recommendation, etc. Validate with internal stakeholders including sales, business development, operations, corporate marketing and any appropriate external customers.

Go to Market:
Develop the go-to-market plan for bringing all products to market including target segments, product positioning, messaging, pricing, schedule for the launch and ramp, sales support strategy, proposed collateral, etc.  Validate with corporate marketing, sales, business development and other internal stakeholders.   Work with corporate marketing to develop a communication plan that outlines the optimal channel mix including press, analysts, website, social, events, direct marketing, etc.

Job Requirements:

  • BS/BA or equivalent experience
  • Deep experience and knowledge of the online advertising industry
  • Exceptional written and oral communication skills
  • 5-8 years as a product marketing manager and/or product manager with ownership of widely adopted, complex products
  • Experience collaborating with diverse cross-functional groups to solve problems

fields.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Revenue/Technical Accounting Manager to play a key role within the company’s Finance function. This highly visible position will be a focal point for ensuring the accurate reporting of revenue and accounting data, the completeness and accuracy of SEC filings, technical accounting research and the sufficiency of the Company’s accounting policies.  The position will report to the Director of Accounting and Finance and is a great opportunity for a talented individual to help drive improvements to our rapidly growing Company. 

The Revenue/Technical Accounting Manager will possess strong organizational, communication and management skills. The candidate will be self-motivated with the ability to identify problems and provide solutions. He/She will be a competent individual with integrity, accountability, strong interpersonal skills, and a team player. The position requires a “hands on” person who is flexible, hard-working and able to work well under pressure.


Responsibilities:

 

  • Review revenue contracts to ensure that revenue is recognized in accordance with SOP 97-2, ASU 2009-13 and ASU 2009-14; review draft contracts and customer orders for potential revenue recognition issues.  
  • Assist with ESP analysis and quarterly revenue allocation schedules and other revenue related schedules for external auditors.
  • Prepare periodic internal revenue reports to the CEO and sales organization.
  • Assist with quarterly, annual and other filings with the SEC, while coordinating reviews with other departments, external auditors and outside legal counsel.
  • Research and document GAAP and SEC reporting requirements and provide technical accounting research for non-routine or complex transactions.
  • Assist with equity accounting under ASC 718.
  • Perform monthly reconciliations over revenue and equity GL accounts.
  • Assist in the maintenance of the Company’s worldwide accounting policies and work towards implementing consistent policies and processes on a worldwide basis.
  • Assist with SOX testing and ensure that SOX narratives are up-to-date.
  • Assist with quarterly reviews and annual audits including the preparation of associated audit schedules.
  • Identify opportunities for improvements to business processes.
  • Review reconciliations of certain subsidiary GL accounts.
  • Assist with administration of employee stock options.
  • Assist with special projects as needed.
fields.title: Revenue/Technical Accounting Manager
fields.skills:
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, CPA preferred
  • 6+ years’ experience in Accounting and/or Finance with a focus on revenue recognition, external reporting and technical accounting,  preferably including experience in both public accounting and corporate environments with hardware and software companies.
  • Understanding of revenue accounting rules under ASU 2009-13/14 and SOP 97-2.
  • Proficient with MS Excel.
  • Experience with XBRL is a plus.
  • System savvy and ability to work with different applications and databases; experience with Netsuite or other cloud-based ERP a plus.  
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the demonstrated ability to work independently, yet cooperatively and constructively, in a team environment.
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with a strong attention to detail.

fields.description:
Accounting Manager
Location: San Francisco, CA

Riverbed is about changing the rules. Forget about how things work today – join us as we solve the problems of the future. Do you thrive on change? Do you like the constant challenge of the new? Do you value simplicity? Our intelligent insights and hard work makes things easy for our customers so we can enable them to serve their customers. Can you help us deliver technology without disruptions – technology that just works?

About Riverbed:
Riverbed delivers performance for the globally connected enterprise. With Riverbed, enterprises can successfully and intelligently implement strategic initiatives such as virtualization, consolidation, cloud computing, and disaster recovery without fear of compromising performance. By giving enterprises the platform they need to understand, optimize and consolidate their IT, Riverbed helps enterprises to build a fast, fluid and dynamic IT architecture that aligns with the business needs of the organization. Riverbed offers the rewarding experience of working with the best minds in the industry who are changing the world through cutting edge technology and applications. If you are a cross-functional collaborator with the ability to see and link the pieces of the big picture together join us and help us create the world of the future

The Accounting Manager is responsible for applying generally accepted accounting principles and procedures to analyze financial information, prepare accurate and timely financial reports and statements, and ensure appropriate internal control procedures. The Accounting Manager will be expected to exhibit the highest professional standards, ethical principles, and attention to detail while working on numerous routine and ad hoc accounting support functions. Other valued attributes that we are seeking are a strong work ethic, capacity to get things done independently, and consistent performance with a sense of urgency and commitment.
Your Responsibilities
• Manage a team of two in the month-end close procedures, including review of monthly journal entries, account reconciliations and analysis of results.
• Assist with preparation of journal entries and account reconciliations for more complex areas of accounting, including marketing development funds.
• Facilitate accounting team’s commitment to timely and accurate processing of accounting transactions in accordance with GAAP, Sarbanes Oxley and internal controls.
• Liaison with business partners to generate, record, and maintain accrual balances.
• Analyze and document balance sheet and income statement activity and variances.
• Proactively identify issues and areas for improvement.
• Help establish and maintain policies and procedures.
• Identify and implement process improvements to streamline accounting processes.
• Support the external audit of the company’s quarterly and annual financial statements, including preparation of audit schedules and responding to auditor questions and requests.
• Perform other special projects and analyses as directed by management.

Your Qualifications
• Bachelor degree in accounting or finance, and a CPA.
• Minimum of 6 years of accounting experience, with at least 4 years of experience in a Big 4 public accounting firm.
• In depth knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office products (Excel, Word, and Outlook)
• Experience with Oracle 11i is a plus.
• Ability to quickly acclimate to complex financial accounting applications.
• Must have the ability to execute multiple tasks and adhere to strict deadlines in a fast-paced, changing environment.
• Excellent written and oral communications skills, including the ability to work collaboratively and build strong relationships across the organization.
• Proactive, assertive, and creative approach to problem solving.
• Strong organizational, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

Why Riverbed Technology?
If you are a high-achiever who wants to be part of a dynamically growing, billion dollar plus San Francisco-based company, then you should look closely at Riverbed. If you want to rapidly develop your career with a company that is also a great place to work, Riverbed should be at the top of your list. Riverbed recently won recognition from two of the most well-reputed barometers of the work environment. We are the Glassdoor “Employees’ Choice” award winner as one of the top places to work, ranking #3 overall and #1 in enterprise companies. Additionally, we’ve been recognized with a Sloan award for work-life balance, which underscores our core values at Riverbed. If you can add to Riverbed’s collective talent and unique culture, then this job might be right for you!

Additional information about Riverbed (NASDAQ : RVBD ) is available at www.riverbed.com. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer. M/F/D/V.
fields.title: Accounting Manager

fields.description:
About Berkeley

The University of California, Berkeley, is one of the world’s most iconic teaching and research institutions. Since 1868, Berkeley has fueled a perpetual renaissance, generating unparalleled intellectual, economic and social value in California, the United States and the world. Berkeley’s culture of openness, freedom and acceptance—academic and artistic, political and cultural—make it a very special place for students, faculty and staff.

Berkeley is committed to hiring and developing staff who want to work in a high performing culture that supports the outstanding work of our faculty and students. In deciding whether to apply for a staff position at Berkeley, candidates are strongly encouraged to consider the alignment of the Berkeley Workplace Culture with their potential for success at http://jobs.berkeley.edu/why-berkeley.html.

Application Review Date

The First Review Date for this job is: October 29, 2013

Departmental Overview

This position is located in the Office of the Executive Vice Chancellor & Provost (EVCP). The EVCP is the Chief Academic Officer of the University of California, Berkeley and acts for the Chancellor in his absence. The EVCP shares responsibility with the Chancellor for the overall leadership and management of the campus and advises the Chancellor on all campus issues. In an administrative role, the EVCP is responsible for executive oversight of the vice chancellors and campus operations. As Provost, he is Berkeley’s chief academic officer and responsible for the largest and most complex control unit on campus.

The Financial Analyst 3 position provides analytic support for the financial operations of the Immediate Office of the Executive Vice Chancellor and Provost (EVCP) and units within the EVCP division as well as the two Vice Provosts which report to the EVCP: the Vice Provost for Teaching, Learning, Academic Planning and Facilities (VP-TLAPF) and the Vice Provost for the Faculty (VP-F). The Financial Analyst 3 position works as part of the EVCP Finance and Administration Unit to provide financial support to units in four divisions: EVCP division, VP-TLAPF division, VP-F division and the division of the Academic Senate.

The Financial Analyst position reports to the Director of Finance and Administration for the EVCP and works with the Director and the team on short and long term financial issues. The position collaborates with the team members on researching and analyzing financial policies and interpreting and communicating those policies to unit managers and administrators.

Responsibilities

FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT 50%
Applies professional concepts to perform moderate to complex analysis to understand past performance and determine present and future performance and/or resource allocations. Coordinates and implements department budget allocations, conceives of and maintains department chart of accounts or other data management tools, and related business processes.

•Performs SAS (Statement on Auditing Standards) review of monthly financial ledger as well as the SAS review of monthly payroll ledger, reviewing Page Center reports for accuracy of dollar amounts and chartstrings. Submits requests to CSS for any necessary pay adjustments or expense transfers based on this review.
•Reviews BAIRS summary and detail reports for deficit balances, erroneous charges, incorrect chartstrings, and proper ledger documentation.
•Ascertains needed ledger adjustments, prepares financial journals for expense transfers and prepares operating transfer journals for reallocating divisional funds.
•Ensures revenues, allocations, and internal transfers are properly budgeted, transacted, reconciled and documented.
•Prepares deposits through the Campus Deposit System (CDS) as necessary.

BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL SERVICES LIAISON TO CAMPUS SHARED SERVICES (CSS) 25%
Provides department support in the areas of business process analysis and design, system or procedure testing and implementation, documentation, security, workflow, and customer feedback.

•Acts as liaison to CSS in the area of Business and Financial Services. Provides guidance to divisional units regarding processes for on-line transactions utilizing BearBuy, bluCard, and Travel and Entertainment. Oversees internal procedures for payment approvals and routing.
•Acts as approver for unit and divisional bluCard transactions and reviews Cal 1 card transactions.
•Revises and implements procedures to improve and streamline the business process interface with CSS.

BUDGETING 15%
Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial and/or resource plans, including annual resource allocation approaches, trended future requirements, operating forecasts, sources and uses, etc.

•Using the CalPlanning, CalReporting and BAIRS systems, works with other members of the Finance and Administration Team in the preparation and analysis of budget reports and projections.
•Maintains HCM/HCP position management system, responsible for integrity of financial data. Supports budgetary management and analysis of all approved positions across all funding sources.
•Responds to requests for customized budget reports (e.g., for grant reporting) from unit and division managers.

DATA ANALYSIS 5%
Performs complex financial or resource research and studies for a variety of internal department constituents. Provides analytical support for complex budget, financial, or resource analysis projects.

•Assists Director with data analysis assignments, primarily quantitative and financial in nature. Provides support for management and costing analysis studies and analysis on resource allocation matters.
•Assists with other ad-hoc analytical studies. Assignments typically deal with complex and/or sensitive matters.

SPECIAL PROJECTS 5%

Examples include generating, modifying, and conceiving of new financial or other resource reports, or analyzing and forecasting staff/faculty salary budgets, contracts, grants, gifts, endowments, or user fees.

•Assists control unit staff in responding to special project requests from senior management.

Required Qualifications

•Demonstrated ability to independently gather and organize information, and perform financial analysis assignments.
•Ability to present information in a clear and concise manner both in writing and verbally.
•Proven ability to understand, articulate and adapt university accounting, payroll, and purchasing policies and procedures.
•Experience in developing budgets, conducting strategic/financial planning and forecasting, and designing financial reports.
•Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office and common desktop/web applications.
•Has demonstrated ability to work well as a member of a team as well as independently
•Has demonstrated ability to juggle multiple assignments and priorities with minimal supervision
•Ability to maintain confidentiality
•Bachelors degree in related area and/or equivalent experience/training.

Preferred Qualifications

•Extensive knowledge of University’s financial and budgetary processes, policies, and practices.
•Proficiency in the use of campus budgeting and finance systems (e.g., BFS, BAIRS, CalPlanning).

Salary & Benefits

For information on the comprehensive benefits package offered by the University visit:

http://atyourservice.ucop.edu/forms_pubs/misc/benefits_of_belonging.pdf

How to Apply

Please submit your cover letter and resume as a single attachment when applying.

Criminal Background Check

This position has been designated as sensitive and may require a Criminal Background Check. We reserve the right to make employment contingent upon successful completion of a Criminal Background Check.
­

Equal Employment Opportunity

The University of California, Berkeley is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
fields.title: Financial Analyst (7709U) #16772

fields.description:
The Senior Manager of Financial Reporting and Technical Accounting will be a key member and leading the function to ensure the company’s compliance with all technical accounting and financial reporting requirements. The primary responsibility of this role is the development and management of the external reporting process including all required technical accounting support. He or she will also be responsible for training, evaluating, and developing team members and ensuring they are equipped to handle their responsibilities. The Manager will also be responsible for monitoring the team's workload, delegating tasks and ensuring team goals and deadlines are met. This individual must have the ability to lead a team in a fast-paced environment where priorities and demands are frequently changing. He/she will also build cooperative working relationships with internal business partners and demonstrate an understanding of various operational and financial processes to facilitate the analysis and internal reporting processes. The Manager will also be involved in key projects and business initiatives that involve financial/accounting support.

 

  • Demonstrated leadership and team performance management including staff motivation, training, coaching/mentoring, development and evaluation.  Build a growing team that scales. Currently will manage a team of 2+ directs.
  • Assist with periodic Audit/Risk Committees’ materials and preparation, and other requests as needed.
  • Ensure internal control procedures and best practices are in place (including SOX controls).  Maintain systems and effective controls which verify the integrity of all systems, processes and data, and enhance the company’s value.
  • Responsible for the overal annual audit and seamless process with external auditors.
  • Maintain supporting documents for audit and assist in data requests of external, regulatory and other requirements.
  • Responsible for researching and analyzing technical accounting issues and their application to internal and external reporting and U.S. GAAP compliance. Summarize the resulting analysis and conclusion for both management review and to record in the general ledger.
  • Responsible for driving 409A valuation process and requests.
  • Ensure compliance with FAS 123R/ASC 718 as the primary owner for stock-based compensation accounting on a worldwide basis for all holders (including valuation and forecasting) and administration.
  • Review colloborative, legal and other financial agreements (e.g. accounting, reporting, insurance).
  • Take ownership to collaborate with Accounting and other groups to assess the reporting implications of changes in U.S. GAAP, ensure compliance with new and/or amended standards/interpretations, coordinate changes, and ensure availability of requisite information for financial reporting.
  • Assist in developing accounting policies and ensure adherence to those policies.
  • Assist in establishing written documentation and manuals of processes and procedures of daily accounting functions.
  • Responsible for all periodic, quarterly and annual related financial reporting. Assist in monthly balance sheet and income statement accounts’ trend analyses, and business review of financial results.
  • Currently responsible for revenue accounting ensuring all product revenue and related CoGS entries are properly recorded.
  • Be open to assisting hands on in working with the accounting close team during the monthly financial close process by reviewing journal entries, balance procedures and G/L reconciliations.
  • Assist with corporate insurance policies and renewals.
  • Assist with special projects and ad hocs requests/reporting as necessary.

ServiceNow, The Enterprise IT Cloud Company, is the industry-leading cloud platform provider for building enterprise applications.  We are redefining markets and changing the perception of enterprise software.  Our cloud platform allows enterprise IT to bring together business strategy, application design and operations in a powerfully simple solution.
 
To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for driversâpeople who thrive on responsibility and live for the next big challenge.  We seek to employ the brightest and most forward-thinking talent on the planet, and we want to hire people who have their best work ahead of them, not behind them.  Accelerate your career and succeed in an environment where you can make an impact daily.  We invite you to join in to stand out.

 

ServiceNow is seeking a Senior Financial Analyst to capitalize on the companyâs momentum.

fields.title: Senior Financial Analyst, Marketing

fields.description:
About Piper Jaffray

Piper Jaffray is a leading, international middle-market investment bank serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, Charlotte and London. Piper Jaffray investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the healthcare, industrials & clean technology, consumer, financial institutions, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Jaffray is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

We are currently looking to add an experienced analyst to our Technology, Media & Telecommunications team in San Francisco.

Experienced Analyst in Technology, Media & Telecommunications:

Our Analysts work closely with senior bankers to make a real impact on our clients’ businesses through involvement in all facets of investment banking activities including equity and debt offerings, valuations, private placements, mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and strategic advisory work. On a day-to-day basis our analysts:

  • Create financial models
  • Conduct financial valuations
  • Create and maintain industry-specific business development books
  • Conduct industry- and company-specific research
  • Interact with clients and senior bankers

Our environment is collaborative, demanding, fast-paced and entrepreneurial. Our clients are extraordinarily dynamic and our people have what it takes to excel.

Qualifications

This position requires an Analyst with 1 – 2 years of Investment Banking experience with formal training.

Piper Jaffray seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects.

Analyst Career Path

Piper Jaffray is dedicated to supporting analysts as they complete their two-year commitment. Top performers may have the option of a third year. Direct promotions to associate level positions are also available.

Analysts interested in pursuing opportunities outside of the firm will have the opportunity to participate in a program designed to give information and networking contacts for opportunities in private equity, corporate development and business school.

Piper Jaffray is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

fields.description:
Piper Jaffray Investment Banking Analyst Opportunity

About Piper Jaffray

Piper Jaffray is a leading, international middle-market investment bank and institutional securities firm, serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, Charlotte, and London. Piper Jaffray investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the clean technology and renewables, consumer, financial institutions, health care, industrial growth, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Jaffray is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

The Analyst Program

The investment banking analyst program is a rigorous two-year program for exceptionally qualified individuals. Our Analysts work closely with senior bankers to make a real impact on our clients’ businesses through involvement in all facets of investment banking activities including equity and debt offerings, valuations, private placements, mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and strategic advisory work. On a day-to-day basis our analysts:

  • Create financial models
  • Conduct financial valuations
  • Create and maintain industry-specific business development books
  • Conduct industry- and company-specific research
  • Interact with clients and senior bankers

Our environment is collaborative, demanding, fast-paced and entrepreneurial. Our clients are extraordinarily dynamic and our people have what it takes to excel.

Analyst Training & Development

Our analyst program begins in July with three weeks of rigorous training at our headquarters in Minneapolis. New analysts attend from offices around the world, including Minneapolis, New York, San Francisco, and London. Training is designed to give analysts a broad understanding of our firm and its capabilities, as well as a strong technical foundation. Technical topics covered include accounting, valuation, financial modeling and general computer skills. Trainees also attend overview sessions on the following:

  • Initial Public Offering (IPO) process
  • Merger & Acquisition process
  • Private Capital process
  • Alternative Investments
  • Corporate & Venture Services
  • Debt Capital Markets
  • High-Yield & Structured Products
  • Financial Sponsors
  • Convertibles
  • Equities
  • Restructuring

Numerous social and team-building activities take place throughout training to help new employees begin their careers with strong relationships among their peers.

Analyst Career Path

Piper Jaffray is dedicated to supporting analysts as they complete their two-year commitment. Top performers may have the option of a third year. Direct promotions to associate level positions are also available.

Analysts interested in pursuing opportunities outside of the firm will have the opportunity to participate in a program designed to give information and networking contacts for opportunities in private equity, corporate development and business school.

What We Look For

Piper Jaffray seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement (generally, a GPA above 3.3) as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects. The most successful analysts have taken courses in finance and accounting and are very familiar with financial modeling.

Piper Jaffray is an equal opportunity employer.

Piper Jaffray is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Are you a CPA with experience managing international accounting issues with a background in Private Accounting? Do you want to work for a very high-growth, fast paced company with a fantastic company culture? If so, this could be the perfect opportunity for you!

This position will report directly to the Controller and will help lead a best-in-class accounting team, build out processes, implement systems, get them ready for their first audit, and assist with their international growth.  The role is very broad as there is a lot to do and learn.  This is an ideal role for a motivated self-starter who wants the opportunity to make a significant impact within the organization.

fields.description:
Description

POSITION TITLE REVISED TO: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, TECHNICAL ACCOUNTING

Key financial executive responsible for providing leadership in: ensuring compliance throughout KFH/HP and subsidiaries with, and monitoring developments in, National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) statutory accounting and reporting requirements; establishing and maintaining consistency in application of statutory accounting and reporting across all applicable regions; represent KFH/HP in various external forums to influence statutory accounting standards setting; responsible for the accounting related aspects of regulatory reporting done by Corporate Controllers Department (CCD) including the California Department of Managed Health Care (DMHC); and acting as a regulatory accounting resource for the CCD, other departments and regional staff. At a future date, it is envisioned that this role will also assume responsibility for ensuring compliance throughout KFH/HP and subsidiaries with, and monitoring developments in, US GAAP accounting and reporting requirements.

Essential Functions:

• Provide general oversight, leadership, and direction for regulatory accounting throughout KFH/HP and subsidiaries, working with staff in various departments and the regional Health Plans.
• Monitor developments in DMHC and NAIC statutory accounting to identify issues that may affect KFH/HP, including attending meetings of the NAIC as needed.

• Ensure the strategic direction of actual and proposed changes to DMHC and NAIC statutory accounting is understood by KFH/HP and work with Corporate Controllers Department personnel, Government Relations and regional regulatory staff to ensure KFH/HP understands, evaluates and responds appropriately and timely to actual and proposed changes to DMHC and NAIC statutory accounting.
• Coordinate with Corporate Controllers Department and other personnel as necessary in the development and implementation of statutory accounting policies.
• Provide oversight, review and quality control for regional statutory audited financial statements to ensure that statutory accounting and reporting requirements are applied appropriately and consistently.

• Ensure that differences between US GAAP and statutory accounting are treated appropriately in audited statutory statements.
• Primary responsibility for oversight and review of regulatory accounting reports for which the Corporate Controllers Department is responsible including the California DMHC, the California Department of Health Care Services, the California Department of Corporations, U.S. Census and a variety of other reports prepared on a quarterly, annual and periodic basis.

• Present reports to senior management for review and approval prior to filing.
• Conduct regular meetings with regional and program office staff to review changes to NAIC statutory accounting and their implementation at KFH/HP.

• Work with staff through the organization to ensure consistent application of NAIC statutory accounting standards at a regional level.

• Monitor and report to senior management on the status of compliance with NAIC statutory accounting, including consistent treatment across KFHP/H regions.
• Act as backup to department staff preparing regulatory filings and ensure other staff assigned as backup maintain the knowledge and experience to perform backup duties as needed.

• Ensure desktop procedures are complete, comprehensive and up-to-date.
• Act as the Corporate Controllers Department resource for information requests related to regulatory audits when assistance is needed by other departments.
• Executes continuous improvement and daily operations managing within department budget.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

• Seven (7) to ten (10) years of comprehensive experience in financial and regulatory reporting.
• Five (5) to seven (7) years of experience supervising professional staff.
• Management Experience in complex, matrixed organizations.

• Substantial experience in change management including: effective goal setting for teams; successful motivation of work groups to adopt best practices; and restructuring to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness.
• Experience in senior management and Board of Directors level communications.
• Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance required.
• CPA required.

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience in DMHC reporting and generally accepted accounting principles preferred.
• Master's degree in business, finance, accounting or related field preferred.
• Extensive knowledge of NAIC statutory accounting and State DOI filings strongly preferred.
• Broad knowledge of the health care industry, insurance, managed care and integrated delivery systems preferred.
fields.title: Executive Director, Technical Accounting

fields.description:
The Sales & Trading Industrial Placement Internship Programme is aimed at undergraduates who are completing a four-year degree in which a year out in industry is a requirement. This one year placement is based in London and begins in June 2014. It offers the opportunity to learn about a variety of product areas, while providing a clear understanding of how Sales & Trading operates as a whole. Following an initial period of training and induction, you will be assigned to a particular team where you will spend the remainder of your placement. Interns are treated as full-time members of the team and work alongside experienced professionals at all levels.

Opportunities are typically available within the following teams:
• Client Coverage: This team acts as the first point of contact for all our Prime Brokerage hedge fund clients. Apart from overseeing the account activity and mitigating risk, the client coverage team really gets to know their client’s business so they can build a long-term relationship and ensure the Firm is well positioned to capitalise on future growth.

• Client Consulting Services: help new funds launch with a range of start-up services and best practices consulting, including finding office space, vendor systems and project management for the fund launch process.

• Risk Management: Review client portfolio risk reports and contribute to projects reviewing operational best practices, policies and procedures, and regulatory initiatives. The resulting work is communicated to a wide audience internally.

• Structured Products: Morgan Stanley offers synthetic derivative products to both institutions and hedge funds, allowing the access to markets with ease and simplicity. We also create bespoke structured solutions to meet client demand.

• Finance: Help to analyse trends in client profitability, including fees charged to clients, costs of internal and external financing, and direct and allocated costs.

• Bank Resource Management (BRM): At the core of ISG transaction flows across all of our market-facing businesses. BRM includes secured financing, fixed-income client facing (including short-term credit products and bond repo), equity securities lending, counterparty risk management and institutional securities documentation.

• Client Onboarding Team: Working with Morgan Stanley Sales teams and their clients to ensure that all necessary information is obtained for opening new subaccounts for Foreign Exchange (FX) and derivatives trading.

• The FX Gateway Team: Providing institutional investors access to FX hedge fund strategies. This can involve analysing the financial structure of the platform, monitoring the operational processes of the FX managers on the platform and carrying out longer-term projects involving other teams and departments within Sales and Trading.

Salary is competitive with excellent benefits.

We recruit on a rolling basis; therefore early application is strongly encouraged. Deadline for applications is Sunday 1st December 2013.

Skills Required
Skills Required:
• You are an undergraduate studying towards a degree where a year in industry is required as part of your structured course syllabus.
• You possess strong analytical, problem solving, communication and interpersonal skills.
• You are able to communicate clearly and succinctly and thrive in high pressure and continuously changing situations.
• You analyse and interpret complex information quickly and accurately.
• A financial degree discipline is not essential, although you should have a strong aptitude for numbers.
• You actively generate and share new ideas and are committed to achieving your career goals.
.

fields.description:
Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa’s innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world’s major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

Responsibilities:

The Global Pricing Strategy Analyst, will support or lead workstreams on projects related to Visa Inc.’s pricing strategy and/or broader corporate initiatives, including collaborating with business lines across Regional and Functional areas. Specific projects will vary greatly in sponsor, business or strategic focus, depth, and stakeholder served, ranging from broad coordination efforts across multiple regions and/or functional areas to focused special assignments for senior management that are of particular high strategic importance to Visa Inc.

The position requires the ability to apply strong analytical and critical thinking skills to solve business problems, and quickly arrive at recommendations that drive corporate priorities.

The Analyst will report to the Sr. Business Leader, Global Pricing Strategy, and will be based at Visa's offices in Foster City, California.

Specific responsibilities include:
  • Support and lead elements of global pricing strategy development and refinement, including global pricing opportunity identification and pricing change planning, including systems readiness, communication planning and compliance monitoring.
  • Manage aspects of rate change opportunity vetting, socialization and forecasting, including but not limited to business case and stakeholder impact assessment development around all proposed new fees/services and/or rate modifications.
  • Identify, prioritize, and execute the activities required to support Visa’s corporate strategies, priorities, and special initiative projects.
  • Work within cross-functional and cross-regional project teams to solve corporate business problems, collaborating and coordinating with a range of internal stakeholders to make recommendations on a wide range of business issues.
  • Support the prioritization of corporate strategic initiatives, and evaluate investment opportunities for their strategic and financial value.
  • Build and maintain business landscape knowledge, to provide solid foundational context for critical strategic projects.
  • Communicate and generate support for recommendations among business leaders across the organization.
  • Participate in continuous training with strategy teams.


    • Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree from top-tier institution or similar academic experience required.
  • Typically requires 3+ years of management consulting, investment banking or equivalent experience.
  • Payments industry experience preferred.
  • Global/multi-national business experience preferred.
  • Ability to work independently, usually within a complex and often ambiguous environment, to build rigorous, fact-bases that support recommendations to senior management, other executive, functional, or regional management.
  • Must be able to develop content independently, often under significant time constraints.
  • Should be able to prioritize work flow with limited supervision.
  • Ability to handle multiple project workstreams, with proven success in synthesizing large data sets related to a wide variety of functional business problems.
  • Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor.
  • Eagerness to work intensively in joint teams with personnel of all levels to accomplish project objectives.
  • Personal presence and ability to clearly communicate compelling messages in written and verbal communications.
  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to influence and build credibility as a "peer" with Global Functions and Regions.
  • Commitment to continuous training.
  • Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel.
fields.title: Global Pricing Analyst - Corporate Strategy

What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.

fields.description:
An Analyst with The Bank Street Group is involved in the execution of transactions across a variety of industries. Bank Street advises clients across various growth sectors including, but not limited to, the following:

 

  • In the Technology, Media and Telecom space, Bank Street advises clients in the following industry sub-sectors: Wireline, Wireless/Cellular, Managed Services, Hosted & Cloud Services, Data Centers and Software.
  • In the Financial Sponsors arena, Bank Street provides solutions to leading private equity investors (primarily leveraged buyout firms) and their portfolio companies.
  • In Debt Capital Markets, Bank Street helps clients raise capital in the debt markets and advises them on debt-related opportunities and capital structuring. Products include private placements, structured finance and syndicated finance.
  • In Equity Capital Markets, Bank Street helps clients raise capital in the private institutional equity markets and advises them on additional equity-related opportunities.
  • In Mergers and Acquisitions, Bank Street assists clients on strategic transactions on both the buy-side and the sell-side as well as transactions in Bankruptcy, typically representing a Debtor in Possession.

 

Within these areas, specific responsibilities will include:

 

  • Extensive financial modeling of various transactions
  • Assisting in the development of transactional strategies
  • Preparation of pitch materials for clients
  • Extensive interaction with the senior management of the firm, client representatives and counterparties

Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience and skills.

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

In this role, you will be responsible for day-to-day Finance support for Nexus products. You will partner with product, engineering, business development, sales and marketing teams in enabling hardware product launches, expansions, and ongoing operations. You will be responsible for accuracy and predictability of financial results and key metrics, product / user / P&L and Balance Sheet analytics, resource and investment planning, and partnerships’ financials and risk management. You will partner closely with other Finance functions in ensuring all finance related requirements (incl. accounting, treasury, tax, financial operations) for launches and existing operations are proactively managed.


Responsibilities
  • Provide business with clear insights into drivers of user metrics, revenue, costs, inventory, market trends, risks, and opportunities, leading to growth and product decisions
  • Lead Finance Go To Market and operational readiness for new products, channels and geographies, and ongoing supply-demand planning and analytics
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop analytical frameworks for understanding and improving the business and financial performance of our Hardware initiatives and product portfolio



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of relevant experience in management consulting, investment banking, finance, corporate strategy or similar environment


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • MBA or graduate technical degree.
  • Experience in Supply Chain Finance.
  • Excellent analytical and modeling skills, FP&A, accounting and project management experience. Strong problem solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with business partners.
  • Ability to self-start and self-direct work in an unstructured environment; comfortable dealing with ambiguity.
  • Demonstrated initiative, cross-functional communication and interpersonal skill.


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
fields.title: Financial Analyst, Mobile Hardware

fields.description:

This is a great opportunity for an experienced accounting lead eager to help build a best-in class accounting environment from scratch. As a key member of the finance team you will help us in designing best practices, internal controls, an efficient month-end close process and meaningful reporting packages. You’ll also get the chance to help the company scope, assess and implement a new accounting system and related tools.

The ideal candidate will have some international and consolidation accounting expertise as well as previous experience in both public and private accounting. They should also possess strong communication skills and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment.

Compensation:

  • Unlimited snacks and ping pong

fields.description:
RCS Capital Corp (RCAP) is seeking to immediately hire several experienced analysts in our New York office to join our investment banking team. RCAP was the number two advisor of REIT M&A transactions in 2012 and has advised on more than $19 billion of M&A and capital markets transactions in the past 18 months.  RCAP’s affiliate, American Realty Capital, is a sponsor of public traded and non-traded REITs and BDCs and other direct investment funds and currently manages 12 REITs, one BDC and two real estate-focused mutual funds, with $24 billion of assets currently under management.

 

A more complete job description can be found below.

 

The ideal candidate has 2-3 years’ experience in real estate or FIG investment banking or real estate private equity.

 

Job Description

 

Position: Investment Banking Analyst

 

Salary: Competitive compensation commensurate with experience

 

Tasks: The Investment Banking Analyst will work with senior bankers on financial models of capital transactions and M&A activity, including researching and interpreting company presentations and financial statements, creation and modification of complex financial models, creation of internal and external presentation / discussion materials and research, analysis and authoring of internal and external memoranda and other materials, including SEC filings.  In addition, the Investment Banking Analyst may assist with the analysis of property acquisitions / asset underwriting.

 

Experience: 2-3 years investment banking analyst (real estate or FIG preferred) or real estate private equity.  Pre-MBA candidates preferred.

 

Skills: Heavy financial modeling (Excel); review and interpretation of financial statements; financial and company research (SNL, Bloomberg); preparation and editing of presentations (PowerPoint); and preparation and editing of memoranda, press releases and SEC filings (Word).
fields.title: Investment Banking Analyst

fields.description:
As “Head of Digital Media Partnerships” for Datalogix you’ll have global responsibility for business development, sales, account management and execution of all DLX audience and measurement products across our largest digital media partners.  These strategic partners rely on Datalogix to help them build the right consumer targeting and measurement solutions for their media, thus driving increased media spending from top agencies and Fortune 500 brands.

 

In the role, you will be part of the Digital Services team, reporting to the SVP & GM, Digital Services.  While Datalogix is fully integrated with virtually every major digital media company, including Publishers, Portals, Exchanges, Ad networks, DSPs, DMPs and Agency Trading Desks, your focus would be working with Comscore 50 Publishers and Portals.


As “Head of Digital Media Partnerships” you will:

  • Own all DLX revenues related to our top Publisher and Portal partners
  • Drive adoption and growth of DLX Solutions
  • Develop close relationships with key personnel from partners – from senior execs to junior staff
  • Focus on recruiting A-level talent to your team
  • Actively participate in industry meetings and trade shows for the purpose of promoting our understanding of, and position within, the digital media ecosystem
  • Introduce compelling new products
  • Coordinate and work with internal DLX Product and Sales Leads to make DLX solutions align with partner goals
  • Report to the SVP & GM, Digital Services and work closely with other members of the senior management team.
fields.title: Head of Digital Media Partnerships
fields.skills:
Our management team is looking for a qualified candidate who will be energized by the dynamics of an entrepreneurial work environment. If you thrive on change, run with new challenges, and you’re interested in what you’ve read so far, you have the qualities we’re looking for in a candidate.

Here’s a summary of the skills you’ll need for this position:

  • 10+ years successfully implementing complex client solutions in digital advertising
  • Strategic Account Management / Solutions Selling / Business Development, versus simply Media Sales
  • Senior-level relationships at top Portals, Publishers and AdTech companies
  • Demonstrated track record of hitting monthly business and revenue goals
  • In-depth knowledge of online advertising processes and techniques, especially those relating to data and audience buying
  • Proven ability to recruit and manage revenue-producing talent
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving and strategic thinking skills
  • Solid verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills with executive level presence
  • Demonstrated ability to self-motivate, work in teams and be flexible within a dynamic environment
  • Ability to travel ~30% (SF base with travel to Denver, NY, LA, Chicago, London as needed)
  • BA/BS degree required, Top MBA is encouraged

fields.description:
Job Title – Technical accounting Senior Manager/Manager

 

Job Description:

 

The Senior Manager/Manager of Technical Accounting is a critical position through which Connor Group adds value to their clients.  The Senior Manager/Manager will take direction and learn from the directors and partners by preparing our clients for an IPO, M&A transaction or an audit. You will be involved with various technical accounting projects, including revenue recognition, equity accounting, memo research and writing, audit preparation and writing technical accounting policies. We rely heavily on our Senior Managers/Managers and expect a high degree of professionalism as we carry out the highest quality of professional service our clients require and expect. The Senior Manager/Manager is responsible for performing, supervising and reviewing the work of each client engagement.  Traditional responsibilities of the Senior Manager/Manager of Technical Accounting include advising, managing and assisting to resolve complex accounting issues, writing technical memos and accounting policies and drafting financial statements with accompanying footnotes.

 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Add value through complex transactions including IPOs, M&A, Reverse Mergers, etc.
  • Lead engagement teams and own client relationships
  • Strengthen client relationships and generate additional engagement opportunities through excellent quality, timely execution and strategic approach to service delivery
  • Add value to clients to successfully prepare and complete audits
  • Add value to public and private clients by assisting in any of the following:
    • Detailed revenue analysis and revenue recognition
    • Equity – stock compensation (FAS 123R, warrant accounting) and EPS
    • Draft or review complex sets of financial statements with disclosures
    • SEC Reporting, including 10K, 10Q and other filings
    • Identification and application of technical accounting guidance to client situations
    • Global accounting activities including IFRS, foreign currency and consolidations
    • Apply knowledge and understanding of governing principles, apply these principles to client transactions and communicate an understanding and application of these principles
    • Identify, analyze and conclude on generally accepted accounting principles for the client and consult with director or engagement partner
    • Ensure work is delivered timely and in accordance with firm standards

Supervise, coach and mentor all levels of staff. Conduct performance reviews and contribute to performance feedback and training. Develop and communicate workplace culture and code of conduct
fields.title: Technical Accounting - Senior Manager / Manager
fields.skills:

  • GPA of 3.5 or better
  • Rated top 25% of Big Four class
  • 5-12 years of public accounting and industry experience required (minimum of 3 years in public accounting)
  • 3 or more years of prior supervisory experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or equivalent required
  • CPA license required
  • Ability to manage teams and own their work product
  • Hard working, detail oriented and ability to motivate engagement teams
  • Professional and personable demeanor
  • Proven solid verbal and written communication skills
  • Passion for helping clients with a strong interest in technical accounting
  • Experience writing complex technical accounting position papers
  • Strong technical accounting knowledge of GAAP
  • Experience and familiarity with technology industries preferred
  • Ability to act and lead as the client contact
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Suite with strong Excel skills

 

Travel:

 

Ability to travel up to 20%

fields.description:
This position is responsible for accounting for investments and banking activities, configuring and maintaining software platforms related to investments and banking, and for preparing investment analysis and reports.

 

Duties include:

  • Configuration and Maintenance the Clearwater Analytics system:
  • Ensure the accuracy of data in the enterprise’ system of record for investments (Clearwater Analytics) by reconciling transactions and balances against records from investment custody banks
  • Coordinate with Clearwater Analytics to ensure that Enterprise data displayed on the Clearwater website is accurate
  • Ensure that month-end reports are accurate and tie to investment custodian statements
  • Prepare month-end close journal entries for treasury-related transactions across the enterprise particularly for investment transactions, investment management fees, bank fees, treasury vendor payments, and funds transfers initiated by Treasury
  • Prepare detailed month-end reports for investment income and bank fees, and reconcile to summary  figures reported by accounting during monthly close meetings
  • Support the preparation of Investment Reports for the Investment Committee (executive management) and Finance Committee (Board of Directors)
  • Ensure timely processing payment of all Treasury related bills:
  • Collect and process all treasury-related invoices from banks, investment managers, and other outside vendors
  • Ensure payment by the appropriate AP department
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations for investment balances, income, and other investment transactions between the Clearwater database, Oracle GL, and bank statements
  • Work with Sr. Treasury Analyst to provide on-line access for all bank accounts to Treasury staff and specific accounting personnel as required
  • Assist in the preparation of the treasury-related items in the annual budget process and track actuals to budget
  • Draft and maintain treasury business processes in the areas of investment management and treasury accounting
  • Support internal and external audits
  • Ensure compliance with internal controls, policies and procedures.
  • Coordinate with other treasury staff and outside resources to provide meaningful fact-based analysis and reports to drive efficient and effective decision-making

fields.description:
Senior Financial Analyst



Why work for our Division: Finance is a global organization that’s dedicated to the short- and long-term growth and success of VMware – and to using analytical tools and collaboration to build connections internally and externally. It’s a fast-paced environment, with lots to learn. We’re looking for people with strong critical thinking skills, who want to work collaboratively, serve our customers and make good choices. Uncompromising ethics and integrity are hallmarks of our organization. We’re a diverse group, covering the areas of corporate finance, FP&A, pricing, mergers and acquisition integration, revenue, investor relations, treasury, license compliance, tax, internal audit and the many corporate accounting functions. Come, join our team of motivated professionals, and grow with VMware.

VMware has an opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst to join our Corporate FP&A Team in a challenging, fast-paced environment. The candidate will report to a Sr. Finance Manager.

- Responsible for the timely and accurate development and completion of monthly forecasts, flux analysis, and bi-annual budget for benefits, bonus rates, and merit increases by country across the entire organization
- Effectively establish a finance partnership with HR to understand current benefit structure and proposed future changes and/or developments
- Work closely with departmental teams to provide monthly and quarterly reporting metrics and variance reporting
- Creating a process framework to work closely with the HR, FP&A, and Accounting groups work towards predictability of results
- Monitoring of monthly benefits close
- Developing deep understanding of systems and forecasting processes in order to drive efficiency and process improvement
- Partnering with IT, Finance Systems Ops and FP&A to improve Benefits allocation process
- Assisting with system upgrades and enhancements
- Assisting Corporate FP&A with quarter-end reporting deliverables
- Ad hoc analysis and management reporting

Qualifications and Education Requirements:

- 5-7 years’ experience in financial planning and analysis.
- B.A. or B.S. in Business, Finance, or Accounting; a MBA, or CPA is preferred.
- Strong interpersonal and team building skills; ability to work with a diverse team and influence/drive change across functional and business boundaries.
- Previous experience supporting Corp FP&A departments as a Senior Financial Analyst is desirable.
- Strong financial modeling, spreadsheet, and database skills.
- Strong project management, planning, and organization skills, including ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
-Self starter who can take charge of complex tasks with minimal direction and develop new strategies and new ways of approaching business challenges independently
- Continuous improvement attitude; ability to suggest and implement best practices.
- Proficiency in computer-based analysis and complex financial modeling.
- Experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Oracle Financials, and Hyperion Essbase or SAP BPC Planning tools.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Self-starter with unquestionable integrity.

Location
Palo Alto, CA, US

Requisition Number
46410BR

EEO Statement
VMware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions, which include: recruiting and hiring, selection for training, promotion, rates of pay or other compensation, transfer, discipline, demotion, layoff or termination. VMware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, family medical history or genetic information, citizenship, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, military status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. VMware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law. Further, it is the policy of VMware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment.

fields.description:
TITLE:    Senior Software Engineer

REPORTS TO: Manager of Development for Sourcing Engineering NA

DEPARTMENT:  Sourcing Product

LOCATION: Sunnyvale, CA

Company Overview

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billion dollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help

 

Position Overview:

The Ariba Sourcing team focuses on designing and implementing cutting edge solutions to automate the complete Sourcing lifecycle – from supplier discovery and negotiation to award optimization and savings tracking.  A unique Software-as-a Service (SaaS) solution, Ariba Sourcing is the most widely adopted and complete strategic sourcing offering in the marketplace used by thousands of companies to create and implement competitive best-value agreements.

We are looking for a technically gifted, highly motivated, principal software engineer capable of making an immediate impact, contributing to the expansion and fulfillment of the team’s vision. As a Principal Software Engineer you will be responsible for the design, development and support of key functional areas for the Ariba Sourcing product. Bring your passion for solving business problems which will make a huge impact in how business sourcing works. 

 

For immediate attention, send resume directly to: sconlon@ariba.com

.
