fields.description:
Summary: This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced level budget or financial analyst to join Berkeley Laboratory working in the Computing Sciences Directorate.  We support three Divisions within Computing Sciences: NERSC, Scientific Networking, and the Computational Research Divisions.  The primary goal of this position is to provide a full range of advanced budget and analytical support to the NERSC Program and the Design Forward initiative managed by the NERSC Division.   It’s a great place to start learning about the Laboratory and its science mission.

 

See http://www.nersc.gov/ for program details.

 

Position Description:  This position is matrixed from the OCFO Field Operations Management Unit to the Computing Sciences (CS) Business Team to provide consultative services on federal program management and serve as the primary financial point of contact for the National Energy Research Scientific Computing Center (NERSC) Program. Working under consultative technical direction and supervision of the Computing Sciences Business Manager, this position works with NERSC senior and mid-level management to independently develop and maintain a diverse and highly complex set of budget formulation submissions/proposals, monthly budget execution reports, summaries, models, forecasts and analyses. Interact with DOE (Department of Energy) Federal Program Managers and Berkeley Site Office staff on project management activities and reporting.  Provide support for major computational procurements managed under DOE Order 413.3 or similar approaches directed by the DOE Office of Science. Processes cost adjustments/corrections, performs additions/changes to chart of accounts and submits monthly accruals. Prepares financial analysis and presentations to support a variety of business objectives, including cost benefit analyses and long range planning activities for senior management.

 

Essential Elements of the Position:

 

Financial Reporting & Analysis (40%): Broadly apply advanced technical knowledge to independently develop, produce and modify routine and specialized financial reports.  Independently prepare institutionally submitted annual NERSC cost/spend plans and then reconcile, evaluate and recommend adjustments to planned costs based on actual costs for a given period, month, quarter or year. Prepare cost analysis of work breakdown structures to support project and operational management.  Prepare, execute, and serve as primary contact for resource adjustments, project ID open/closure, and chart of accounts.

 

Reports Production, Programming & Financial Modeling (35%): Independently develop innovative solutions to extracting and using financial data from institutional financial management systems. Organize large data sets into easy-to-understand and manageable financial reports.  Support the use of advanced Excel capabilities (i.e., spreadsheets, macros, data tables and formulas) to create highly advanced models used for decision support and analysis.

 

Consultative & Advisory Support for Federal Program Management (20%):  Independently develop and propose innovative solutions to highly complex budget management requirements.  Assist NERSC Senior management in understanding and interpreting DOE and OCFO reporting and budget management issues.  Independently develop financial or project management components to support the Program, including regular and ad hoc DOE program/budget reviews. Provide consultative direction and advice to the Project Managers for major computational procurements managed under DOE Order 413.3 or similar approaches directed by the DOE Office of Science. 

Specialized Business & Operational Analysis (5%):  Contribute to CS Business Team’s capabilities to support Sponsor reviews of operational and project costs.  Contribute financial and programming expertise to independently develop advanced models to facilitate long range business decision making and support.  Research and develop innovative and practical solutions to measure, quantify, benchmark, and document ongoing improvement program efforts and efficiencies.
fields.title: Staff or Principal Financial Analyst
fields.skills:
Essential:  6-8 years of relevant or comparable job experience and/or educational background in financial, project and operational analysis covering areas such as alternative analysis and pricing models.  The relevant educational background includes a Bachelor’s degree in a business discipline or equivalent in accounting or business administration. Advanced knowledge level of accounting and budgeting principles and the ability to apply advanced theories and concepts to computer spreadsheets and report generation applications.  Advanced knowledge and experience with spreadsheets and financial databases, such as Excel, Access and PeopleSoft financial applications and other standard office software such as Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Project. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Able to interact effectively with broad range of employees at many levels, especially at the senior management level.  Advanced knowledge of Cost Accounting Standard principles and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.

 

Marginal: MS/MBA or extensive graduate work desired. Prior experience as an analyst on a DOE Order 413.3 managed project. Understanding of DOE and other Federal process and regulations. Knowledge of LBNL, DOE and WFO sponsor reporting requirements and audit policies. Knowledge of University of California business environment. An understanding of LBNL, Divisional, and DOE financial policies, practices and procedures. Advanced knowledge of PeopleSoft financial applications.

 

Salary Levels:  At Principal Resource Analyst (F25.4) Classification Level: $84,384/year (minimum) to $116,016/year (maximum)

 

Qualifications (Financial Analyst Classification):

Essential

  • Bachelor degree in a business discipline or equivalent in budgeting/accounting or business administration or equivalent level of work experience and education.
  • Minimum of two years of experience in budget development, planning and support in midsize to large business unit
  • Applied knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and cost accounting standards (CAS)
  • Demonstrated experience in providing financial and budget analysis.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills
  • Substantial experience with Excel and other Microsoft Office applications as well as Google web applications.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the proven ability to interact effectively with peers and a broad range of customers, including scientists, other divisional budget analysts, other LBNL departmental staff, and program sponsors and other external stakeholders.

Marginal

  • Working knowledge of Federal Cost Accounting Standards and other Federal process and regulations.
  • Knowledge of LBNL, DOE and WFO sponsor reporting requirements and audit policies.
  • Knowledge of University of California business environment. An understanding of LBNL, Divisional, and DOE financial policies and procedures.

Salary Levels:

 

At Resource Analyst (F25.2) Classification Level: $56,856/year (minimum) to $78,180/year (maximum)

fields.description:
Accounting Manager


TellApart helps many of the world's most successful retailers unlock the power of their customer data by applying the latest advances in cloud computing, predictive analytics, and machine learning. Our Customer Data Platform collects and analyzes massive amounts of data to power an integrated suite of marketing solutions that delivers personalized shopping experiences for 100s of millions of consumers in real time.


TellApart is backed by Greylock Partners and Bain Capital Ventures. Several of technology's top executives have also invested in TellApart, including: Ron Conway (SV Angel), Dick Costolo (CEO, Twitter), Reid Hoffman (Founder & Chairman, LinkedIn), Jeff Jordan (former CEO, OpenTable), Phil Libin (CEO, Evernote) and Mike Walrath (former CEO, RightMedia). David Rosenblatt (former CEO, DoubleClick) is also an executive advisor.


Why we need you:


We are seeking a dynamic, talented, experienced and extremely motivated individual to lead accounting for us. Based in Burlingame, CA, you will report directly to our VP, Business Operations. We are looking for a key individual contributor to help us oversee the accounting function, financial reporting and budgeting activities. We need someone who has experience in developing and managing the build-out of financial controls and implementing systems necessary for a dynamic, fast moving company. As an Accounting Manager at TellApart, you are someone who is able to roll up their sleeves to:

  • Execute the monthly, quarterly and year-end close processes, prepare consolidations, review journal entries and reconciliations, publish internal/external consolidated financial statements
  • Own the day-to-day accounting activities - general ledger accounting, AR, AP, accruals, payroll accounting and financial reporting
  • Prepare, present, and analyze financial statements to executive management teams
  • Develop internal control and safeguards for receipt of revenue, costs, and program budgets and actual expenditures
  • Establish and maintain corporate accounting policies, procedures, and internal controls to ensure conformance with US GAAP, tax and other laws/regulations
  • Proactively lead all aspects of technical accounting, including revenue recognition and deferred stock compensation; research technical accounting matters as they arise and determine accounting treatment for complex transactions
  • Oversee first external financial audit and subsequent audits


Your qualifications:

  • 8+ years of total accounting experience, preference given to candidates with both public accounting experience and experience at fast-growing startups
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent required; CPA highly preferred
  • Thorough understanding of GAAP and the ability to research technical accounting issues
  • Strong knowledge of IT-based accounting systems and other relevant information systems
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proven ability to exercise sound judgment, making decisions based on accurate and timely analysis (with a sharp attention to detail)
  • Crisp written and verbal communication skills with an ability to communicate across all levels of the organization
  • Uncompromising professional integrity and dependability with a high level of respect for all individuals
  • Strong process and project management skills. Ability to manage multiple priorities and activities to meet tight deadlines with a strong sense of urgency and a high degree of accuracy
  • Experience with the software and online advertising industries a plus

fields.description:
The Role:

The Senior Manager of Technical Accounting and Reporting is responsible for:

  • Support the Director of Accounting, as the Company’s subject matter expert on accounting issues for both existing and new FASB and IASB accounting standards.
  • Research new accounting guidance from the FASB, IASB, SEC and other regulatory bodies, including evaluating the impact of new guidance on the Company’s financial statements.
  • Responsible for preparing technical accounting memos documenting the Company’s accounting position/treatment of the accounting matters as they arise.
  • Review and manage technical research on complex accounting issues and prepare documentation outlining conclusions, primarily in the areas of revenue recognition and operations accounting.
  • Maintain Company’s accounting policies and memos, and the creation of new policies. Draft and update global accounting policies as necessary and roll them out internationally.
  • Provide technical accounting support for significant transactions. Assist with and/or complete ad hoc projects as requested (e.g. research and document issues, valuation assistance associated with business combinations, M&A activity, goodwill impairment, segment reporting analysis, etc.)
  • Support Company-wide educational efforts on accounting related issues, including existing and new accounting guidance and policies.
  • Assist with all periodic, quarterly and annual reporting/SEC filings, including Forms 8-K, 10-Q and 10-K - Manage and review documentation preparation, data analysis, integrity validation and filing submission readiness, including interacting on a regular basis with key members of various departments to gather, consolidate and analyze information.
  • Continuously improve the efficiency and effectiveness of reporting. Implement process improvements in reporting and disclosure process, taking a pro-active approach with the goals of streamlining processes, increasing quality and communications and monetary efficiency.
  • Review monthly, quarterly and annual SOX controls over G/L, equity, goodwill and intangibles, and financial reporting processes.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.


Your Skills:

For consideration, you must bring the following skills and behaviors to our team:

Move fast. Speak up. Decide and own. Drive change. Exceed customer needs. These are some of the winning behaviors you’ll need for success at Logitech. In this role you will:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related discipline required. CPA license is required. - Minimum 4 years Big 4 firm experience, 3 - 5 years industry experience preferred.
  • Excellent analytical skills and knowledge of technical accounting matters, US GAAP, SEC regulations.
  • Proficiency with Excel, Word, Powerpoint and Oracle 11i/R12 preferred.
  • Ability to adapt and prioritize in a dynamic environment. Demonstrate a vigilant attention to detail.
  • Strong project management, leadership, relationship development and people management skills. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to communicate in an effective, concise manner.
  • Demonstrates initiative and is self-motivated.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills and ability to make sound decisions.
  • Ability to multi-task and consistently meet deadlines.
  • Results orientation with an ability to manage the overall project, collaborate with different individuals across the organization, and “roll-up the sleeves” in order to accomplish all necessary tasks.
  • Must possess excellent written, presentation and organizational skills
  • Hi-tech industry experience preferred.

Small Company. Big Products.

Logitech is a world leader in products that connect people in a natural, intuitive way to the digital experiences they care about. We develop our products with a powerful blend of artistic design, surprising science, and innovation driven by consumer insight. Our consumer products are designed for popular computing devices--PCs and Macs, tablets and smartphones. Want to be part of this team of innovators?

Logitech is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Logitech are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.
fields.title: Senior Manager, Technical Accounting and Reporting

fields.description:
Textainer currently has a Senior Accountant position open at our administrative headquarters office conveniently located in San Francisco’s Financial District.

 

This position is responsible for the accounting, finance and reporting for the Company’s Treasury Department. Specific duties include:

 

Internal and External Reporting:

  • Prepare required treasury and finance related schedules for accounting close.
  • Prepare treasury and finance related footnotes, supporting schedules and analysis for GAAP financial reporting and SEC filing.
  • Prepare credit facility profile on monthly basis.
  • Responsible in confirming treasury and finance related general ledger account balance to accounting department.
  • Primary liaison for overall aspects of treasury and finance related accounting reporting.
  • Prepare monthly payment date packages (manager report, asset base report and hedging summary) for designated entities to external lenders.
  • Prepare financial covenant calculations and other schedules required by debt agreements.
  • Assist in forecast and develop sensitivity analyses around covenant ratios as needed.
  • Prepare information as requested by other departments and external lenders.

 

Cash and Debt Management:

  • Maintain and update cashbooks for designated bank accounts.
  • Prepare wire transfer, cash book reconciliation and related journal entries.
  • Prepare debt related schedules and journal entries on designated entities.
  • Manage designated debt facility portfolios.
  • Prepare and manage funding request on designated entities.
  • Ensure accurate accrual and payment of interest income and expense components.

 

Hedging and Derivatives Management:

  • Prepare monthly fair valuations on derivative contracts and related journal entries.
  • Maintain hedging portfolio summaries.
  • Determine hedging needs on designated entities.
  • Assist in derivative accounting research and recommendation as needed.
  • Responsible in analyzing and reporting all derivative transactions.
  • Support derivative accounting system updates.

 

Other:

  • Prepare monthly preliminary interest revenue and expense estimates.
  • Assist with annual budgets.
  • Assist with due diligence, internal and external financial audits.
  • Update SOX narratives documentation.
  • Act as a backup for the Treasury Analyst as needed.
  • Other projects and duties as assigned.

 

At Textainer, we offer a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package including health and wellness benefits for you and your family, 401k retirement plan with company matching, paid vacation days and holidays, flexible work hours as well as training and education opportunities.  We are committed to fostering an environment that promotes work-life balance.

 

We will accept resumes for this position until Thursday, October 24, 2013.

 

To apply for this position, please submit your resume through Textainer's Career Opportunities website at http://www.textainer.com/Careers/CareerOpportunities.aspx.

 

Textainer (NYSE:  TGH) was established in 1979 and is a leader in the global marine container leasing industry. Textainer leases standard, special dry freight, and refrigerated marine containers to international shipping lines. Textainer also purchases older containers from its shipping line customers and sells these containers along with containers being disposed from its own fleet. Since 2003 Textainer has been the primary supplier of containers to the U.S. Military. Today, Textainer is the largest lessor of marine containers and the largest seller of second hand containers in the world.

 

The Company’s strategy is to be the most reliable supplier of quality containers. This strategy is implemented by paying detailed attention to all aspects of the business including: providing superior equipment; ensuring it is available in the right place and the right time; charging competitive rates; minimizing repair costs; and operating a professional, experienced organization. Whether you need 20' standard dry freight containers in Shanghai, 40' high cubes in Chicago, or folding flatracks in Hamburg, Textainer provides the high quality equipment and excellent service you expect from a world leader. 

 

Textainer's owned and managed container fleet is comprised of 2.9 million twenty foot equivalent units (TEU). The Company has over 400 leasing customers, who include virtually all of the world's leading international shipping lines, and approximately 1,000 container sales customers. Textainer’s 160 employees and dedicated representatives are located around the world in major international shipping and trading centers; the network of regional and area offices form the backbone of Textainer's leasing, resale, and operations efforts.

 

To learn more about the company, please visit www.textainer.com.

 

Must be eligible to work in the United States for any employer (cannot sponsor work visa or pay for relocation). Textainer is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. This employer participates in the E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification Program.

If you are a Business Analyst with Salesforce.com implementation experience, please read on!

We are a Global Investment Bank with beautiful offices in West Los Angeles. Our IT team is seeking a star Business Analyst with Salesforce implementation experience to join the team. We will take care of relocation costs from the Bay Area to LA.

The Salesforce analyst / administrator will be responsible for supporting tactical day to day administration and operation of the Salesforce platform and related processes and workflows, as well as working with user community on an ongoing basis to improve and enhance the CRM platform to support the investment banking business globally. The analyst will be part of an initial implementation effort as well as post go live support and future enhancement phases of the CRM system and platform. The analyst needs to have firm grasp of CRM best practices to drive and foster greater CRM adoption and to improve internal customer experience on an ongoing basis.

What you need for this position:
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
- Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a cross functional team environment required
- Strong customer focus, ability to probe customer needs and translate customer requirements into system specifications required
- 2-5 years of business analysis and/or data analysis experience required
- Strong business acumen, superb knowledge of business processes and CRM best practice required
- 2+ years of strong operational experience with SalesForce.com required
- Salesforce administrator certification a strong plus
- Bachelor's degree in business or information systems preferred

What you'll be doing:
- Perform system administrator function of the Salesforce CRM application. Responsible for maintaining functional areas of contacts / relationship, accounts, opportunities, dashboards and reports.
- Create and execute queries and reports, maintain user roles, security and profiles.
- Work in a cross functional environment with various business groups, IT and end users to identify, document, and communicate business processes.
- Maintain and enhance visual layout, workflow rules and business logic layer to streamline and enhance business processes and improve user experience.
- Implement and integrate third-party products / applications on the salesforce platform.
- Work with IT and Salesforce and other 3rd party vendors to maintain smooth operation and performance of the platform.
- Coordinate and lead user acceptance tests with the business units and end users against business requirements.
- Maintain key system metrics to track trends in usage / adoption and data integrity.
- Train end users, prepare related documentation (requirements, training materials, process and data flows, use cases, functional design, etc), participate in cross-functional teams, communicate key messages or address critical questions from the user base involving the CRM.

What's in it for you:
- Full time, permanent role
- Base salary + bonus
- 401K + full benefits
- Work with one of the top IT teams in Finance
- Beautiful offices in West LA + lots of perks!

So, if you are a Business Analyst with Salesforce experience, please apply today!

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Email your resume in Word to:

Julia.Gliner@cybercoders.com

fields.description:
Morgan Stanley is a global leader in wealth management with an extensive network of over 500 offices and 16,000 Financial Advisors around the world. Our Financial and Wealth Advisors deliver tailored solutions to fit individual investment objectives, risk tolerance and liquidity needs. We provide individuals, families, businesses and institutions with a wide variety of financial services: brokerage and investment advice, financial and wealth planning, banking and lending, cash management, annuities and insurance, and retirement and trust services.

Commencing in early July, the competitive 26-month Branch Analyst program places you in one of our branches located throughout the United States.
During the program, analysts will have rotations in Operations/Service, Risk and Business Development and a placement with a Financial Advisor team. Analysts are required to take and pass both the Series 7 and 66 in the first month after orientation prior to beginning the rotations. Continuing the program is contingent on passing both exams.

The Branch Analyst’s responsibilities will include: • processing and analyzing financial data for client portfolios • creating asset allocation reviews and financial plans • developing proposals and presentations for prospects and clients • analyzing the Financial Advisors’ books of business and identifying new business opportunities • identifying opportunities to promote the development of client relationships, (prospecting clients through cold calling, and organizing client seminars)

Our employees are critical to delivering world-class service to our clients and positive results to our shareholders. To accomplish these goals, we seek to attract and retain the most talented individuals from across the industry. By fostering creativity, encouraging debate and recognizing achievement, we have created an environment that challenges individuals to achieve their best performance for our clients. We view career development as an ongoing process, and we offer our employees challenging developmental opportunities, both on the job and within a training environment.



Skills Required


Success as a Branch Analyst in Wealth Management requires:
• the applicant to be a graduate of an four-year accredited college or university by the time they begin orientation• a minimum overall GPA of 3.2
• a strong desire and commitment to understand the global wealth management business
• an ability to understand and interpret numeric data, especially as it relates to financial services
• effective communication and interpersonal skills (both written and oral) • demonstrated leadership skills
• the ability to work effectively on a team


Skills Desired

Application Deadline November 29th

fields.description:
The Senior Director, Integrated Campaigns will provide executional and thought leadership in all aspects of the integrated marketing organization. This seasoned professional will have responsibility for strategic planning and execution of programs including, PR, website, events, regional field marketing, social media and infrastructure.

 

The Senior Director will lead a talented team of creative, lead gen and marketing communications professionals and will be responsible for recruiting, developing, and retaining key individuals and team leaders to ensure a highly functioning and effective organization. The Senior Director will mentor team members as they develop professional knowledge, communication skills and organizational savvy.

 

This position involves substantial interactions with multiple parts of the corporation. As such, the Senior Director will showcase excellence in communications at all levels of the organization and will maintain an organization that fosters a collaborative spirit within the integrated marketing organization.

 

The Senior Director is responsible for the implementation of programs to drive the adoption of products through targeted promotional programs and campaigns that are integrated with online and other marketing efforts as well as the development of the marketing tactics for these activities. These programs will involve a full range of online and multi-media services (podcasts, videos, interactive presentations, webinars), and will ensure the localization of messaging to appropriate geographic regions.

 

The Senior Director will implement methodologies and process for reporting and capturing metrics to measure and improve program effectiveness and will implement best practices and processes from outside our company and industry to improve and streamline integrated marketing activities.

 

Responsibilities:

Brand Management

  • Act as brand steward: understand corporate branding and thought-leadership objectives and obtain buy-in from executive management on brand direction
  • Manage creative teams to create brand guidelines for written and visual communications, and review/update periodically
  • Provide ongoing brand guidance and mentorship to creative teams (writers, editors, graphic designers, etc)
  • Ensure all deliverables, both written and visual, created by internal and external teams adhere with brand guidelines
  • Create and maintain library of corporate templates (doc/ppt/xls) and corporate identity system (business cards, letterhead, signage)
  • Manage graphic designers/writers on specific deliverables for: collateral, videos, templates, signage, websites, sales tools, etc.

 

Content Marketing (Strategy)

  • Drive the development and effective use of engaging content across all touch points to improve lead generation, thought leadership, and engagement metrics
  • Understand personas and sales cycles and drive relevant content creation to support/increase conversion throughout the buying journey to closed business
  • Coordinate a cross-functional team to align around content themes and topics; manage content calendar to keep all stakeholders aware of deliverables and roles
  • Optimize content to improve search engine ranking, visitation, and conversion
  • Ensure timely and engaging use of content through appropriate channels (website, blogs, social channels, third party channels, marketing programs, sales teams, etc.)
  • Develop a variety of content types, including: infographics and other “fun” thought-leadership oriented content, articles, animated videos, research/buying guides, interactive/online tools, microsites, ebooks, briefs, and customer stories (written, video, talking head interviews, etc.)
  • Test and report on content effectiveness; make recommendations for improvement/innovation
  • Contribute personally to content creation, writing when possible and appropriate; manage relationships with writers/freelancers, editors, content strategists
  • Act as chief editor and arbiter of best practices in grammar, messaging, writing, and style to ensure consistency
  • Work closely with graphic designers/creative teams to ensure visuals support the brand and reinforce messaging in all content

 

Program Marketing (Execution)

  • Manage the creation, execution, and measurement of cross-channel marketing campaigns and programs using a content-marketing strategy
    • Email campaigns – through third-party channels
    • Email campaigns – nurture through Marketo
    • Print advertising
    • Online (banner) advertising
    • Content postings
    • Surveys
    • Webinars
    • List builds
    • CPC ad campaigns – Google Adwords, LinkedIn
  • Support international teams with regional marketing activities and events
  • Ensure timely lead flow and response

 

Web Marketing

  • Manage the creative, technical, and operational aspects of all E2open social media channels(Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google+, Pinterest, YouTube)
    • Maintain profiles
    • Update graphics, ensure brand consistency
    • Ensure frequent/timely postings
    • Technical/app integrations (e.g., YouTube, Work4Us in Facebook)
    • Promote usage internally for SEO
    • Analytics and reporting
  • Other management
    • Microsite management (e.g., Leaders Forum)
    • Third-party listings and directories
    • Third-party link management

fields.description:
You’ve probably heard of ValueClick, and may know something about what we do. We’re a company about endless possibilities. With many of the strongest businesses in Media (ValueClick Media), CRM (Dotomi), Mobile (Greystripe), Affiliate (Commission Junction), and Technology (Mediaplex) ValueClick, Inc. transforms client businesses – and the industry – every day! The key to our success is a culture of empowerment that emphasizes responsibility, accountability, and a really awesome spirit of teamwork. And that success has driven our tremendous growth. Every day we work with more than 400 blue chip companies including 3 of the top 4 cellular carriers, 7 of the top 10 car manufacturers, 8 out of 10 pharmaceutical companies, 70 of the top 100 retailers, and 97 of the top travel companies, to name just a few of the categories where we dominate in providing powerful marketing solutions that drive stronger results than ANY competitor! It takes superstars to work here, and if that’s what you are, there’s no better place to make your mark! We live eat sleep and breathe data. How to use it to better meet customer needs. How to make it the lynchpin of programs that drive extraordinary growth for your clients. Everyone talks about data in our industry; what’s different about us is our focus on making data actionable.

Why Join Us?

The real question is, why not join ValueClick Media?! It’s not every day you’re offered the chance to be a part of something exciting and uniquely innovative. With an established presence in the industry – we’ve been satisfying digital customers for more than a decade – and a full-service audience targeting platform to match, we invite you to be a part of the future of digital advertising. Hold on to your seat as your career revs up with a company that eats and sleeps innovation.

Having mastered display advertising, we set out to take on mobile and video and have done so with great success. Our expert product management team and data aces ensure you have the latest and greatest in digital solutions to not only meet your numbers, but exceed them each quarter!

Join ValueClick Media and grow your career by working with a world class sales team consistently nominated and recognized via prestigious IAB Best Online Media Sellers awards as well as other regional sales excellence recognition. . We are equal parts digital geeks and evangelists, and we thrive on the fact that sales runs deep in our DNA.

Your mission

As a competitive, motivated, sales pro, you will utilize your in-depth understanding of the online media industry and complexities of the underlying technology from either an ad sales or media planning perspective. Drive new mobile business and strategic engagements with top marketers and ad agencies. Work in an entrepreneurial environment that is performance-driven. With tremendous upside earning potential, you will enjoy delivering exceptional results and continually exceeding sales goals. You will utilize your strong problem-solving skills to provide custom solutions based on client marketing objectives while you proficiently communicate the subject of online advertising technologies, including cross platform solutions, optimization, advanced targeting, inventory sources, attribution analysis and trading desks.

Requirements

Is this you?

  • Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree a plus
  • You are a strategic thinker, with the ability to translate marketer needs into compelling concepts and solutions
  • You are comfortable and proficient with the entire sales cycle from prospecting, face to face meetings, pitching and contract negotiations
  • Possess superb organizational, written, and verbal communication skills
  • Proven track record of revenue generation
  • In depth understanding of digital media and consumer behavior
  • Proven collaboration skills, with ability to lead cross functional teams to achieve sales results
  • Minimum of 1 year of online media experience with expertise in digital, online media or technology
  • Passionate student of online media best practices and trends

fields.description:
Within Ernst & Young's Assurance service line, Financial Accounting Advisiry Services (FAAS) professionals provide advisory services encompassing accounting and regulatory support on accounting change and special matters; accounting processes and controls support (remediation, long-term contract accounting and cost accounting); GAAP conversion and implementation; IPO and other public offering assistance; on call financial reporting advice; and transaction accounting and financial reporting assistance (purchase price allocation).

We currently have a career opportunity for a Senior to participate in and supervise multiple FAAS engagements as fieldwork leader of an engagement team.

Responsibilities
Confer and agree with other team members to create or customize work plans.
Execute procedures using the FAAS service delivery framework.
Ensure quality in delivering client service by directing daily progress of fieldwork, informing supervisors of engagement status.
Review work of staff to ensure completeness, accuracy, and proper documentation. Provide daily guidance and coaching to staff and help mentor, develop and evaluate them.
Follow through on client requests in a timely fashion, and manage expectations regarding the timing of deliverables and reports.
Develop and maintain productive working relationships with client personnel and assess client satisfaction.
Identify engagement and client service issues. Research and benchmark client data to industry data. Explain the client's critical success factors to the engagement team.
Archive FAAS engagements in a timely manner and in compliance with firm policy.
Discuss moderately complex accounting with the engagement team and client management. Analyze evidence, reach conclusions, interpret and apply standards, and identify non-compliance while applying a balanced view of all client matters.
Comply with all applicable firm policies and guidelines as well as the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct and other professional standards.
Benchmark client data to industry data in order to make possible recommendations for improvements.
Apply independent and objective professional judgment in applying auditing and accounting standards to meet engagement expectations, including regulatory requirements.
Demonstrate a good understanding of accounting concepts; keep informed of professional standards and firm policies (e.g., the guidance in our EY FAAS Policy Manual); and effectively apply this knowledge to moderately difficult and/or complex client situations.
Assist staff and interns in reaching their full potential by training and developing them and serving as a positive role model and mentor, willingly addressing questions, contributing constructively as a coach and providing timely on-the-job feedback.
Receive direction from the Manager, Senior Manager and Partner.

Qualifications

To qualify, candidates must have:
  • a bachelor's degree and approximately 2 years of related work experience; or a graduate degree and approximately 1-2 years of related work experience
  • an undergraduate or master's degree in accounting
  • experience working as an auditor for a public accounting firm and particular business/industry experience to meet special needs
  • CPA certification or be preparing to become licensed
  • strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service and technical writing skills
  • ability and comfort level in researching client inquires and emerging issues, including regulations, industry practices and new technologies
  • flexibility and willingness to travel on short notice, as necessary

Financial Analyst - Professional Services

Company Profile

Founded in 1997, Calypso Technology is a leading global application software provider for the capital markets industry, delivering an integrated suite of trading, risk and processing applications within many of the premier financial institutions including banks, asset managers, hedge funds, and other companies participating in the world’s financial markets.

Its innovative platform is the industry’s first integrated application suite with the ability to support the trading, risk management, and processing of various financial products such as Interest Rate, Credit, Foreign Exchange, Commodity and Equity and their derivatives.

With strategically based offices in global financial centers in San Francisco (headquarters), New York, London, Paris, Frankfurt, Copenhagen, Moscow, Johannesburg, Sydney, Tokyo, Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Mumbai and Chennai, our 500+ employees include some of the best talent from the capital markets and technology industries. Our global presence offers international exposure, experience and travel for many of our employment positions.

Calypso Technology's clients are industry innovators and leaders — from 8 of the world’s top 10 banks to regional and local banks, and the world’s largest asset managers, leading hedge funds, and insurance companies. With over 110+ customers and 18,000+ users around the world, we are extremely proud of the relationships we have developed. A partial list of our clients can be found here: www.calypso.com/customers/

With a world-class team of professionals who share a passion to succeed, Calypso places a high value on providing equal employment opportunities and maintaining a diverse workforce. We invite you to explore the Calypso website and discover how our organization can help you to navigate your journey in finding a rewarding career and achieving your own personal and professional goals.

Job Description

Calypso seeks a Financial Analyst at its San Francisco headquarters to facilitate the tactical and strategic operations of the Professional Services business. We are seeking a hands-on individual with relevant experience in a professional services business for a software company. The position reports directly to the Financial Planning & Reporting Manager located in San Francisco and interfaces with the Professional Services organization on a world-wide basis and the Finance & Accounting team. In addition, the position will have exposure to the Chief Financial Officer and senior members of the Professional Services Team.

Responsibilities:

  • Professional Services Analysis: Support Professional Services managers in the field for project and cost tracking, including project profitability analysis, fixed price project analysis and utilization reporting.
  • Forecasting: Assist Professional Services Managers in the field with bottoms up revenue forecasting and capacity model planning. Work jointly with Professional Services Operations and Revenue Accounting teams to develop financial plans.
  • Monthly Close: Support timely and efficient monthly close, including management of timesheet compliance for invoicing, assistance with resolution of client invoicing issues, review of billable expenses, and review of subcontractor costs.
  • Professional Services Ops Administration: Support the administration of project set-up, timesheets and invoicing for all time and materials as well as fixed price engagements, and expense reimbursements. Manage billing and collection issues with the professional services teams in the field. Oversee subcontractor administration. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures.
  • Systems: Oversee tracking of customers and contracts in internally developed CRM system, Sharepoint, NetSuite OpenAir and Oracle Financials.

Skills & Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration, with at least 2-4 years relevant experience.
  • Experience in a professional services business strongly preferred.
  • Advanced Excel skills absolutely necessary. Strong analytical skills essential.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills with ability to effectively gather and convey information via e-mail or phone with people located in other non-local offices and in different time zones.
  • Experience with NetSuite OpenAir and Oracle Financials preferred.
  • Ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, deadline oriented, fast-learner, who is an organized, dedicated, flexible, hands-on team player with excellent problem-solving skills. “Roll-up-the sleeves” approach required. Comfortable in unstructured, dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Benefits

Calypso offers career development opportunities, a competitive compensation package, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Calypso Technology is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.

fields.description:
Position Summary

 

The VP of Business Development for Financial Services will report to Ripple Labs’ EVP of Business Development and will lead and supervise Ripple Labs’ sales and business development efforts in the Financial Services category. This is a global position. It’s an exciting growth opportunity for candidates with an entrepreneurial mindset who can build and lead a sales and business development team while also possessing mastery of the sales cycle, cost, regulation and compliance considerations for emerging fintech, banks, forex trading, financial institutions, and their channel distributors worldwide. The role is based in our San Francisco, CA office.

The VP of Business Development for Financial Service will be responsible for managing all FI acquisition activities from sale to operation. Currently, Ripple Labs promotes the adoption of the Ripple protocol across the Internet economy to banks and financial institutions, merchants, forex traders, and application developers. The VP will begin to build a global sales team immediately and add staff through the 2nd half of 2013 and into 2014. Competitive compensation.

 

Responsibilities


First 90 days:

  • Identify receptive financial institution channels
  • Set overall business development and sales strategy for FI acquiring in concert with EVP of Business Development and CEO;
  • Structure and hire sales team and business development team
  • Set targets for sales team and build incentive structure
  • Build CRM and reporting tools

Ongoing:

  • Pitch Ripple to potential partners
  • Coordinate learnings and needs with Marketing team to generate inbound funnels
  • Work with Design teams to develop marketing material and collateral
  • Coordinate sales tools and hiring needs to optimize for specific FI verticals
  • Analyze, track, and report on all sales and business development progress
  • Manage global operation within a budget

fields.description:
Title:  Information Security Engineer

Department:   Information Security

Location:  Sunnyvale, CA

Reports To:  Sr Manager, Information Security

FLSA Status:  Exempt

Company Overview:

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billiondollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.

Position Overview

The Ariba Information Security/Privacy organization at Ariba is responsible for the Information Privacy and Security policies, WebTrust audit (for the Principles of Security, Confidentiality, Processing Integrity, Availability), PCI DSS compliance (Ariba is a Level 1 Service Provider), and US Department of Commerce Safe Harbor compliance. The Information Privacy/Security department also runs the Vendor Oversight program, awareness training, penetration tests, supporting commercial for any Security/Privacy issues with deals, approving access to production systems, and handling Security Incidents.


The main focus of this position is to assure that existing and new data centers meet and maintain the security standards that Ariba needs to meet its compliance and contractual obligations.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Support Information Privacy/Security requirements for Ariba Data Centers in EU and US
  • Support audits of data centers and Ariba Hosted Operations
  • Contribute to the establishment of Privacy/Security standards in support of Hosted Operations and audits
  • Ability to work as a team member and as an individual contributor
  • Knowledge of EU Data Protection laws and EU Security standards

fields.description:
Staff Financial Analyst “Customer Care”

 

The Staff Financial Analyst is responsible for analyzing, forecasting and budgeting revenue, margin, and operating expenses for the “Customer Care” organization. The Staff Financial Analyst supports management on strategic and operations planning, performance monitoring and variance analysis.  He/She assists in financial evaluation of business opportunities and prepares analysis to determine past, present and future financial performance.

 

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Analyze financial information and fulfill all duties required to effectively monitor and forecast revenue, margin, and operating expenses for the company;
  • Analyze financial data, defining relevant information and interpreting the results for the purpose of determining past financial performance and potential risks and opportunities for the future;
  • Coordinate regular business reviews for the supported functional areas, presenting financial overviews and communicating success areas and areas for improvement;
  • Assist in the preparation of yearly budget and quarterly forecast development for the supported functional areas;
  • Develop various financial reports for forecasting, trending, budgeting and results analysis;
  • Gather data from financial systems for analysis (Hyperion, SAP/ERP, SAP/BW, etc.);
  •  Provide analytical support to other departments on an on-going basis. This includes analysis of current trends as well as what-if scenarios. The Staff Financial Analyst is expected to be proactive in preparing analysis and using it to drive changes in the business as supported by his/her manager;
  • Produce ad hoc analysis and reports as required;
fields.title: Staff, Financial Analyst - Supporting the "Customer Care" organization

  • Communication skills that clearly present ideas, theories, and technical financial information to executives, operation, and managerial staff, both formal and informal
  • Extensive computer skills, particularly advanced level in Excel are a must.  Experience in SAP is preferred.
  • Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Must be proactive and able to work independently in a variety of financial activities.
  • Must be accurate, detailed oriented, professional, and timely in all aspects of job duties

 

Qualified external candidates may apply by submitting a resume to d.jobs@meditec.zeiss.com. PLEASE REFERENCE: R#1404JM in the subject line

fields.description:
Associate - Business Development & Strategic Initiatives

Location: United States-CA-Foster City
Organization: Visa Inc.
Job: Strategic Planning
Job Number :132807

Description

Visa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks.

Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visas innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the worlds major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies.

Behind the Visa brand are our talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

Position Summary

The Associate will be a part of the Business Development and Strategic Initiatives team. The team reports directly into the Group President, Strategy and is responsible for mission critical global strategy projects.

The Associate will have visibility into the key strategic issues of the business comprising the majority of Visas revenue and gain exposure to senior leaders across the company. Example projects and responsibilities include developing a new merchant go-to-market strategy, regulatory response strategy, new product/platform strategy, and support of top client negotiations.

The team is comprised of individuals with experience at top tier consulting and banking firms who have made the transition to industry and continue to place a high premium on team work and critical thinking. The position will be based at Visas headquarters in Foster City, California (30 minutes south of San Francisco. Visa offers convenient complimentary shuttle service from several locations in the Bay Area).

Job Scope

Specific responsibilities include:
-Lead or support analysis and strategic projects related to Visa Inc.'s business with a view across both mature and fast growing emerging markets
-Engage with client facing teams to collaborate on business strategy development and analysis to support the card issuer and merchant sales process, potential strategic alliances, and/or other key client facing initiatives
-Create, develop and manage executive level reporting to support C-Level decision making
-Develop strong cross-functional and cross-regional relationships across the business
-Team with the Corporate Strategy, Pricing, Interchange, Core Product, Emerging Product, and M&A groups on projects and for continuous training
-Example projects: Product Growth Strategy, Go-to-Market Strategy, Business Model Strategy, Regulatory Business Response
-Potential career path for this role includes moving into business (e.g. product, pricing) or senior roles in other strategy teams

Qualifications
-Bachelor's degree from top-tier institution or similar academic experience required
-Management consulting, investment banking or equivalent analyst experience (2+ years required)
-Superior analytical and problem solving skills along with willingness to learn the payments business
-Ability to work independently within a complex and often ambiguous environment
-Personal presence and ability to communicate clear, compelling messages in written and verbal communications
-Ability to prioritize across multiple projects and responsibilities, with proven ability to analytically evaluate business performance information and synthesize it logically
-Eagerness to work in teams at all levels and collaborate to accomplish project objectives
-Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to build credibility across all levels
-Payments industry experience a plus, but not required
-Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel
fields.title: Associate - Business Development & Strategic Initiatives Job

fields.description:
BCMS Corporate and its registered Broker Dealer, BCMS Capital Advisors, are a fast growing M&A Advisory firm focused on advising lower middle market private companies and entrepreneurs. We are seeking a full-time Associate to assist senior bankers on sell-side transactions. The hire will be expected to assume significant deal responsibility from Day One.

 

The successful candidate will have prior investment banking or Big Four accounting experience. BCMS is a highly entrepreneurial environment, so a dynamic, self-motivated person is essential for this role.

 

As an integral part of the deal team, the Associate will ensure timely delivery of key transaction deliverables, interface with clients and potential buyers / investors and drive transaction results. The Associate responsibilities include: conducting company due diligence, drafting marketing documents (information memorandums, teasers, management presentations, etc.), researching industry trends and data, financial modeling and analysis, and supporting senior deal team members with potential buyer meetings, deal negotiations, valuation, structuring, etc.

 

The candidate will need to possess exceptional financial modeling and writing skills, an understanding of financial statement analysis and accounting, as well as outstanding communication and client management skills.

fields.description:
Responsibilities:

The Director, M&A Consolidations & Purchase Accounting is a global role that is responsible for on-time and accurate monthly and quarterly financial reporting associated with the acquired entities of Oracle prior to integration.

This position will be leading a team of 2 direct reports and 4 staff level accountants to provide direction and mentoring with respect to ensuring timely monthly close of all acquired companies of Oracle. Work is deadline oriented, non-routine and very complex, requiring technical skills that are usually accumulated through professional experience in this capacity. Involves regular partnering with cross-functional teams to ensure that financial information reported is accurate and follows Oracle’s accounting policies and procedures.

M&A Consolidations

  • Oversee the process of consolidations as it relates to acquired companies on M&A Consol GL
  • Ensure acquired company submissions comply with Oracle policies and US GAAP for accounting and reporting
  • Oversee the process of creating general ledger structures for acquired companies
  • Oversee the process of GL account/department mapping of acquired company submissions
  • Oversee the recognition of tax integration step plan JEs for all entities on M&A Consol GL
  • Close the M&A Consol GL books on a monthly basis and ensure that all account reconciliations are performed
  • Work with cross-functional partners to resolve accounting issues pertaining to M&A activity
  • Ensure that SOX key controls in the area of M&A Consolidations are fully complied with

Purchase Accounting

  • Oversee the process of purchase accounting in accordance with ASC 805
  • Maintain accurate up to date detailed supporting documentation to be used in forms 10-Q and 10-K filings
  • Review and reconcile accounts for goodwill, intangible assets, deferred revenue haircut and intercompany
  • Review acquired company specific goodwill roll forwards
  • Review intangible assets roll forwards
  • Oversee the recognition of amortization JEs of intangible assets
  • Close the Purchase Accounting books on a monthly basis and ensure that all account reconciliations are performed
  • Manage the monthly goodwill adjustment process with the acquired company finance staff and Oracle finance as per US GAAP
  • Perform and document Opening Balance Sheet reviews for all acquired companies
  • Working with cross-functional partners to resolve accounting issues pertaining to M&A activity
  • Help on consolidating entities reported through M&A Consol GL
  • Ensure that SOX key controls in the purchase accounting area are fully complied with
  • Ensure that purchase accounting GL chart of accounts is properly updated to reflect new acquisitions
fields.title: Director, Acquisition Accounting (M&A Consolidations & Purchase Accounting)
fields.skills:
Personal Skills and Qualifications:

  • Hands on experience in a purchase accounting/operational accounting or technical accounting function at a large, multi-national organization
  • 10+ years of relevant and progressively responsible accounting experience
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills
  • Advanced skills in Excel
  • Must be well-organized for a fast paced environment, great at planning and prioritizing
  • Demonstrated strength in partnering and influencing others to achieve business objectives
  • Strong experience in using Oracle Financials R12 and or FAH
  • Great attitude and works well under very tight timelines
  • Excellent interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication
  • Experienced in managing direct reports
  • Exposure to the dynamics of a change management environment
  • Strong understanding of US GAAP and familiarity with the business combinations issues
  • Bachelors Degree Required
  • CPA Required 
  • Total commitment to accurate and on-time delivery of the financial statements which requires great work ethics, willingness and the ability to work overtime including some weekends

 

***All Qualifications are preferred****

 

Process:

Interested candidates may e-mail resumes directly to Oracle Corporation Recruiting for immediate consideration, brock.musgrave@oracle.com.  Prior to any consideration for this opportunity, Oracle requires that you complete the following 3-step process:

· Logon to https://irecruitment.oracle.com and create a user profile
· Keyword search IRC2309598
· Apply for the role by submitting resume

As part of Oracle's standard employment process, candidates will undergo a complete background check prior to an offer being extended. These background checks are conducted by a professional third party firm at no charge to the applicant and include: prior employment verification, education verification, social security trace, criminal background check and motor vehicles records (where required for position).

Oracle Supports Workforce Diversity

fields.description:
GSM Systems is looking for intelligent, positive, and adaptive hard workers to join our growing sales force. You crush your goals and you are proud of it.  For our salespeople, we offer an unparalleled opportunity to operate in a fast pace international sales environment where ambition is rewarded and we are all business builders.  If you have the confidence and hustle to open and close business from Venezuela to Vanuatu, we encourage you to apply.

 

Job Description:  As a Senior Sales Associate or Sales Executive you will help to provide our customers with wireless network hardware and repair solutions.  The primary responsibilities of a GSM Systems salesperson is to prospect, open, close, and grow sales with Wireless Network Operators such as Vodafone, Orange, and AT&T. These deals will range from $50K to $1M+ in size.  They will require CxO relationship building, coordinating equipment deliveries from global warehouses,technological expertise, mapping decision making processes and the ability to navigate complex organizational structures.  An exceptional hire can expect to make 150K-250K within their first 18 months.  We will fast track applicants falling within our “Preferred Qualifications” category.

The Opportunity: GSM Systems is a rapidly growing telecommunications supply chain and operations outsourcing company reaching from New York City to Jakarta.  All of our momentum, success, and expansion have been fueled by ambitious sales executives forging into uncharted territory to close the deal, open the operation, and overcome mountainous obstacles to build unwavering competitive advantages in our local markets.  We provide hundreds of thousands of wireless network systems around the world on a monthly basis; building wireless networks, and beating our competition.  We win by traveling far and wide to meet our customer, by being persistent in our approach as a team, and relentlessly focusing on meeting our objectives no matter what.
fields.title: International Sales and Trading

The Challenges: As a sales person, one can only succeed if you are a quick learner and dynamic.  Our deals are not simple and our customer expectations are very high.  You have to be able to follow the transaction all the way from its opening, to its final destination each and every time.

Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Background in competitive team sports environment
  • Drive to succeed
  • Willing to travel

Preferred Qualifications

  • 3-5 Years relevant experience in IT / Wireless Networking Hardware sales
  • Knowledge of and established relationships within the telecom industry
  • Knowledge of and established relationships within the relevant industry vertical
  • Knowledge of traditional as well as contemporary B2B sales tactics and strategy.
  • A deep understanding of the industry’s issues, a vision for its growth and a commitment to advance GSM Systems strategies within the marketplace
  • Fluency in Russian, French or Spanish

fields.description:
An exciting opportunity for a Financial Analyst exists at University HealthCare Alliance’s Hayward site.  UHA is a new medical foundation affiliated with Stanford Hospital & Clinics.

 

Under the direction of the Decision Support Manager, responsibilities include development and production of all operational analysis and financial reporting for UHA. Reporting and analysis include proformas, payer reimbursement analysis, creation and standardization of performance dashboards, and reporting of monthly divisional statistics and projections. The successful candidate will work closely with operations, physicians and UHA leadership (specifically Finance, Reimbursement and Physician Compensation teams).

 

The Financial Analyst is also responsible for providing support to the Decision Support Manager in the coordination of the operating and capital budgets processes.  Key responsibilities include the preparation and distribution of annual budgets and payroll data.

 

This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Master’s preferred), 3+ years of experience successfully applying technical skills in the areas of accounting and financial analysis, preferably in an ambulatory healthcare organization.  Demonstrated experience with budgeting and financial systems, knowledge of statutory and regulatory requirements, MGMA accounting and analysis skills, including technical factors, standard methodologies and equipment, and strong problem-solving, written/verbal communication and computer skills (Excel, Access and preferably Lawson & Anodyne) are required.

 

Additional information available at http://universityhealthcarealliance.org.  Submit resume and cover letter to: UHACareers@UHAhealth.org, and include Financial Analyst in the subject line. Equal Opportunity Employer

fields.description:
SUMMARY ROLE DESCRIPTION:


The Sr. Financial Analyst will report to the VP of Finance and provide support to Brand Management for Business Planning and Analysis (BP&A): budgeting, strategic planning, financial forecasting, reporting and analysis of assigned brands. The Sr. Financial Analyst coordinates the analysis of brand margin and contribution drivers including revenue, price promotions, consumer incentives, cost of goods and tactical and marketing spending. This position will require building strong working relationships with brand managers, commercial managers and the accounting and finance team. This role will be responsible for analytical and decision support to the brand teams, especially in the areas of strategic and annual planning, forecasting, brand analysis, budget oversight, and brand reporting. In addition, this role will support and provide financial education by instilling a value creation mindset throughout the Brand Management teams to increase marketing effectiveness and efficiency.

OVERVIEW OF ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Financial Planning &  Analysis:

  • Compile, review, analyze and provide  recommendations on key Brand P&L components and drivers (e.g.,  depletions, shipments, billings, inventory days, distributor and retailer margins, pricing, gross margin,  advertising and promotion spend, brand contribution, market analysis, syndicated consumer data, SKU  profitability etc.)
  • Develop and manage pricing and financial models to support brand planning, maximize volume/profitability trade-offs and support short and long-term strategic brand goals.
  • Provide economic analysis and coordination for margin reviews, line extensions,  innovation projects and cost  savings initiatives/opportunities.
  • Build and maintain financial models and analysis to support profitable marketing investments for the brand.
  • Manage monthly brand reporting and related accounting close support.

Leadership, Collaboration and Influence:

  • Liaise with Brand Managers to ensure alignment between overall brand strategy and specific advertising and promotion activities as well as competitive threats to ensure that brand performance will be achieved.
  • Provide practical and consultative financial leadership to drive business decision making within the brands.
  • Collaborate with all departments and senior management on budget/forecast submissions, presentations and monthly financial performance reviews.
  • Provide information to management by assembling and summarizing data; preparing reports; presenting findings, analyses, and recommendations.
  • Enhance BP&A accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.

Process Efficiencies & Operational Leverage:

  • Integrate company strategic initiatives and competitive intelligence into brand planning and brand management.
  • Review and approve proposed price changes to FOBs.
  • Analyze and review brand marketing and program spending, impact on financial and strategic goal attainment and return on investment.
fields.title: Sr. Brand Financial Analyst (Brands)
fields.skills:
EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Education
  • BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or other related degree
  • MBA preferred
  • CPA or other financial designation a plus

EXPERIENCE:

  • At least 5 years in the development of financial and business plans and decision support analyses is required. 
  • Experience with a brand-focused company and exposure to the consumer products industry and customer trade spending is required.      
  • Experience in the beverage alcohol industry a plus.
  • Knowledge/Skills
  • Intermediate to expert level proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint.
  • Advanced PC based financial and data modeling expertise is required.
  • Previous experience in designing and executing reports in an enterprise resource planning environment (SAP preferred) and within data warehouses(BO, Essbase, etc.).
  • Experience using syndicated data (such as Nielsen or NABCA) to conduct research and data analysis to resolve complex issues is a plus.
  • Previous experience in competitive and pricing analysis is highly desired.
  • Ability to build and sustain good interdepartmental relationships, liaison with suppliers and international key stakeholders.
  • Thorough knowledge of accounting and finance regulations, policies and procedures.
  • Ability to formulate, initiate and administer policies and procedures for effective fiscal control and business optimization.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven leadership skills with demonstrated experience in leading and driving change across the organization as well as working effectively with senior management.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Available to work extended hours to meet critical deadlines as needed.
  • Review and analyze paper and on-line reports, data and other information.
  • Utilize on-line systems and tools.
  • Communicate effectively with others.

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

With your analytics and financial savvy, you'll liaise between the Finance team with the functional areas it supports. You resolve issues related to forecasting, planning, resource prioritization and business profitability, and you help translate analyses into easy-to-understand presentations.

The Acquisitions Sales Finance team closely partners with Google’s SMB (Small to Medium Business) customer acquisitions teams to grow Google. We provide the insightful analyses and visibility into business performance needed to make the right business decisions. We also define and measure incentive plan performance, conduct annual planning, and ensure optimal resource allocation while continuously improving our finance processes.


Responsibilities
  • Build and iterate the next generation of reporting to manage the business and enable deep insights.
  • Drive business improvement with deep analyses, creative insights, and persuasive communications to an executive audience.
  • Create an environment of continuous improvement. Institutionalize business learning through regular reviews. Automate and streamline processes to reduce manual work, and increase efficiency and accuracy.
  • Lead and influence cross-functional working teams.
  • Build Total Economic Value calculation and process. 



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree with evidence of quantitative coursework such as engineering, computer science, mathematics, economics, or finance or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of relevant experience.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Master’s degree.
  • Superior problem solving and analysis skills, combined with impeccable business judgment and ability to communicate with management team.
  • Excellent analytical and modeling skills, FP&A and/or project management experience.
  • Extensive knowledge of spreadsheet software. SQL or other coding experience.
  • Demonstrated good leadership, cross-functional communication and interpersonal skills.


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
