Manager of Ad Marketplace Integration
Brisbane, CA (SF Bay Area)


Glam Media is a leading vertical social media company with the largest online global reach in lifestyle. We were founded in 2004 with a simple, yet powerful idea—that people are the most influential filters for discovering and sharing each other’s most passionate interests. Our mission is to help people create, discover and share content that they love. Since then, we have built an online ecosystem that brings together consumers, content creators and brand advertisers around shared interests that drive some of the most powerful connections between people—online and beyond. 
We’ve recently been ranked among the top 10 of the Wall Street Journal’s annual ranking of the top 50 U.S. venture-backed companies. Today, Glam Media is #1 in Lifestyle globally and a Top 10 Media Property—reaching more than 284 million global monthly unique users, as measured by comScore (June ’13), and have served over 60 billion premium brand ads! Learn more at www.glammedia.com. 

What's great about the role:

  • A strong candidate will understand the existing and potential flow of advertising demand into Glam’s platform.
  • Work closely with the VP of Ad Products, Director of Ad Marketplace Products, external client teams, internal teams and external trading desks to effectively grow Glam’s programmatic revenue.
  • Responsible for sourcing, evaluating, closing, integrating, training and managing new buying partners on Glam’s programmatic platform. Partners could include demand side platforms, ad networks, etc.
  • Lead our audience and premium programmatic sales efforts to agency and brand trading desks.
  • Define requirements from agencies and brands in programmatic buying and be able to evangelize and speak to those requirements.
  • Work closely with the product, marketing and publisher development teams as the voice of the programmatic buyer influencing product enhancements and inventory sourcing.

Whats great about you:

  • Established industry relationships with core demand-side technology platforms to facilitate integrations and partnerships.
  • 4+ years working in media sales and/or business development in the display advertising industry at an agency, publisher, network or relevant technology platform.
  • Extensive experience with one or more major demand-side technology platforms such as Rubicon, AdMeld, AppNexus, Turn, MediaMath, Invite Media, etc.
  • Deep knowledge of the programmatic buying and the digital media/ad network/monetization ecosystem within today’s digital media industry, as well as a general understanding of how the components of that ecosystem connect and transact business.
  • Deep understanding of how digital publishers manage supply.
  • Strong verbal and written skills with the ability to present results of complex analyses clearly and to interface with cross-functional teams at all levels of seniority.
  • Excellent partner communication and presentation skills and ability to quickly understand contracts with strong attention to detail.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills a must.
  • Self-starter, Self-driven; Good work attitude.
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and the desire to figure things out and define new processes.
  • Highly detail-oriented, task-focused and organized.
  • Ability to meet deadlines and turn projects around in a timely manner.

What we offer:

  • Awesome colleagues
  • Excellent benefits program
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Commuter benefits
  • Company-wide winter break week off
  • Fully stocked fridge and snacks
  • Pet insurance
  • Generous time off policy
  • Competitive equity package
  • Free onsite gym and a wellness room at HQ 

Glam Media is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California with offices in New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, Detroit, Tokyo, Munich, London, Paris, Toronto, Mumbai, Pune and Seoul. Join us to build the future of content publishing and social discovery!

 

Glam Media is an EOE.

fields.description:
Fulfilling complex transfer pricing requirements can be a daunting task for any multi-national organization. As experts in transfer pricing, Duff & Phelps provides an independent and uncompromised perspective on all aspects including compliance, planning, controversy and implementation. Our team of internationally recognized transfer pricing advisors provides the technical expertise and industry experience necessary to ensure understandable, implementable and supportable results.


Join our team and together we'll power the sound decisions that enhance value - yours and ours.


We are looking for Transfer Pricing Analysts to join our team in the Summer of 2014.

Responsibilities:

Transfer Pricing Services Analysts work on a variety of assignments, including planning, identifying, and documenting the arm’s length nature of intercompany transactions within a company’s global value chain, performing functional interviews with company management, industry and company research, litigation support, complex intellectual property valuations, transfer pricing planning studies, and financial modeling in support of transfer pricing analyses.

  • Undertaking in-depth company, industry, and market research
  • Relying upon accepted and relevant methodologies and theory, perform financial and statistical analysis for clients that include Fortune 500 companies, top ranked law firms, non-profits, and government organizations
  • Conducting interviews with our clients’ executive leadership teams to understand the company’s global value chain and where intercompany transactions occur
  • Designing and leveraging complex financial models for use on diverse projects, ranging from intercompany services analyses to intellectual property valuations
  • Performing economic analyses of intercompany transactions by using transfer pricing valuation methods such as comparable profits benchmarking, transactional analyses, intercompany services analyses and profit splits
  • Contributing directly to the development of client reports and presentations, industry publications, budgets, and proposals

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to support our Global Sales Organization. You will be directly involved in the coordination of the various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks). Your role will include providing variance analysis of bookings, revenues, and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments.

We are looking for a Senior Financial Analyst to support our Global Sales Organization. You will be directly involved in the coordination of the various planning cycles (annual planning, quarterly forecasts and monthly outlooks). Your role will include providing variance analysis of bookings, revenues, and expenses, clearly explaining the business reasons for variances and adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments. You will be responsible for ensuring the accuracy of the company’s models and assisting with the worldwide consolidation process. Strict attention to detail and an ability to set and meet tight deadlines will be important for your success.

fields.description:
TITLE:  Accounting Operations Manager

DEPARTMENT: Accounting

REPORTS TO:  Controller

LOCATION: San Francisco

 

GENERAL DESCRIPTION:

Campari America is a wholly owned subsidiary of Davide Campari-Milano S.p.A. (Reuters CPRI.MI - Bloomberg CPR IM), together with its affiliates Gruppo Campari. At the heart of Campari America are two legends in the American spirits industry. The first, Skyy Spirits, was founded in San Francisco back in 1992 by the entrepreneur who invented iconic SKYY Vodka. The second is the world-famous Wild Turkey Distillery in Lawrenceburg, Kentucky, where they have been making the world’s finest whiskies since the 1800’s. Both companies were purchased by Davide Campari-Milano and together they form Campari America, which has built a portfolio unrivaled in its quality, innovation and style, making it a top choice among distributors, retailers and consumers.

 

Campari America manages Gruppo Campari’s portfolio in the US with such leading brands as SKYY® Vodka, SKYY Infusions®, Campari®, Wild Turkey® Straight Kentucky Bourbon, American Honey®, Russell’s Reserve®, Glen Grant® Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Cabo Wabo® Tequila, Espolón® Tequila, Ouzo 12®, X-Rated® Fusion Liqueur®, Frangelico®, Cynar®, Carolans Irish Cream®, Irish Mist® Liqueur, Sagatiba® Cachaça and Jean-Marc XO Vodka®.

 

Campari America is also the exclusive US distributor of Bowmore® Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Auchentoshan® Lowland Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Glen Garioch® Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky, Flor de Caña® Rum, Midori® Melon Liqueur, Hibiki® Whisky, Hakushu® Single Malt Whisky, and The Yamazaki® Single Malt Whisky. Campari America is headquartered in San Francisco, California. More information on the company can be found at www.campariamerica.com, www.facebook.com/campariamerica, Twitter: @CampariAmerica and www.camparigroup.com. Please enjoy Campari America brands responsibly and in moderation.

 

SUMMARY ROLE DESCRIPTION:

The Accounting Operations Manager will manage the overall accounting operations for Campari America by ensuring service levels, performance metrics and policies/procedures are met.  This role will be very visible and will be the key point person for the company to ensure payroll, procure to pay and order to cash processing is timely and accurate as well as the management of the monthly and fiscal year-end closing processes are met.

OVERVIEW OF ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES:

Leadership

  • Directs and manage the accounting function to include reporting, forecasting, invoicing and cash management, accounts payable/accounts receivable, payroll and taxes by leading and managing 7 employees.
  • Provide leadership and coaching to support strong customer service, a focus on problem solving and improved accounting operations.

Process Efficiencies

  • Responsible for the review and evaluation of accounting policies and procedures by implementing changes to improve overall accounting operations.
  • Directs the weekly and bi-weekly payroll processing for approximately 100 union and 150 non-union employees. Ensures that employee benefits are processed timely and accurately. Ensures compliance with federal and state regulations and Company policies and procedures.
  • Develops and manages service levels and performance metrics. Identifies, develops and implements processes to improve department performance including providing leadership in the design, development and implementation of supporting applications to drive continuous improvements in services delivered.

Accounting Operations

  • Manages high volume accounts payable processing and payment to ensure efficiencies with our suppliers.  Leverages electronic payment options with suppliers to increase DPO and reduce working capital. Direct the annual tax reporting of 1099-MISC for miscellaneous income in accordance with IRS regulations. Direct and ensure full compliance with Escheats laws in regards to both uncashed vendor checks and customer credits.
  • Directs the Accounts Receivable invoicing and collection process of approximately 3,000 invoices and $50 million in collections per month. Identifies collection risks and takes action to minimize past due invoices and reduce DSO and working capital. Ensures strong adherence to Company credit procedures. Employs sound judgment inside authority to release of customer’s orders due to the financial credit hold.
  • Monitors compliance with company policies and contributes to the development of operational policies and procedures.  Interacts with internal customers, by meeting regularly, responding to requests and explaining procedures.

People Management:

  • Develop the capabilities of the team to drive continuous improvement and efficiencies, creating capacity for a higher level of production and ability to meet growing business demands.
  • Set clear performance standards and manage results to those standards.  Address performance issues quickly and consistent with the Campari way of people management.
  • Identify developing talent and contribute to the building of strong finance and accounting talent for the future.  Provide coaching and mentoring to the team.

As part of the SEC Reporting/Technical Accounting group, the Senior Analyst will work under the direction and supervision of the SEC Reporting/Technical Accounting Senior Manager to assist in external reporting including Form 8-Ks, Form 10-K/10-Q. This position will interact with external auditors and work across many other Aruba functional groups, including GL, Revenue, FP&A, and finance teams globally. In addition, the Senior Analyst will be responsible for technical accounting research. 

 

The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor Degree in Accounting, strong working knowledge of accounting/US GAAP. The candidate must be detail oriented, have strong organization and communication skills, be a team player, and be very hands-on.

 

Responsibilities:

• Assist the team in preparation of SEC filings, including 8-K, 10-Q/10-K, XBRL and Proxy; prepare PBC schedules/reports for quarterly reviews/annual audits, and other projects.

• Assist the team in preparation of XBRL filing (Levels 1-4)

• Responsible for preparing Statement of Cashflows, EPS, and quarterly technical accounting memo

  • Maintains a rolling twelve month forecast based on actual financial results and modified budget assumptions

  • Reviews and monitors health plan shared savings programs to ensure we are maximizing revenue
  • Analyzes healthcare costs by creating reports that monitors trends in cost and utilization

fields.description:
About Piper Jaffray

Piper Jaffray is a leading, international middle-market investment bank serving the needs of middle market corporations, private equity groups, public entities and institutional investors. Headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, the firm has additional investment banking offices in New York, San Francisco, and London. Piper Jaffray investment banking specializes in a variety of financial transactions and focuses on the needs of growth companies in the healthcare industrials & clean technology and renewables, consumer, financial institutions, technology, media, telecommunications, and business services sectors. Piper Jaffray is one of the premier investment banks focused solely on the middle market.

We are currently looking to add an experienced analyst to our Industrials/Clean Tech team in Minneapolis.

Experienced Analyst:

Our Analysts work closely with senior bankers to make a real impact on our clients’ businesses through involvement in all facets of investment banking activities including equity and debt offerings, valuations, private placements, mergers and acquisitions, leveraged buyouts and strategic advisory work. On a day-to-day basis our analysts:

  • Create financial models
  • Conduct financial valuations
  • Create and maintain industry-specific business development books
  • Conduct industry- and company-specific research
  • Interact with clients and senior bankers

Our environment is collaborative, demanding, fast-paced and entrepreneurial. Our clients are extraordinarily dynamic and our people have what it takes to excel.

Qualifications

We are looking for an Analyst with 1 – 2 years of Investment Banking experience with formal training.

Piper Jaffray seeks dedicated and motivated individuals possessing demonstrated academic achievement as well as leadership, organizational and teamwork skills. The ability to create innovative solutions, articulate complex ideas and adapt to a rapidly changing environment is essential. Analysts must be able to work well under pressure and manage multiple projects.

Analyst Career Path

Piper Jaffray is dedicated to supporting analysts as they complete their two-year commitment. Top performers may have the option of a third year. Direct promotions to associate level positions are also available.

Analysts interested in pursuing opportunities outside of the firm will have the opportunity to participate in a program designed to give information and networking contacts for opportunities in private equity, corporate development and business school.

Piper Jaffray is an equal opportunity employer.

Piper Jaffray is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

fields.description:
Title: Account Executive

Department:  Ariba North America Sales

Location:  Sunnyvale, Southern California, Colorado, Utah

Reports To: VP of Sales North America

 

Company Overview

Come join the brightest, most dedicated, most energetic engineers, marketers, project managers, sales, service, and finance professionals in the Bay Area!

Ariba, an SAP company, is the global leader in business commerce networks, supporting more than $450 billion dollars in yearly trade between over 1 million connected companies.  Ariba is transforming the way the world conducts business and is poised for strong continued growth with its innovation around the commerce graph. Every day, we help companies big and small collaborate with trading partners to manage spend, cut costs, reduce risk, and grow revenue. This collaboration is enabled through the Ariba Network, a cloud-based community where companies find buying, selling, and managing cash to be as easy as using Amazon, eBay, and PayPal; Ariba Exchange, a free online place where business commerce professionals network and share information and best practices, just like friends on Facebook; and the Networked Economy Blog, where we share best practices and thought leadership on procurement and financial management topics with companies across the globe.

Ariba provides professionals the opportunity to solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based problems. We offer:

  • Work with some of the brightest engineers in the Bay Area
  • Solve some of the world’s most challenging large-scale, cloud-based issues
  • 20 PTO DAYS + Winter break between Christmas and New Year’s Day ~ Paid!
  • 10 holidays
  • Mon.-Thurs. free lunch and Friday beer & wine bash
  • Flexible work schedule and telecommuting opportunities
  • Choice of medical plans, 401(k), etc.

We are growing and looking for talented people to help.

 

Position Overview:

The Ariba Sales team focuses on selling Ariba’s Spend Management software, solutions and related services to prospective and existing Fortune 1000 large and midsize enterprise customers.

-        Leadership role in analysis, design & implementation of the Sourcing product

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Interact with the current sales organization and all other Ariba Colleagues in pursuit of overall customer satisfaction.
  • Assume full responsibility of quota attainment as agreed to and communicated by the Sales Director
  • Participation and involvement in applicable industry conferences both internal and external

 

 

 

Preferred Qualifications

  • Past software sales experience in the following areas including Business Analytics, Sourcing, Reverse Auctions, Order Management/Procurement, Finance, Contracts and Supplier Performance strongly preferred
  • Exceptional presentation skills required
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skill required.
  • The Ability to build relationships and quickly develop trust with C-Level executives including CFO, CPO and CEO required.
  • Highly professional written and oral communication skills required.
  • Ability to work effectively in a sales team environment
  • The position will require at least 50% travel

fields.description:
Financial Analysts ensure that Google makes sound financial decisions. Our team of Financial Analysts foster the financial health of our organization by partnering closely with our various functions, tracking performance metrics and creating financial models. Our Financial Analysts are up to date with the latest economic trends and apply knowledge around rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements and investment performance to the projects at hand. As a Financial Analyst, you are called upon to build complex scenarios analyses that serve as the basis for recommendations that leaders of the business draw from to make critical strategic decisions. A master juggler working on multiple projects at a time, you maintain a consistently high level of attention to detail while finding creative ways to tackle financial challenges.

Patent litigation is an exciting and rapidly growing field at the intersection of law, technology and innovation. Google is battling a large number of patent threats directed at core products such as search, ads, cell phones, video and an array of others. Some of these disputes are high-stakes battles the outcome of which could impact not just Google, but the entire Internet ecosystem and its billions of users. A key component to defending against patent threats involves attacking the financial incentives for bringing these claims against Google, and in particular, the claimants’ damages theories. In the Patent Litigation Financial Analyst role, you will marshall the best evidence and analysis to support Google’s positions on such issues for our large and complex docket of patent litigation matters. In addition, this role will contribute to issues relating to varied and interesting tasks that include patent-related licensing, dispute resolution (pre-litigation and litigation), acquisition, deals and policy work. You will work with Google’s financial and accounting teams, engineers, product developers, executives and other legal team members, and will be responsible for working closely with outside counsel and outside experts. Our Patent team is an invigorating, inspiring team of innovators and attorneys who are passionate about future technologies and excited about resolving their ensuing legal challenges. As a member of this team, you will have the unique opportunity to develop and implement Google's strategy to protect, defend and capture the value of its patents.

As a Financial Analyst in the Patent Litigation group, you will support the litigation attorneys in building the strongest case to rebut plaintiff’s (often outlandish) damages claims. You will work closely with Google accounting, finance, and engineering teams to ensure that we have the appropriate data to support our cases and our positions. This will involve marshalling relevant data and helping shape the appropriate analysis of the data such that we can best present our position to the courts and juries who ultimately decide our cases. You will also help assess new cases as they are filed against us. In addition, in this role you will assist our team in gathering data on cases and maintaining our database of case tracking information, maintaining our document repositories, analyzing historical case data and providing summary information, preparing presentation materials for case management and assisting with a variety of other tasks necessary for the efficient management of a large and growing docket of litigation matters. As a member of our team, you will enjoy a fast-paced and dynamic work environment with constantly evolving technologies and a goal of continual improvement.


Responsibilities
  • Work closely with Patent Litigators and other Legal groups to gather relevant financial information relating to our patent cases.
  • Work closely with outside counsel and outside economic experts to best shape our strategy in dealing with damages issues in our patent cases.
  • Develop and maintain financial expertise regarding Google broad array of products and services.
  • Help maintain historical case information and assist with analysis of such data and preparation of presentations for management.
  • Gather, organize and maintain document repositories of forms, exemplars and best practices for case management.



    • Minimum Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree degree in technical, financial or accounting fields or equivalent practical experience.


    • Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with litigation and/or patent law especially as it relates to damages issues
  • Strong experience working with spreadsheets, presentation software, scripting languages, and statistical analysis tools
  • Distinctive problem-solving and analytical skills, combined with strong grasp of technological issues
  • Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal and team skills and sense of humor


    • Area

    The name Google came from ""googol,"" a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.
fields.title: Financial Analyst, Patent Litigation

fields.description:
Workday is the leader in enterprise-class, software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions for managing global businesses. Our solutions combine the lower cost of ownership of SaaS with a modern approach to applications. Founded by PeopleSoft veterans Dave Duffield and Aneel Bhusri, Workday delivers Human Capital Management, Payroll, Financial Management and Worker Spend Management solutions for midsize and Fortune 500 companies.
Workday is looking for a versatile financial professional to join the team as Senior Financial Analyst for Professional Services. In this newly created position you will partner closely with leaders within the Professional Services organization to assist in finance-related matters including designing, implementing, and managing processes that support our business needs. Workday Professional Services encompasses a broad offering of revenue-generating value-added services that help customers maximize the benefits of Workday’s software applications within their organizations.
As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will join a small team as we build our capabilities and develop the processes to maximize business impact. We’re looking for someone who wants to make their mark on a growing team and develop business partnering skills, is a self-starter, a great communicator and who enjoys collaborating with people with a diverse set of talents, in a dynamic fast paced environment.
Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities
Responsibilities of the position will include:
  • Partnering with general managers within the Professional Services business to forecast revenue and expenses and to develop departmental budgets
  • Monitoring department performance and preparing management reports and analysis on a regular basis (e.g., budget vs. actual and fluctuation analysis)
  • Liaising with Corporate Accounting and Revenue Accounting to ensure correct accounting treatment of transactional activities, including revenue recognition and expense categorization
  • Preparing journal entries related to financial close activities (end-of period accruals, reclass entries, fixed asset accounting)
  • Leveraging the Workday Financials system to automate and scale current processes
  • Developing insights on business performance based on the interpretation of financial results
  • Proposing business process improvements to enhance financial visibility, control and planning effectiveness
The position will report to the Professional Service Finance Manager and also report indirectly to general managers within the Professional Services organization. In addition, the position will provide general and ad hoc support to Corporate FP&A to assist in effectively managing requests for information and analysis from senior management and on-going reporting requirements for the business overall.
Education and Experience
  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance
  • Minimum of 8 years related experience
  • Prior Professional Services Finance or Accounting experience strongly preferred
  • Software and/or internet industry experience highly desirable
  • High proficiency with MS Excel and Word
  • Experience using a large ERP system; systems implementation experience will be useful
Key Competencies
  • Ability to work independently, with general direction and guidance
  • Excellent analytical and financial modeling skills
  • Experience in the application of accounting principles to periodic financial reporting, planning and forecasting
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Strong organizational and communication skills
  • Ability to learn new concepts and technology quickly
  • Team player
  • Willingness and ability to adapt to the rapid business and organizational changes that accompany a high-growth environment
The Workday Experience is the combination of everything that′s unique about Workday: our culture, our core values, our company meetings, Cantina happy hours, our soccer team, our recognition programs, but most importantly it′s our people. It′s everything that makes us different from your average employer, and everything that makes Workday a great place to spend a workday. At Workday, we are committed to equal employment opportunity.

Workday does not accept resumes from headhunters, placement agencies or other suppliers that have not signed a formal agreement with us. Our supplier base is restricted to specified hiring needs. Therefore, any resume received from an unapproved supplier will be considered unsolicited, and Workday will not be obligated to pay a referral or placement fee.*
